topic: Judge In Italy Reportedly Extends Hotel Detention For Film Director Paul Haggis
content: BRINDISI, Italy (AP) â€” A judge in southern Italy on Wednesday ordered Academy Award-winning film director Paul Haggis to remain under detention at his hotel while Italian prosecutors continue to investigate a womanâ€™s allegations that he had sex with her over two days without her consent, Italian news reports said. After conducting a hearing that lasted several hours in the Brindisi courthouse, Judge Vilma Gilli issued the ruling that extends his detention for now in the hotel in the town of Ostuni, where he was supposed to participate in an arts festival this week, Corriere della Sera daily reported. Calls Wednesday evening to Villiâ€™s office went unanswered. The Ansa and LaPresse news agencies said Villi had concluded that while the 69-year-old Haggis, who lives in the United States, isnâ€™t a flight risk, there was the â€œdangerâ€ evidence could be compromised or that the alleged crime could be repeated. Haggisâ€™ lawyer, Michele Laforgia, said after the hearing that his client reiterated his total innocence and is in â€œhopeful expectationâ€ that he will be ultimately vindicated. â€œPaul Haggis answered all questions and explained what happened,â€ Laforgia told reporters outside the courthouse. â€œHe declared himself, as he had already done right after the detention, completely innocent, in the sense that the sex he had with this woman was totally consensual.â€ While the womanâ€™s allegations are investigated, the 69-year-old Canadian-born director, producer and screenwriter was initially ordered on Sunday to stay detained in his guest residence in a farmhouse in Ostuni, a popular tourist town in Puglia, the region forming the â€œheelâ€ of the Italian peninsula. Prosecutors have said he is under investigation for alleged aggravated sexual violence and aggravated personal injuries. Prosecutors have described the woman as young and foreign. State TV and other Italian media said she is a 30-year-old Englishwoman who had known Haggis before he came to Ostuni to participate in an arts festival that began this week. Haggis co-wrote, directed and produced â€œCrash,â€ which won the 2006 Academy Awards for best picture and best screenplay. He also wrote the screenplay for â€œMillion Dollar Baby,â€ another Oscar winner. He has had legal problems in recent years stemming from sexual misconduct accusations by four women in the United States.

topic: Stephen Colbert Spots Trump's Most 'Pathetic' Moment Yet
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Stephen Colbert spotted a revealing moment for Donald Trump â€• one the â€œLate Showâ€ host said proves just how â€œpatheticâ€ the former president truly is. In new audio played during Tuesdayâ€™s Jan. 6 committee hearings, Trump pressured Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to overturn the results of the 2020 election. â€œI only need 11,000 votes,â€ Trump said during the phone call after the election. â€œFellas, I need 11,000 votes, give me a break.â€ â€œThat is just pathetic,â€ Colbert said after airing the audio. â€œHeâ€™s literally begging them to invent votes for him. Itâ€™s like watching an old man try to mooch an extra pancake at the Dennyâ€™s.â€ See more in Colbertâ€™s Tuesday night monologue: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Trey Anastasio Fans Blown Away When 7-Year-Old Joins Him On Stage For 'Bug'
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Phish frontman Trey Anastasio received some unexpected help during a solo show in Michigan on Monday when he spotted a 7-year-old girl in the audience with a sign asking: â€œCan I sing Bug with u?â€ According to Relix, Anastasio asked the young fanâ€™s mother if she could do exactly that. Then, Jovi Crusen delivered an unforgettable rendition of the song from the 2000 Phish album â€œFarmhouse.â€ She had the audience cheering â€• and Anastasio grinning from ear to ear: â€œI wasnâ€™t nervous but I had to take a big breath just to keep the tears away,â€ Jovi told the JamBase website. â€œI like â€˜Bugâ€™ because I get to raise my voice and sometimes yell â€˜Bug!â€™ Itâ€™s fun to sing.â€ Hereâ€™s the original for comparison: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Werner Herzog Reading Terrible Jokes Is All You Really Need Today
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Filmmaker Werner Herzogâ€™s voice is often imitated â€• usually as part of a joke. So, â€œLate Showâ€ host Stephen Colbert one-upped all the imitators by getting Herzog himself to tell some jokes. Really, really bad ones. And itâ€™s true. Herzogâ€™s voice really does make everything sound better: Herzog stopped by â€œThe Late Showâ€ on Tuesday to talk about his first novel, The Twilight World, as well as how he feels about becoming known as a â€œcharacterâ€ just for being himself: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: 'Jimmy Kimmel' Host Sean Hayes Has X-Rated 'Theory' About Rudy Giuliani
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ guest host Sean Hayes tore into former New York Mayor and Donald Trump henchman Rudy Giuliani over Tuesdayâ€™s Jan. 6 House select committee revelations. Giuliani, who led Trumpâ€™s attempts to overturn the 2020 election and remain in power despite losing the presidential vote, apparently admitted he didnâ€™t have any facts to back his outlandish claims of widespread voter fraud. Arizona House Speaker Rusty Bowers said at the committee hearing Tuesday that Giuliani had told him before the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol: â€œWeâ€™ve got lots of theories, we just donâ€™t have the evidence.â€ Bowers said he and others who heard the candid comments â€œkind of laughed about it.â€ Hayes had a more explicit reaction. â€œSo as long as weâ€™re presenting theories without evidence, I have a theory about Rudy Giuliani that the reason he smokes cigars is because heâ€™s trying to break his habit of chewing on dildos,â€ he offered, quickly adding: â€œI donâ€™t have any evidence.â€ See more in his Tuesday night monologue as Kimmel is taking the summer off and letting Hayes and other guests take the mic: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Twitter Erupts With Comparisons After BeyonceÌ Releases â€˜Break My Soulâ€™ Shortly After Drakeâ€™s New House Album
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost BeyoncÃ© and Drake are switching things up, and the internet is buzzing. On Monday, BeyoncÃ© caused quite the stir when she dropped a new single, â€œBreak My Soul,â€ from her highly anticipated seventh studio album, â€œRenaissance,â€ shocking fans in the best way. The legendary artist, who set the industry standard for surprise album releases in the 2010s, stunned audiences with the tune, which is quite different from the songs the award-winning vocalist usually bellows out. With its heavy house influence, the summer-ready dance track embarks on a new musical direction for the queen of the Bey Hive. Amid praise for the track, Twitter users couldnâ€™t help but call out connections between BeyoncÃ©â€™s new song and Drakeâ€™s house music debut with his â€œHonestly, Nevermindâ€ album. Drakeâ€™s album dropped on Friday just days before BeyoncÃ©â€™s latest track. Fans jumped on the social platform with hilarious reactions over the pairâ€™s similar musical shifts as debates sizzled over whoâ€™s tunes are better. beyoncÃ© gave HOUSE drake gave ROOF BeyoncÃ© and Drake having a house off pic.twitter.com/SXPILA5Cnj Drake tried to give house and BeyoncÃ© said â€œmmm, sounds more like apartment, bb.â€ Some Twitter users praised BeyoncÃ© for capitalizing on of the genreâ€™s popular wave, similarly to what Drake did on his new album. BeyoncÃ© & Drake are smart for making house music. The world needs healing right now. There is a spiritual war happening and this will help people get through it. #beyonceisBACK Now that @beyonce just dropped her new single watch how folks give the new @Drake album another listen. Itâ€™s culture a shift house music ,soulful  house & dance ğŸ’ƒğŸ½ ğŸ•ºğŸ¾ is the wave now hate it or love. ğŸ™ŒğŸ¾ Whether you like all of it or not, BeyoncÃ© and Drake are tryna help us escape from this dark music era. Iâ€™m enjoying it. Other fans accused Drake of being privy to BeyoncÃ©â€™s house project release and releasing his work first to have the upper hand. â€œDrake said yâ€™all gonna catch up knowing BeyoncÃ© dropping an house albumâ€¦my son really a Scorpio,â€ another person wrote. after hearing the new beyoncÃ© iâ€™m convinced that someone in the industry tipped drake off on what she had coming & he rushed to drop â€œhonestly nevermindâ€ ğŸ˜­ drake said yâ€™all gonna catch up knowing BeyoncÃ© dropping an house albumâ€¦my son really a Scorpio The Drake emergency drop makes COMPLETE sense now tho. Cause if BeyoncÃ¨ doin a dance album too then i wouldve dropped my shit too. not drake had his ear to the wall when beyonce was in the studio Many fans sided with the â€œFalling Backâ€ artist, bashing the hypocrisy of people dissing Drakeâ€™s breakout into house music while glorifying BeyoncÃ© for similar sounds. Yâ€™all trashed drakes album but BeyoncÃ© put out the same music and now yâ€™all loving it huh?ğŸ‘€ You canâ€™t criticize Drake for having a House inspired album, but hype Beyonce for it lol. Theyâ€™re both reaching into an era of black music history that hasnâ€™t been touched in a while. Respect to both of them for trying to start a new vibe for our generation ğŸ«¡ Listen to BeyoncÃ©â€™s new single below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'X Factor' Star Tom Mann 'Broken' After FiancÃ©e Dies On Wedding Day
content: Reporter, HuffPost â€œX Factorâ€ star Tom Mann announced the death of his fiancÃ©e Danielle Hampson while mourning his sudden loss on Instagram Monday. Hampson, a PR executive and dancer who had worked with Take That and Little Mix, died on Saturday, Mann said. Her death occurred just hours before they were to be married. Hampson was 34, according to the BBC. The cause of death is unknown. â€œWhat was supposed to be the happiest day of our lives ended in irreversible heartbreak,â€ wrote Mann, whose boy band Stereo Kicks was on the British reality competition show in 2014. A post shared by Tom Mann (@tommanninsta) â€œI feel like I have cried an ocean. We never made it to the altar; or got to say our vows, or dance our first dance, but I know you know that you were my entire world and the best thing that has ever happened to me, Danielle,â€ wrote Mann. â€œI will wear this ring that I was always supposed to wear as a sign of my unconditional love to you.â€ Mann said that he would do his best to be a great parent to the coupleâ€™s child, Bowie. â€œI am completely broken trying to process this and I honestly donâ€™t know where to go from here, but I do know I need to use any strength I can muster for our little boy,â€ Mann wrote. â€œI will not be a mark on the parent that you had already become but I promise I will do my everything to raise Bowie just the way we always wanted. I promise you he will know how amazing his mummy was. I promise to make you so so proud.â€ A post shared by Tom Mann (@tommanninsta) The last few posts on Mannâ€™s Instagram account include photos of him, Hampson and Bowie enjoying life together. In a post from June 2021, Mann could be seen kissing Hampsonâ€™s belly and expressing excitement about starting a family. â€œDaddy bout to be a daddy ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘¦ baby boy Mann due Oct 2021,â€ he wrote at the time. A post shared by Tom Mann (@tommanninsta) Mann asked fans for privacy in his post on Monday. â€œMy darling Dani, the brightest light in any room, my world is nothing but darkness without you. I will miss you forever,â€ he wrote. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bill Cosby Sexually Abused Teenager In 1975, Civil Jury Rules
content: SANTA MONICA, Calif. (AP) â€” Jurors at a civil trial found Tuesday that Bill Cosby sexually abused a 16-year-old girl at the Playboy Mansion in 1975. The Los Angeles County jury delivered the verdict in favor of Judy Huth, who is now 64, and awarded her $500,000. Jurors found that Cosby intentionally caused harmful sexual contact with Huth, that he reasonably believed she was under 18, and that his conduct was driven by unnatural or abnormal sexual interest in a minor. The jurorsâ€™ decision is a major legal defeat for the 84-year-old entertainer once hailed as Americaâ€™s dad. It comes nearly a year after his Pennsylvania criminal conviction for sexual assault was thrown out and he was freed from prison. Huthâ€™s lawsuit was one of the last remaining legal claims against him after his insurer settled many others against his will. Cosby did not attend the trial or testify in person, but short clips from 2015 video deposition were played for jurors, in which he denied any sexual contact with Huth. He continues to deny the allegation through his attorney and publicist. Jurors had already reached conclusions on nearly every question on their verdict form, including whether Cosby abused Huth and whether she deserved damages, after two days of deliberations on Friday. But the jury foreperson could not serve further because of a personal commitment, and the panel had to start deliberating from scratch with an alternate juror on Monday. Cosbyâ€™s attorneys agreed that Cosby met Huth and her high school friend on a Southern California film set in April of 1975, then took them to the Playboy Mansion a few days later. Huthâ€™s friend Donna Samuelson, a key witness, took photos at the mansion of Huth and Cosby, which loomed large at the trial. Huth testified that in a bedroom adjacent to a game room where the three had been hanging out, Cosby attempted to put his hand down her pants, then exposed himself and forced her to perform a sex act. Huth filed her lawsuit in 2014, saying that her son turning 15 â€” the age she initially remembered being when she went to the mansion â€” and a wave of other women accusing Cosby of similar acts brought fresh trauma over what she had been through as a teenager. Huthâ€™s attorney Nathan Goldberg told the jury of nine women and three men during closing arguments Wednesday that â€œmy client deserves to have Mr. Cosby held accountable for what he did.â€ â€œEach of you knows in your heart that Mr. Cosby sexually assaulted Miss Huth,â€ Goldberg said. A majority of jurors apparently agreed, giving Huth a victory in a suit that took eight years and overcame many hurdles just to get to trial. During their testimony, Cosby attorney Jennifer Bonjean consistently challenged Huth and Samuelson over errors in detail in their stories, and a similarity in the accounts that the lawyer said represented coordination between the two women. This included the women saying in pre-trial depositions and police interviews that Samuelson had played Donkey Kong that day, a game not released until six years later. Bonjean made much of this, in what both sides came to call the â€œDonkey Kong defense.â€ Goldberg asked jurors to look past the small errors in detail that he said were inevitable in stories that were 45 years old, and focus on the major issues behind the allegations. He pointed out to jurors that Samuelson said â€œgames like Donkey Kongâ€ when she first mentioned it in her deposition. The Cosby lawyer began her closing arguments by saying, â€œItâ€™s on like Donkey Kong,â€ and finished by declaring, â€œgame over.â€ Huthâ€™s attorney reacted with outrage during his rebuttal. â€œThis is about justice!â€ he shouted, pounding on the podium. â€œWe donâ€™t need game over! We need justice!â€ The Associated Press does not normally name people who say they have been sexually abused, unless they come forward publicly, as Huth has. ___ AP Entertainment Writer Andrew Dalton contributed to this report.

topic: Kim Kardashian Responds To Claims She Damaged Marilyn Monroe's Dress
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Kim Kardashian has broken her silence on claims that she damaged Marilyn Monroeâ€™s vintage gown at last monthâ€™s Met Gala. Appearing on â€œTodayâ€ Tuesday, the reality TV icon dismissed media speculation that the dress had been stretched to the point of being â€œrippedâ€ and â€œtattered,â€ and was now missing some of its rhinestones. â€œI showed up to the red carpet in a robe and slippers and I put the dress on at the bottom of the carpet, went up the stairs,â€ Kardashian recalled. â€œI probably had it on for three minutes, four minutes, and then I changed right at the top of the stairs.â€ â€œThere were handlers in gloves that put it on me,â€ she added. Elsewhere in the interview, Kardashian said she held deep respect for Monroe, who died in 1962 at age 36, and understood â€œhow much this dress means to American history.â€ Weâ€™re catching up with @KimKardashian about her relationship with Pete Davidson, wearing Marilyn Monroeâ€™s dress, her newest business project thatâ€™s been years in the making and more! pic.twitter.com/Chsz8cK5FW Monroe wore the shimmery gown â€• fitted with 2,500 rhinestones on sheer, nude-colored fabric â€• to President John F. Kennedyâ€™s 45th birthday celebration in 1962, where she crooned a sultry rendition of â€œHappy Birthday.â€ Kardashian has been hit with a barrage of criticism after borrowing the dress from its current owner, the Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not! museum, for the Met Gala, which she attended with boyfriend Pete Davidson. Among those to publicly disapprove of her wearing the dress was designer Bob Mackie, who sketched the original gown specifically for Monroe. â€œNobody else should be seen in that dress,â€ he told Entertainment Weekly. The backlash began to intensify last week, after questions about the state in which Kardashian returned the dress were raised by ChadMichael Morrisette, a visual artist who regularly helps handle and display costumes. Morrisette, a longtime Monroe fan, said he spotted what he believed to be new damage to the dress on a recent visit to Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not! in Los Angeles. He later shared before and after images to support his claim with the Marilyn Monroe Collection. A post shared by The Marilyn Monroe Collection (@marilynmonroecollection) â€œI know the dress very well, Iâ€™ve seen it many times,â€ he told HuffPost last week. â€œIâ€™ve photographed it many times, I have plenty of photographic evidence of whatâ€™s different now.â€ However, Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not! refuted Morrisetteâ€™s observations. Amanda Joiner, the museumâ€™s vice president of publishing and licensing, released a statement last week indicating she was with the dress during its transport from Orlando, Florida, where it was last displayed, and on the day of the gala. â€œFrom the bottom of the Met steps, where Kim got into the dress, to the top where it was returned, the dress was in the same condition it started in,â€ she said. â€œNo matter which side of the debate you are on, the historical importance of the dress has not been negated, but rather highlighted,â€ the statement continued. â€œA entirely new group of young people have now been introduced to the legacy of Marilyn Monroe.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Harry Styles Helps Concert Attendee Come Out As Gay: 'You Are A Free Man'
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Harry Styles offered a playfully profound gesture of LGBTQ visibility this weekend by helping a young Italian fan come out as gay. During his performance at Londonâ€™s Wembley Stadium on Sunday, the Grammy winner spotted the audience member who was carrying a sign that read: â€œFrom Ono to Wembley: Help me come out.â€ Styles, who has been an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ rights, was more than happy to oblige. Footage of the concert that appeared on social media shows the pop star picking up a rainbow flag from the front of the stage. â€œWhen this flag goes over the head, you are officially gay, my boy,â€ he tells the fan, as seen in the clip. After his band begins a drumroll, Styles teases raising the flag for a moment, and eventually hoists the banner into the air as the crowd roars. â€œCongratulations, you are a free man,â€ he proclaims. Harry helps a fan come out tonight at Wembley Stadium - June 19 ğŸ³ï¸â€ğŸŒˆ (via @calsmoodswings) #LoveOnTourWembley pic.twitter.com/or0BbRkg1K Styles released his third album, â€œHarryâ€™s House,â€ to great acclaim last month. Since then, heâ€™s continued to make waves with a number of heartwarming fan interactions while performing across Europe and the U.K. on his Love On Tour. Last week, the singer took a moment to acknowledge his â€œfirst ever school teacher,â€ Ann Vernon, whom he thought was in attendance at his show in Manchester, England. He returns to the concert stage Wednesday with a performance in Dublin. This fall, Styles is slated to appear in two new movies, â€œDonâ€™t Worry Darlingâ€ and â€œMy Policeman.â€ In the latter film, he plays a closeted gay cop who finds himself ensnared in a love triangle between a museum curator (David Dawson) and a teacher (Emma Corrin). Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

content: content

topic: Dave Chappelle Rejects His High Schoolâ€™s Offer To Name Theater After Him Amid Controversy
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Dave Chappelle announced that his alma mater, the Duke Ellington School of Arts, wonâ€™t carry his name on its theater. The comedy icon, who graduated from the Washington, D.C., public high school in 1991, shocked the audience at Mondayâ€™s ceremony dedicating the student theater when he made the announcement. The theater will instead be called the Theater for Artistic Freedom and Expression. Chappelle said during the ceremony that he declined the honor because he did not want his name to distract from studentsâ€™ work. The Duke Ellington School of the Arts decided to rename the theater after Chappelle last year and scheduled a fundraiser in November. But the school postponed the event after controversy escalated following Chappelleâ€™s Netflix special â€œThe Closer,â€ which included graphic jokes about transgender women and the LGBTQ community. Chappelle in November urged people in an Instagram post to donate to the school regardless of whether they agree with his name on the theater. A post shared by Dave Chappelle (@davechappelle) â€œThe Duke Ellington school is a glorious institution. Within those walls I found a context to explore my creativity seriously,â€ Chappelle wrote, adding: â€œMy only intent is to insure Duke Ellington the opportunity to train its artists unfettered.â€ The Netflix special sparked a storm of controversy over Chappelleâ€™s comments about the trans community. Duke Ellington students joined the outcry. Chappelle said Monday that criticism from students â€œsincerely hurt me.â€ â€œI took a lot of cold shots in business â€¦ but that day, they hurt me,â€ the stand-up icon told the bustling crowd at the ceremony. Chappelle said instead of outright rejecting the eponym, he would â€œdeferâ€ the renaming of his schoolâ€™s theater in order to emphasize â€œthe nuance of artâ€ as well as â€œmy right, my freedom of artistic expressionâ€ by renaming it the Theater of Artistic Freedom & Expression. After voicing his decision, which he said he made on Friday, the crowd erupted in applause and gave Chappelle a standing ovation. â€œNo matter what they say about â€˜The Closer,â€™ it is still (one of the) most-watched specials on Netflix,â€ Chappelle said. â€œThe more you say I canâ€™t say something, the more urgent it is for me to say it. It has nothing to do with what you are saying I canâ€™t say. It has everything to do with my freedom of artistic expression.â€ Philip Lewis contributed reporting. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Sandra Bullock Says She's 'So Burnt Out' From Work, Will Take A Break From Acting
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Sandra Bullock is ready for a break. â€œThe Lost Cityâ€ actor recently revealed in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter that sheâ€™s feeling â€œso burnt outâ€ and is ready to return to life with her two children, Louis and Laila. â€œI donâ€™t want to be beholden to anyoneâ€™s schedule other than my own,â€ Bullock told the outlet last week. â€œIâ€™m so burnt out. Iâ€™m so tired, and Iâ€™m so not capable of making healthy, smart decisions and I know it,â€ the actor said. Asked how long she planned to take a break, she replied, â€œI really donâ€™t know.â€ â€œWork has always been steady for me, and Iâ€™ve been so lucky,â€ Bullock added. â€œI realized it possibly was becoming my crutch.â€ But she remarked that it made her feel like she was â€œopening up a fridge all the time and looking for something that was never in the fridge.â€ â€œI said to myself, â€˜Stop looking for it here because it doesnâ€™t exist here. You already have it; establish it, find it and be OK not having work to validate you,â€™â€ she added. Bullock has been on a whirlwind press tour for her most recent movies but said that being in the public eye doesnâ€™t come naturally to her. â€œI shrivel up when it comes to press, when it comes to being in public and when it comes to doing a photo shoot,â€ Bullock says. â€œI just collapse. Iâ€™m not good at that, but what I love is working in tandem with people to create something.â€ The â€œBullet Trainâ€ actor has repeatedly spoken about her desire to step back from work and the spotlight for a bit. â€œI want to be at home,â€ Bullock told CBSâ€™s â€œSunday Morningâ€ back in March. â€œSo Iâ€™m not doing anyone any favors whoâ€™s investing in a project if Iâ€™m saying, â€˜I just want to be at home.â€™ Because I was always running, I was always running to the next thing. I just want to be present and responsible for one thing.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: The Chicks' Mid-Concert Cancellation Turns Into Something Bigger
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost The Chicks ended their concert prematurely in an Indianapolis suburb on Sunday and later canceled two other shows for what the group said were â€œdoctorâ€™s orders for vocal rest.â€ The country music band played for about 30 minutes at Noblesvilleâ€™s Ruoff Music Center in Indiana before departing the stage. â€œIndianapolis, we are so sorry we could not give you the show you deserved OR the show we wanted to give you,â€ the band, formerly the Dixie Chicks, wrote on Instagram. â€œWe will be back Indianapolis!! Hold onto your tickets.â€ Fans in attendance noted singer Natalie Maines appeared in vocal distress during the performance, Billboard reported. In a spectatorâ€™s video, the throat-clearing Maines told the crowd: â€œYou all will get tickets, I promise. I just canâ€™t â€¦ weâ€™ll try one more song. Waiting for this shot to kick in â€¦ not a shot of alcohol, a shot of steroids.â€ A post shared by The Chicks (@thechicks) A message on Instagram later confirmed that postponements would extend to future shows as well. The band â€” comprised of Maines, Martie Maguire and Emily Strayer â€” said Monday they â€œare forced to postponeâ€ some other Midwest dates on their tour, citing â€œdoctorâ€™s orders for vocal rest.â€ The post included rescheduled dates. A post shared by The Chicks (@thechicks) The Dixie Chicks won more than a dozen Grammy awards before they rebranded as The Chicks in 2020. The group dropped Dixie from its name because of the wordâ€™s association with the Confederacy and slavery. The trio released the single â€œMarch Marchâ€ at the time, encouraging civil rights protests after the police killing of George Floyd, an unarmed Black man. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: â€˜Stranger Thingsâ€™ Season 4, Volume 2 Trailer Is Out, And Plays With Fan Theory
content: Reporter, HuffPost The trailer for â€œStranger Thingsâ€ Season 4, Volume 2 is flaying fansâ€™ minds. Warning: spoilers for Season 4 of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ below. Netflix released a trailer on Tuesday for the final two episodes of the season for its sci-fi smash hit, and the next installment looks pretty bleak. But on the bright side, it also features an Upside Down guitar solo, a little love for poor Will and even more Kate Bush. The trailer also seems to play with a fan theory that someoneâ€™s going to die. Many believe itâ€™s going to be fan-favorite Steve (Joe Keery), thanks to Robin (Maya Hawke) telling him, â€œIt might not work out for us this time,â€ in the trailer. With that, plus the many screenshots of Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo) screaming, people are preparing themselves for the loss of the former shotgunning jerk turned lovable babysitter. But if being too liked on this show has proven to be a recipe for swift demise (R.I.P. Barb, Bob and Chrissy), then newcomer Eddie (Joseph Quinn) could also be the one to die. Or perhaps no one dies, and Erica (Priah Ferguson) could just obliterate the whole Upside Down with a side eye. We suppose weâ€™ll find out who â€” if anyone â€” will perish when the two last episodes drop on July 1. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sign Chris Evans Up To Play Human Torch In Another 'Fantastic Four' Movie
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Long before he was known as Americaâ€™s ass, a professional Lizzo flirter and famously not the toy version of Buzz Lightyear, Chris Evans flamed on as the Human Torch for two admittedly mediocre â€œFantastic Fourâ€ movies. For many fans, the 2005 film and its sequel, â€œFantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer,â€ starring Jessica Alba, Ioan Gruffudd, Michael Chiklis and Evans as the iconic superhero team, are best-forgotten artifacts of an age before Marvel found its groove. But Evans, who would, of course, go on to play a central role in the Marvel Cinematic Universe as Captain America, has decidedly fonder memories than the rest of us. â€œGod, wouldnâ€™t that be great?â€ Evans told MTV News when asked about playing Johnny Storm/Human Torch again. â€œWouldnâ€™t that be great? No, no oneâ€™s ever come to me about that. I mean, I donâ€™t exactly look the same anymore. That was 15, almost 20 years ago. Oh my God, Iâ€™m old. But I really love that character, but I think â€¦ arenâ€™t they doing something now with Fantastic Four?â€ Marvel is indeed developing an upcoming reboot of the â€œFantastic Four,â€ but has yet to announce any casting or production details. The studio is also on the hunt for a new director after Jon Watts, who helmed the recent â€œSpider-Manâ€ trilogy, exited the project in April. Surely itâ€™s a bit of a, well, stretch to imagine Evans suiting up again as Storm, but given the boundless storytelling potential of Marvelâ€™s newly established multiverse, stranger things have happened. After years of fan casting, John Krasinski made a cameo appearance as Reed Richards/Mister Fantastic in the recent â€œDoctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness,â€ but the studio has yet to announce whether the actor will continue with the role in future films. Evans, meanwhile, said that it would be an â€œeasier sellâ€ for him to play Storm again than Captain America. â€œCap is so precious to me. And you know, I almost donâ€™t wanna disrupt what a beautiful experience that was,â€ he continued. â€œBut Johnny Storm, I feel like he didnâ€™t really get his day. That was before Marvel really found its footing. So, I loved that role and, you know, who knows?â€ Despite its longstanding legacy in comic books, â€œFantastic Fourâ€ has a checkered history on the big screen. The 2015 reboot starring Kate Mara, Miles Teller, Jamie Bell and Michael B. Jordan was an undisputed flop, with director Josh Trank publicly disowning the film ahead of its release. But surely, if there was anybody who could ignite the franchise once again, itâ€™s Evans. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Amber Ruffin And El DeBarge's Slow Jam To Seditionists Is A Riot
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost The Jan. 6 Capitol riot was a sad note to U.S. history, but talk show host Amber Ruffin has managed to turn the trials of the seditionists into beautiful music. On Fridayâ€™s â€œThe Amber Ruffin Showâ€ on Peacock, Ruffin and sidekick Tarik Davis performed a sexy soul jam dedicated to punishments being meted out to the people who tried to overturn Donald Trumpâ€™s election defeat. They titled it â€œWhite Supremacists Facing Consequences Fills Me With Joy.â€ (â€œHahahahahaha! I ONLY do long titles!â€ Ruffin told HuffPost.) Ruffin begins her song by seductively singing: â€œIs it the way you looked/ When the judge said you were guilty?/ Is it the way you sweat/ When you realize they have your texts?â€ Davis then joins in: â€œIs it the way you smiled/ When you took a selfie at the Capitol building?/ Is it the way you frowned/ When that picture got you thrown in jail?â€ After a chorus that repeats â€œYour sadness fills me with joyâ€ to hilarious effect, Ruffin and Davis up the ante by bringing in â€™80s soul legend (and Ruffinâ€™s favorite artist) El DeBarge to boost the seditionist soul ballad into high gear: â€œIs it the way you thought/ You could get away with literal sedition?/Is it the way your friends/And family arenâ€™t on your side?â€ You can see the video below. But a warning: This is the first anti-insurrectionist song that may make you want to slow dance with your special someone. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Watch The Dancing Magician Simon Cowell Calls 'Fantastically Good And ... Bad'
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Jannick Holste rhapsodized about judge Heidi Klum and dancing in his pre-audition chat on â€œAmericaâ€™s Got Talent.â€ (Watch the video below.) But he failed to mention magic â€• the central part of his performance. In an â€œEarly Releaseâ€ clip posted by â€œAGTâ€ on Monday, the element of surprise boosted the buoyant Germanâ€™s illusion act. The 19-year-old made his backup dancers appear out of seemingly nowhere â€• to panelist Klumâ€™s song â€œChai Tea with Heidi.â€ Judge Howie Mandel was confused at first. Simon Cowell flashed a few of his signature smirks during the performance, but ultimately gave it a Simon-esque thumbs-up. â€œFantastically good and fantastically bad at the same time,â€ he said. â€œHorrendous, but it kinda worked.â€ Find out Holsteâ€™s fate right here: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Kimmel' Host Sean Hayes Takes NSFW Swipe At Tucker Carlson Over Biden Bike Fall
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ guest host Sean Hayes on Thursday teased President Joe Biden for falling off his bicycle, but saved his best zinger for Fox Newsâ€™ Tucker Carlson. (Watch the video below.) Hayes, the â€œWill and Graceâ€ alum, showed a clip of Bidenâ€™s accident Saturday near his beach home in Delaware and snarked: â€œYou know theyâ€™re just loving this at Fox News. Tucker Carlson has been going around the office dry-humping all the furniture.â€ Fast-forward to 3:50: Carlson, who has attempted to cast the president as feeble, did comment on the mishap Monday. â€œWeâ€™re not attacking Joe Biden for falling off his bike at a dead standstill,â€ the prime time cable TV star said. â€œHeâ€™s at the age where that can happen. He shouldnâ€™t be riding bikes. He also shouldnâ€™t be president.â€ Carlson then accused Bidenâ€™s staff of lying about his â€œphysical and mental state for years.â€ Fast-forward to 16:08: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Prince William Celebrates His Milestone Birthday With Help From The Royal Family
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Prince William celebrated his 40th birthday on Tuesday with well-wishes and photos from the British royal family. The Duke of Cambridge was born to Prince Charles and Princess Diana on June 21, 1982, at 9:03 p.m. at St Maryâ€™s Hospital in London. The Prince of Wales and Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, released a message for Williamâ€™s big day on Tuesday via their social media accounts, which included four photos of the father and son together. â€œWishing The Duke of Cambridge a very happy 40th birthday,â€ the message read, alongside birthday cake and balloon emojis. Wishing The Duke of Cambridge a very happy 40th birthday! ğŸ‚ğŸˆ pic.twitter.com/lV709IUivH The Royal Family social media accounts, which represent Queen Elizabeth and other members of the family, also released photos and a birthday note for William. â€³ğŸ¥³ Happy Birthday to The Duke of Cambridge!â€ the Royal Family Twitter account wrote on Tuesday, alongside a thread of facts about the heir to the throne. ğŸ¥³ Happy Birthday to The Duke of Cambridge!As the second in line to the throne turns 40, learn more about His Royal Highness ğŸ§µğŸ‘‡ pic.twitter.com/9WXk7kBiT9 The Duke of Cambridge expressed gratitude for the messages later in the day through a personal tweet of his own. â€œThank you for all the happy birthday messages today!â€ the prince wrote, signing off the tweet with â€œW.â€ Both the royal and his wife, Kate Middleton, use their first initials when sending personal tweets. Twitter users celebrated the future kingâ€™s birthday under the trending Twitter topic #PrinceWilliamAt40. Royal watchers were also on the lookout for a new photo of the prince, as members of the British royal family typically release a new portrait the day before their birthdays. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge released a new photo two days ago to mark Fatherâ€™s Day. The photo shows William grinning alongside his three children: George, Charlotte and Louis. A post shared by Duke and Duchess of Cambridge (@dukeandduchessofcambridge) The photo was taken during the familyâ€™s visit to Jordan last year. The foursome were pictured in the same outfits they wore in a photo released for their 2021 Christmas card. A post shared by Duke and Duchess of Cambridge (@dukeandduchessofcambridge) Subscribe to HuffPostâ€™s Watching the Royals newsletter for all things Windsor (and beyond). Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bradley Cooper Fumes Over Director Who Dissed His Oscar Nominations At A Party
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œMaestroâ€ star Bradley Cooper said he never forgets an insult â€• and one jogged his memory on a recent â€œSmartLessâ€ podcast. (Check it out below.) Co-host Will Arnett mentioned that Cooper now has nine Oscar nominations. That reminded the movie star of a nasty encounter he had with a director at a Hollywood party a few years ago. The director, Cooper recalled, asked him how many nominations he had. The â€œA Star Is Bornâ€ filmmaker had seven at the time and told him so. Cooper said the nameless director replied: â€œWhat world are we living in where you have seven nominations?â€ â€œI remember, â€˜I fucking hate this business,â€™â€ Cooper continued. â€œIâ€™ll never forget it. Iâ€™m looking at him and Iâ€™m like, â€˜Bro, why are you such an asshole? Go fuck yourself.â€™â€ Cooper has collected two other best-picture nominations since for co-producing â€œNightmare Alley,â€ which he starred in, and â€œJoker.â€ When he got his first nomination, for best actor in 2012â€™s â€œSilver Linings Playbook,â€ he remembered being at another party hosted by the same talent agency. He said he met a prominent actress who disdainfully referred to Cooperâ€™s honor as the â€œnom.â€ It got weirder. Fast-forward to 25:25: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost
