topic: BTS Break Sparks Debate On Activism, Military Exemptions
content: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) â€” The surprise announcement by BTS last week that they were taking a break to focus on membersâ€™ solo projects stunned their global fanbase, shaking their labelâ€™s stock price and leaving many questions about the K-pop supergroupâ€™s future. HYBE, the company behind the band, denied the group was taking a hiatus â€” a word used in a translation of the groupâ€™s emotional dinnertime video announcement. In the days since, band members have remained active on social media, continuing the stream of posts, photos and assurances that the band wasnâ€™t breaking up. Despite the immediate impacts â€” HYBEâ€™s stock initially dropped more than 25% and has yet to fully recover â€” several factors may still affect BTSâ€™ future. One is looming military enlistment for older BTS members, as well as how engaged the group and their devoted fans, known as ARMY, will continue to be in social issues. In 2020, at the height of BTSâ€™ success, the South Korean government revised the countryâ€™s military law that requires able-bodied South Korean men to perform approximately two years of military service. The revised law allows top K-pop stars â€” including Jin, the oldest member of BTS â€” to defer their military service until they turn 30 if theyâ€™ve received government medals for heightening the countryâ€™s cultural reputation and apply for the postponement. All BTS members meet the criteria as recipients of government medals in 2018. â€œObviously, thereâ€™s a looming military enlistment so they might have thought itâ€™d be good to do something individually before itâ€™s too late and thatâ€™s why I think military enlistment was the biggest factor,â€ said Lee Dong Yeun, a professor at Korea National University of Arts. There have been calls â€” including from South Koreaâ€™s former culture minister â€” for an exemption for BTS because of their contribution to heightening South Koreaâ€™s international reputation. But critics say that such an exemption would be bending the conscription rules to favor the privileged. Jin, 29, is expected to enlist this year unless he receives an exemption. Military enlistment of members has always been a headache for HYBE; BTS once accounted for 90% of the labelâ€™s profit. Currently, the group makes up 50%-60% of the labelâ€™s profit according to a report from eBest Investment & Securities. The eBest report noted that the rapid stock plunge might have resulted from an â€œanticipation that the activities as the whole group might be uncertain after being discharged from the military.â€ HYBE has been attempting to diversify its portfolio by debuting new K-pop bands, making online games, and rolling out Korean language tutorials. As the most successful K-pop band to date with hits like â€œDynamiteâ€ and â€œButter,â€ BTS has for years commanded tremendous attention on social media and with each new music release. They recently performed several sold-out shows in the United States, became the first K-pop act to get a Grammy Award nomination, released an anthology album, â€œProof,â€ and channeled their global influence with an address at the United Nations and a trip to the White House to campaign against hate crimes directed at Asians. â€œOnce you achieve success like BTS achieved success, then it means thereâ€™s a constant expectation to continue doing something that is connected to what youâ€™ve already done, where youâ€™ve already been. In the most recent releases that BTS has brought out, also we can see how they continually reflect back on where they have been,â€ said CedarBough Saeji, professor of Korean and East Asian Studies at Pusan National University. She said Tuesdayâ€™s announcement signaled the bandâ€™s intention to figure out â€œwhere they are going for themselves without interference from other peopleâ€ and â€œbeing able to choose their own path forward as artists.â€ Last weekâ€™s announcement also leaves in doubt the groupâ€™s social justice efforts, which have included vocal support for the Black Lives Matter movement and anti-violence campaigns. BTSâ€™ legions of fans have embraced the causes, matching a $1 million donation to Black Lives Matter after George Floydâ€™s death. But the group has faced mushrooming questions about why it isnâ€™t as vocal about discrimination in their own country. A leading South Korean newspaper recently published a column in which the author mused why South Korea, despite having BTS â€” â€œthe ambassador of anti-discrimination and human rightsâ€ â€” has struggled to enact an anti-discrimination law for 15 years. â€œItâ€™s an irony,â€ the writer said. â€œSouth Korea needs their force for good.â€ The countryâ€™s lack of an anti-discrimination law has led to unfair treatment against women and foreigners, among others. Jumin Lee, the author of the book â€œWhy Anti-Discrimination Law?â€ told the Associated Press that thereâ€™s a dire need for the anti-discrimination law in the country. â€œSouth Korea is in essentially the same situation legally as Americaâ€™s Jim Crow South. Equal protection exists as a constitutional concept, but there is no implementing legislation that allows the government to force private businesses to comply,â€ Lee said. â€œWhat that means in practice is that if Iâ€™m a business owner, I could post a sign on my door tomorrow that says â€˜no gaysâ€™ â€˜no blacksâ€™ or â€˜no old people,â€™ and absent extraordinary intervention by the Constitutional Court, thereâ€™s very little the law can do to stop me.â€ Lee recently expressed disappointment in the band for not speaking up about the important domestic issue. â€œBTS and their business folks know that speaking up in the US is profitable but doing the same back home would be more trouble than itâ€™s worth. So they donâ€™t,â€ tweeted Lee after the bandâ€™s visit to Washington. Despite that, Lee said the bandâ€™s silence is understandable, stating that BTS would be met with â€œindifference at best and hostility at worstâ€ from politicians if they did speak up. Some South Korean celebrities like singers Harisu and Ha:tfelt have been speaking out on touchy subjects such as the anti-discrimination law and feminism, despite backlashes. After speaking out about the 2014 sinking of the Sewol ferry, which killed 304 people in one of the countryâ€™s worst disasters, Cannes-winning actor Song Kang-ho and director Park Chan-wook were blacklisted by the administration of the ousted President Park Geun-hye, noted Areum Jeong, a scholar of Korean pop culture. â€œSo, although many idols might be politically conscious, they might choose not to discuss social issues,â€ Jeong said. Several BTS members said during last weekâ€™s announcement that they were struggling with the groupâ€™s successes and having trouble writing new songs. â€œFor me, it was like the group BTS was within my grasp until â€˜Onâ€™ and â€˜Dynamite,â€™ but after â€˜Butterâ€™ and â€˜Permission to Dance,â€™ I didnâ€™t know what kind of group we were anymore,â€ member RM said. â€œWhenever I write lyrics and songs, itâ€™s really important what kind of story and message I want to give out but it was like that was gone now.â€ While that clouds what BTSâ€™ next steps might be, Saeji said their continued candor was necessary because of how much the group has impacted their fanbase. â€œTheyâ€™re meeting the fans with that same honesty and saying to them, â€˜You had my help when I needed it. And now I need my help,â€™â€ she said. â€œâ€˜I need to be on my own. To think for myself, to know what I want to write a lyric about, to understand my own mind, to become inspired on my own.â€™â€

topic: John Oliver Calls Out Greedy Landlords In Report On Skyrocketing Rents
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost John Oliver on Sunday pointed out that housing is now â€œthe thing a 16-year-old TikTok millionaire can afford and you canâ€™t.â€ (Watch the video below.) On â€œLast Week Tonightâ€ the host took aim at skyrocketing rents and some of the greedy attitudes behind them. He noted that the average monthly rent was at an all-time high and that there wasnâ€™t a single county in the nation where a minimum wage worker can afford to rent a â€œmodest 2-bedroom home.â€ Landlords who blamed â€œmarket rateâ€ for raising rents didnâ€™t get a pass from Oliver. He showed a clip of Dave Ramsey, a personal finance personality, assuring a guilt-ridden landlord that raising rent to the market rate â€œdoesnâ€™t make me a bad Christian.â€ â€œI did not displace the person out of that house if they can no longer afford it. The marketplace did,â€ Ramsey said on â€œThe Ramsey Show.â€ â€œOf course kicking someone out of your house doesnâ€™t make you a bad Christian,â€ Oliver said. â€œItâ€™s in the Beatitudes: â€˜Blessed are the poor in spirit. For theirs is the kingdom of heaven. Fucked are the poor in money. For theirs is the kingdom of landlords. Wazzaaaaaaa!!â€™â€ Then there was footage of Bob Nicolls of Monarch Investment and Management Group gushing over the â€œunprecedented opportunityâ€ to â€œpress rents.â€ â€œWhere are people gonna go? They canâ€™t go anywhere,â€ he reasoned. Oliver accused the firm of treating people like paninis. See what he meant: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Kate Hudson Honors Kurt Russell For Father's Day And His Response Is Too Sweet
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Celebrity dads, theyâ€™re just like ours: communicating via social media the best they know how. On Sunday, Kate Hudson shared a sweet Fatherâ€™s Day tribute with her followers to Kurt Russell, her mother Goldie Hawnâ€™s longtime love. â€œFun, adventurous, passionate, determined, honest, devoted, amazing father and the best head of hair in Los Angeles,â€ she wrote alongside a throwback photo of her cuddling in bed with Russell. â€œLucky us! Love you Pa! Happy Fathers Day.â€ Hudson was raised by her mother and Russell, Hawnâ€™s partner for nearly 40 years, as the â€œAlmost Famousâ€ star is estranged from her biological father, musician Bill Hudson. Since Russell has no social media presence of his own, Hawn passed along her daughterâ€™s message, before publicly sharing his heartfelt response in the comments for all to see. A post shared by Comments By Celebs (@commentsbycelebs) â€œHoney I showed this to daddy. Hereâ€™s his messageâ€¦â€ Hawn wrote. â€œBirdie, mommy just showed me this picture, this is perfect Fatherâ€™s Day present. Iâ€™ve never seen it before. Wow..itâ€™s a killer,â€ Russell wrote. â€œLotta water under the bridgeâ€¦itâ€™s kinda hard to see it though cause all the water seems to somehow have found its way into my eyesâ€¦thanks for making me the luckiest father in the world sweetheart. I love you, Pa.â€ Hawn also posted a special shoutout to Russell on Instagram alongside a photo of the two stars sharing a kiss. â€œHow can I explain the gratitude and love I feel for the greatest father who has given us all so much in this life,â€ she captioned the photo. A post shared by Goldie Hawn (@goldiehawn) Hudson and her brother, actor Oliver Hudson, were born to Bill Hudson and Hawn during the coupleâ€™s marriage, which lasted from 1976 to 1982, but both consider Russell to be their father. Hawn and Russell share son, â€œThe Falcon and the Winter Soldierâ€ star Wyatt Russell, together. The â€œEscape from New Yorkâ€ actor is also father to son Boston from a previous marriage to Season Hubley. Throughout the years, Hudson has repeatedly gushed about Russellâ€™s pivotal role in her life, calling him a â€œgreat loyal protectorâ€ and â€œour dependable authentic captainâ€ in a Fatherâ€™s Day post last year. But the estrangement from her biological father still weighs heavily on the star. â€œI have a great family, I have a beautiful mother. I have a stepfather who stepped in and played a huge, huge part in sharing what it is to have a dependable father figure in our life,â€ she said in an episode of â€œSunday Today with Willie Geistâ€ last year. â€œBut it doesnâ€™t take away from the fact that we didnâ€™t know our dad,â€ she continued, describing the fracture as a â€œ41-year-old issueâ€ that lingers to this day. â€œPeople sometimes just need to hear that theyâ€™re not alone in that.â€ For Fatherâ€™s Day, Hudson shared an additional tribute to her partner Danny Fujikawa on Instagram, posting a video of him with their 3-year-old daughter Rani. Just like her parents, Hudson has a blended family of her own. She is also a mom to son Ryder, 18, whom she shares with ex-husband, musician Chris Robinson, and son Bingham, 10, from a previous relationship with Muse frontman Matt Bellamy. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: â€˜Lostâ€™ Star Matthew Fox Reveals Why He Retired From Acting
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost We have to go back ... to set. Perhaps the most tantalizing mystery â€œLostâ€ ever spun had nothing to do with hatches, polar bears or even smoke monsters, but what happened to star Matthew Fox. The actor went onto appear in a handful of films, including â€œWorld War Z,â€ and â€œExtinction,â€ before leaving Hollywood altogether after his presumed final onscreen role in the horror western â€œBone Tomahawk.â€ Ahead of his return to television in Peacockâ€™s upcoming apocalyptic series â€œLast Light,â€ Fox addressed the longstanding speculation about why he pressed pause on his acting career. â€œIâ€™ve just spent seven years living my life with my family and pursuing things that Iâ€™m passionate about,â€ the actor said about his self-imposed retirement from acting, per Variety. â€œBut storytelling is in my DNA in some way, and I felt like this form of storytelling was something that I wanted to reengage with, and see how it felt. And Iâ€™m really happy that I did so â€• itâ€™s been good.â€ Fox explained that he chose to walk away from the industry after checking off all the items on his bucket list, which included starring in a western film. â€œAfter I did [the movie] â€˜Bone Tomahawkâ€™ in 2014 that had kind of completed the bucket list,â€ he said. The 55-year-old star, who shares two children with his wife Margherita Ronchialso, said that he also chose to prioritize family time over movie roles. â€œAt that time in my life, our kids were at an age where I felt like I needed to really reengage,â€ he continued. â€œI had been focused on work for some time, and [my wife] Margherita had been running the family so beautifully, but I felt like it was time to be home, and I really felt like I was retiring from the business, and working on other creative elements that are really personal to me â€” some music and writing.â€ The opportunity to both star in and executive produce a project drew Fox back to his first television role since â€œLostâ€ ended over a decade ago. Based on the novel by Alex Scarrow of the same, â€œLast Lightâ€ is a five-episode drama series following â€œa family fighting to survive in a world that has been suddenly thrown into chaos,â€ as the worldâ€™s oil supply is abruptly cut off. The series also reunites Fox with director Dennie Gordon, who worked with the actor on â€œParty of Five,â€ which initially launched his career. â€œI kind of got to a point where I thought that maybe the bucket list included executive producing,â€ he said. â€œIâ€™d never done that before.â€ Since his days starring as Dr. Jack Shepard, Fox has faced a number of setbacks in his personal life, including a DUI arrest and allegations that he punched a female bus driver. He denied her claims and charges were never filed with the driver later withdrawing her lawsuit against him. But an incendiary tweet from Foxâ€™s â€œLostâ€ co-star Dominic Monaghan, who claimed that the actor â€œbeats womenâ€ only compounded the negative press surrounding him at the time. Fox later blasted Monaghanâ€™s allegations as a â€œpile of bullshit,â€ remarking in 2012 that itâ€™s â€œbeen a long, trying year of sitting on my hands on a lot of negative shit said about me.â€ â€œTheyâ€™re the furthest things from who I am,â€ he told Menâ€™s Fitness about the accusations. â€œIn the 46 years Iâ€™ve been breathing on this planet, I have never hit a woman before. Never have, never will.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Maybelle Blair, Who Helped Inspire 'A League Of Their Own,' Comes Out At 95
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost A baseball player who was one of many inspirations for â€œA League of Their Ownâ€ is speaking publicly about her sexuality for the first time. Maybelle Blair, 95, was among the members of the All-American Girls Professional Baseball League, a professional womenâ€™s baseball league which existed from 1943 to 1954. The California native pitched for the Peoria Redwings in 1948. The womenâ€™s league became immortalized by Hollywood in the 1992 film â€œA League of Their Own,â€ starring Geena Davis, Tom Hanks and Madonna. The movie is also the basis for a new Amazon Prime series of the same, created by Abbi Jacobson of â€œBroad Cityâ€ and Will Graham. Blair â€• also known as â€œAll The Way Mae,â€ like Madonnaâ€™s character in the original movie â€” came out as a lesbian while speaking after a screening of the new series at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York this week. â€œI think itâ€™s a great opportunity for these young girl ball players to come to realize that theyâ€™re not alone, and you donâ€™t have to hide,â€ Blair told the audience. â€œI hid for 75, 85 years and this is actually basically the first time Iâ€™ve ever come out.â€ After Mondayâ€™s screening, Amazon Prime shared footage of the emotional moment on the official â€œLeague of Their Ownâ€ Twitter and Instagram accounts. For the majority of her life, sports legend 95-year old @AAGPBL player, Maybelle Blair felt like she had to hide her authentic self. Today she came out publicly for the first time. We couldn't be happier for her, and continue to push for love and acceptance on and off the field. pic.twitter.com/BEaCisO2RH Like the 1992 movie, â€œA League of Their Ownâ€ takes place in 1943 and follows fictionalized members of the Rockford Peaches. According to press notes, the series diverges from the film by taking â€œa deeper look at race and sexuality, following the journey of a whole new ensemble of characters as they carve their own paths towards the field, both in the league and outside of it.â€ A teaser for the show released earlier this month hints at a flirtation between players Carson (played by Jacobson) and Greta (Dâ€™Arcy Carden). Appearing on â€œThe Drew Barrymore Showâ€ last year, Jacobson confirmed that sheâ€™d sought the blessing of Penny Marshall, who directed the movie and died in 2018, before committing to the series. She also vowed that the show will explore â€œthe realities of what was really going on in 1943â€ while evoking â€œthe spirit and the joyâ€ of the original. â€œA door opens for a lot of white women and white-passing women that get on the league that we all know from the film,â€ she said. â€œBut what about the Black women who were not allowed to try out and who had to sort of carve their own path to play baseball? Itâ€™s also a really queer story.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Lauren Graham, Peter Krause Announce Split After More Than 10 Years Together
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Actors Lauren Graham and Peter Krause have announced that they split up last year after more than a decade together. Grahamâ€™s rep confirmed the breakup to People.com, saying the â€œGilmore Girlsâ€ star and â€œSix Feet Underâ€ star â€œquietly ended their relationship last year.â€ The couple had a long history as friends before romance bloomed, having met while on the set of the NBC sitcom â€œCaroline in the Cityâ€ in 1995. But they didnâ€™t actually start dating until 2010, when they played brother and sister on the NBC series â€œParenthood.â€ Graham told reporters back in 2010 that the relationship was â€œso funâ€ and â€œso easy,â€ but said timing and shyness kept them from connecting when they met in the 1990s. â€œI think we liked each other [but] he asked me over to his house to play a board game â€• and thatâ€™s exactly what we ended up doing,â€ she said. â€œSo I was like, â€˜This guy doesnâ€™t like me. Who actually plays a board game?â€™ The timing wasnâ€™t right. I don t think either of us was ready.â€ The relationship may have been frayed by COVID-19 concerns, based on what Graham told Ellen DeGeneres back in April 2021. At the time, she was working on the Disney+ series â€œThe Mighty Ducks: Game Changers,â€ which was shot in Vancouver. â€œNormally thatâ€™s a two-hour flight and you come home on the weekends, but I couldnâ€™t do that. So we were separated for almost five months, which had never happened before,â€ she told the talk show host. When she did finally come home, Graham noticed â€œmore pilesâ€ around the house and that Krause and his son from a previous marriage had â€œreally bonded.â€ She said the bonding â€œwas fantastic,â€ but that it left her feeling like the odd man out. â€œLike, it was more that they were the married couple,â€ she said. You can see Graham discuss her relationship with Krause in this 2016 HuffPost Live interview below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Miles Teller Belts 'Great Balls Of Fire' In Previously Unseen 'Top Gun: Maverick' Clip
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Miles Teller is a supporting actor to Tom Cruise in most of â€œTop Gun: Maverick,â€ but heâ€™s the star of the show in a previously unseen extended scene from the popular movie. The clip, released Thursday, shows the full-length version of Teller performing the Jerry Lee Lewis classic â€œGreat Balls of Fire,â€ which was also heard in the 1986 original. Actors often use body doubles in scenes where their character plays a musical instrument, since not every actor has musical training. But Teller insisted on actually playing and singing the song himself for the scene. Teller said he told producers: â€œI played piano when I was younger. I still dabble a little bit. I donâ€™t need a double, I will play and sing this live,â€ according to CinemaBlend. But when he started to practice the song for the scene, he admits he wondered if heâ€™d bitten off more than he could chew, because â€œitâ€™s a pretty hard songâ€ and Lewis â€œsings pretty high.â€ Still, it was probably easier than the flight training he went through for his role as Rooster. Teller told Seth Meyers earlier this week that he broke out in hives during the shoot. He said doctors found â€œflame retardant, pesticides and jet fuelâ€ in his bloodstream. Later, when Teller informed Cruise that he had jet fuel literally coursing through his veins, the veteran actor didnâ€™t seem shocked. â€œYeah, I was born with it, kid,â€ Cruise told Teller, which Teller said â€œwas a very Tom momentâ€ for him. You can hear Teller sing â€• and play â€• â€œGreat Balls of Fireâ€ in the video below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

content: Reporter, HuffPost Woof â€” itâ€™s been a long week. If you feel like youâ€™ve been working like a dog, let us offer you the internet equivalent of a big pile of catnip: hilarious tweets about pets. We Shih Tzu not. Each week at HuffPost, we scour Twitter to find the funniest posts about our furballs being complete goofballs. Theyâ€™re sure to make you howl. topic: â€˜9-1-1: Lone Starâ€™ Actor Tyler Sanders Dead At 18
content: Reporter, HuffPost Tyler Sanders, a young actor who was most recently featured in the Fox series â€œ9-1-1: Lone Starâ€ and was just nominated for a major award, died Thursday, his representative confirmed to HuffPost. The cause of death is unclear and it is currently being investigated. He was 18. â€œTyler was a talented actor with a bright future. He comes from a wonderful family and we ask that you respect their privacy at this time,â€ his rep told HuffPost via email. TMZ was the first to report the news, adding that he died in his Los Angeles home. Sanders recently posted on Instagram about how much he enjoyed working on â€œ9-1-1: Lone Star.â€ A post shared by Tyler Sanders (@tylermsanders) And in February he seemed pretty excited about officially becoming an adult. A post shared by Tyler Sanders (@tylermsanders) Sanders has been featured in a few big shows, including â€œFear the Walking Deadâ€ and â€œThe Rookie.â€ He was also recently nominated for a Daytime Emmy for Outstanding Principal Performance in a Childrenâ€™s Program for his role as Leo in Amazonâ€™s series â€œJust Add Magic: Mystery City.â€ He also seemed to be dabbling in stand-up comedy. In a video posted to his official Facebook page, he joked about his love for Red Bull and made plenty of quips about his family. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Pete Davidson Asks Kim K If Audio Person Has Seen Her Vagina More Than Him
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Pete Davidson didnâ€™t appear onscreen for â€œThe Kardashiansâ€ all season, but he still provided raunchy laughs on Thursdayâ€™s last episode. In a post-credit scene shared by Us Weekly, Kim Kardashian introduced Davidson to her longtime sound person and noted: â€œShe knows everything about me. Sheâ€™s probably seen my vagina.â€ â€œMore than me?â€ the â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ alum said off-camera. â€œNot more than you,â€ Kardashian replied. â€œBut sheâ€™s probably seen it.â€ The audio tech said sheâ€™s never seen Kardashianâ€™s privates, prompting mock surprise from the reality star. â€œWeâ€™ll get there,â€ Kim K said. â€œTakes time to warm up to seeing my vagina. But you could look on the internet.â€ Davidson and the reality queen began dating after Kardashianâ€™s guest host gig on â€œSNLâ€ in October. She said recently she was lured in at first by Davidsonâ€™s â€œBDE.â€ General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Diary Of A Wimpy Kid' Actor Who Killed Mother Also Targeted Justin Trudeau: Court
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Canadian actor Ryan Grantham, who has appeared on â€œRiverdaleâ€ and the 2010 film version of â€œDiary of a Wimpy Kid,â€ pleaded guilty to killing his mother in March â€” but now comes word he also allegedly plotted to kill Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau as well. That revelation came during the sentencing hearing for the 24-year-old Grantham, who pleaded guilty to second-degree murder earlier this year. According to the CBC, Grantham shot 64-year-old Barbara Waite in the back of the head in March 2020 while she was playing the piano. During a hearing on Monday, the court heard how the actor rehearsed the killing beforehand and filmed a video afterwards where he confessed to the murder and showed his motherâ€™s corpse on camera. The day after the murder, officials said Grantham packed a car with guns, ammunition, 12 Molotov cocktails and camping supplies and hit the road with the intention of killing the prime minister. His reason for doing so wasnâ€™t made clear at the hearing. However, when he got to Hope, B.C., he turned around, drove to Vancouver police headquarters and told police, â€œI killed my mum,â€ according to Complex. Grantham also mentioned his plan to kill Trudeau in a statement to police and in an excerpt from his private journal that was read in court. Two psychiatric reports presented at the hearing showed that Grantham was suffering clinical depression in the months leading up to the murder and had experienced urges to commit violence and kill himself, escalating feelings of self-hatred and guilt over his mother possibly learning he had stopped attending classes at college, according to the CBC. The reports also said he had a cannabis use disorder. If convicted, Grantham faces an automatic life sentence, but Canadian prosecutors are asking for 17 to 18 years of parole ineligibility. In Canada, people convicted of second-degree murder are typically eligible for parole in anywhere from 10 to 25 years. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Ana De Armas Channels Iconic Marilyn Monroe Moments In First Trailer For 'Blonde'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Ana de Armas may not wear an actual dress of Marilyn Monroeâ€™s in â€œBlonde,â€ but she does a good job of filling her shoes. Thatâ€™s based on the first trailer for the upcoming Netflix biopic about the iconic sex symbol, released on Thursday. The â€œofficial teaserâ€ shows de Armas channeling some of Monroeâ€™s most famous moments, including her rendition of â€œDiamonds Are A Girlâ€™s Best Friendâ€ from â€œGentlemen Prefer Blondes.â€ However, de Armas is not seen singing â€œHappy Birthdayâ€ to John F. Kennedy. The filmâ€™s synopsis describes it as a bold reimagination of the life of â€œone of Hollywoodâ€™s most enduring icons,â€ from a volatile childhood as Norma Jeane Mortenson, through her rise to stardom and romantic entanglements. De Armas told Netflix Queue that director Andrew Dominik told her he wanted the world â€œto experience what it actually felt like to not only be Marilyn, but also Norma Jeane.â€ She added, â€œI found that to be the most daring, unapologetic, and feminist take on her story that I had ever seen.â€ The film is based on the Joyce Carol Oates novel of the same name. De Armas said she prepared for the role by studying â€œhundreds of photographs, videos, audio recordings, films â€” anything I could get my hands on.â€ Every scene in the film is inspired by an existing photograph, and de Armas said she and Dominik would pore over every detail in each photo and debate what was happening in it. â€œThe first question was always, â€˜What was Norma Jeane feeling here?â€™ We wanted to tell the human side of her story. Fame is what made Marilyn the most visible person in the world, but it also made Norma the most invisible.â€ The NC-17 film debuts on the streaming platform Sept. 23, and Dominik told Vulture that it has â€œsomething in it to offend everyone.â€ You can see the trailer below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Tom Hanks Doesnâ€™t Think He Could Star In Oscar-Winning â€˜Philadelphiaâ€™ Today
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Tom Hanks is reflecting on his role in the critically acclaimed film â€œPhiladelphia.â€ Hanks, who scored an Oscar after starring in the 1993 movie as Andrew Beckett, a gay man with AIDS, said that if the production were created today, a straight actor wouldnâ€™t be cast in that role. â€œRightly so,â€ he added. In an interview this week with The New York Timesâ€™ David Marchese to promote the new Elvis Presley biopic, Hanks looked back on his part in the groundbreaking film. He called both â€œPhiladelphiaâ€ and â€œForrest Gumpâ€ (1994) â€œtimely movies, at the time, that you might not be able to make now.â€ â€œPhiladelphiaâ€ was the first major studio film to face the AIDS crisis head-on. It portrays the struggles and eventual death of Hanksâ€™ character as he battles discrimination after contracting AIDS. Hanks agreed with Marchese that a heterosexual actor couldnâ€™t be cast in the nearly 30-year-old film anymore. â€œLetâ€™s address â€˜Could a straight man do what I did in â€˜Philadelphiaâ€™ now?â€™â€ Hanks said. â€œNo, and rightly so.â€ â€œThe whole point of Philadelphia was donâ€™t be afraid. One of the reasons people werenâ€™t afraid of that movie is that I was playing a gay man,â€ Hanks said. â€œWeâ€™re beyond that now, and I donâ€™t think people would accept the inauthenticity of a straight guy playing a gay guy,â€ he added. â€œItâ€™s not a crime, itâ€™s not boohoo, that someone would say we are going to demand more of a movie in the modern realm of authenticity.â€ Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Kelly Clarkson Responds to Britney Spearsâ€™ Criticism Of Her By Covering â€˜Womanizerâ€™
content: Reporter, HuffPost Kelly Clarkson seems to have nothing but love for Britney Spears. The former â€œAmerican Idolâ€ winner performed a cover of Spearsâ€™ 2008 single â€œWomanizerâ€ during the â€œKellyokeâ€ segment on her talk show Wednesday (see the video below). The cover â€” captioned â€œCelebrating Queen Britneyâ€ when â€œThe Kelly Clarkson Showâ€ tweeted a video of it Wednesday â€” appears to be a response to Spears criticizing Clarkson in a now-deleted caption on Instagram. Last week, Spears posted a video with a caption presumably targeting Clarkson for making insensitive comments about her mental state during a 2008 interview with an Atlanta radio show. â€œDonâ€™t you just wish she would say sheâ€™s kidding ???â€ Spears wrote in the caption, according to screenshots circulating on social media. â€œClarkson â€¦ in a world where bullying has been heartbreaking, Iâ€™ve had my share.â€ Spears publicly displayed a series of troubling behavior in 2007 and was placed under conservatorship in 2008. In the short clip from that year, Clarkson wonders out loud if her fellow pop starâ€™s strange behavior at the time is just a joke. â€œMan, but wouldnâ€™t it be funny if sheâ€™s just totally screwing with everyone?â€ Clarkson says in the clip. â€œCause itâ€™d be real funny if she were like, â€˜Just kidding!â€™ I mean, think about it.â€ Britney Spears CALLS OUT Kelly Clarkson for saying this about her in 2007 pic.twitter.com/z3ziK56Fzt Clarkson added: â€œSheâ€™s done no press for her album [Blackout], which I love by the way. Sheâ€™s done no press, just gets so much press off all this other stuff.â€ Although the quotes in the clip donâ€™t look particularly great for Clarkson, a full video of the conversation adds a bit more context. In the 2008 interview, the hosts of the radio show frequently call Spears â€œcrazyâ€ and make fun of her use of a mysterious British accent while speaking to paparazzi. Although Clarkson seems to be politely engaging in the conversation, she does appear to be trying to steer it in another direction. At one point, in which a host calls Spears â€œpure crazy,â€ Clarkson defends her. â€œI met her a couple of times, sheâ€™s actually really super cool to me,â€ Clarkson says. When the hosts play a clip of Spears talking in the fake British accent, Clarkson attempts to find an explanation for the behavior. â€œOK, so sometimes when I drink, I have accents,â€ she says. â€œIs she drinking?â€ â€œI donâ€™t know, but sheâ€™s on a lot of medication,â€ says one host. â€œBritneyâ€™s high on life,â€ another host says. â€œHey, well, donâ€™t knock it â€™til you try it,â€ Clarkson says. When a host asks Clarkson what kinds of accents she does when she drinks, she seems uncomfortable and replies: â€œI donâ€™t know, I was just trying to be nice.â€ As the hosts all laugh, Clarkson seems to take the opportunity to change the subject. â€œI get a thicker Texan accent,â€ Clarkson says. The conversation from there on out is all about how Clarkson sounds when sheâ€™s drunk and cursing around children. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Stephen Colbert Has A Message For The Proud Boy Who Name-Dropped Him In Court
content: Stephen Colbert has a message for the leader of the Proud Boys, the street gang indicted for their role in the Jan. 6, 2021 attack on the U.S. Capitol, who name-dropped him in court. During his monologue on Wednesday, â€œThe Late Showâ€ host said Joseph Biggs referenced â€œnegative press and media coverageâ€ â€• such as coverage by Colbert â€• in his request to move his trial away from Washington, D.C. Biggs is facing up to 20 years in prison for seditious conspiracy in connection with the Jan. 6 attack. Colbert, who jokingly became emotional, implied he was overwhelmed that a â€œviolent fascistâ€ made him feel seen despite his jokes. After referencing a Newsweek story on his showâ€™s name-drop in court, Colbert had a message for Biggs that he also wanted a potential jury pool to hear. â€œYou are going to jail you neo-numbnut, and if you donâ€™t like it, you can come and get me. My name is Joe Scarborough and I love coffee. Welcome to the monkey house, brother,â€ he said. Watch Colbertâ€™s full monologue below:

topic: Kim Kardashian Left Marilyn Monroe Dress In 'Heartbreaking' State, Expert Says
content: A costume display expert said Marilyn Monroeâ€™s iconic 1962 dress has been â€œcompletely alteredâ€ and lost its â€œmagic momentâ€ after Kim Kardashian wore it to the Met Gala in May. Kardashian and the dressâ€™s owner, Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not, have been under fire after recently surfaced pictures revealed alleged damage to the dress. Monroe wore the dress â€• fitted with 2,500 rhinestones on a nude-colored fabric â€• to President John F. Kennedyâ€™s 45th birthday celebration, where she famously sang a sultry rendition of â€œHappy Birthday.â€ ChadMichael Morrisette, a visual artist who regularly helps handle and display costumes, said he spotted the damage on a recent visit to Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not in Los Angeles. He later shared images of what he spotted with the Marilyn Monroe Collection. â€œI know the dress very well, Iâ€™ve seen it many times, Iâ€™ve photographed it many times, I have plenty of photographic evidence of whatâ€™s different now,â€ Morrisette, a Monroe fan, told HuffPost. A post shared by The Marilyn Monroe Collection (@marilynmonroecollection) The dress was designed to be skin-tight on Monroeâ€™s body, he said. The dressâ€™s patches and panels have been pulled to the point of being â€œbubbled, rippedâ€ and â€œtattered,â€ according to the expert. There are also a number of missing crystal beads, he said. He said heâ€™s curious why Met Gala co-chair Anna Wintour and others at the event allowed Kardashian to wear the dress, which he said is the most expensive dress in the world. HuffPost reached out to Kardashian, the Met Gala and Ripleyâ€™s for comment. Back in 2016, Morrisette said he curated an exhibition that put thousands of Monroeâ€™s personal items on display â€• including the dress â€• for Julienâ€™s Auctions. He said he staged and created â€œa museumâ€ for people to view the â€œSome Like It Hotâ€ actorâ€™s history in 2016. â€œI got to put this dress forth to the public and treat it respect and dignity and awe,â€ Morrisette said. Ripleyâ€™s bought the dress that night for $4.8 million. A number of internet users have weighed in on a video taken of Kardashian in the dress prior to the Met Gala and believe it to be evidence of an already â€œruinedâ€ dress, Buzzfeed News reported. Those worries donâ€™t hold up for Morrisette, however, who said Kardashian already tried on the dress in Calabasas prior to the video. â€œThat [damage] is because of her. She already tried to squeeze it up her body, and she decided to lose 16 poundsâ€ to wear it, he said. â€œAnd the fact that itâ€™s hanging on a wooden hanger [in the video] is outrageous. That is not how you treat a garment that has that weight, those crystals and that delicacy, itâ€™s unbelievable that itâ€™s not being laid flat.â€ Morrisette, in an Instagram post earlier this week, wrote that the dress is a â€œpieceâ€ of his life and described its current state as heartbreaking to him. A post shared by ChadMichaelChristianMorrisette (@1morrisette) Kardashian looked â€œstunningâ€ in the replica dress, he said, but heâ€™s unsure what she can do in response to the original dressâ€™s current state other than â€œtake accountability.â€ â€œBut it doesnâ€™t change the reality of what happened... that this dress is completely altered,â€ Morrisette said. â€œIt doesnâ€™t have that magic moment anymore.â€

topic: Brad Pitt Tells Gwyneth Paltrow, 'I Do Love You,' More Than 20 Years After Their Split
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Gwyneth Paltrow and Brad Pittâ€™s relationship may not have ended in marriage, but the two still share a deep mutual respect for each other. From 1994 to 1997, the Oscar winners and â€œSe7enâ€ co-stars were among Hollywoodâ€™s most-buzzed-about celebrity couples. In a recent Q&A-style interview for Paltrowâ€™s wellness and lifestyle site, Goop, the pair look back on their long-defunct romance and brief engagement with no regrets. At one point in the interview, Paltrow shares how her late father, Bruce Paltrow, felt as though he were â€œgaining a sonâ€ while she and Pitt were planning to wed â€œeven though we didnâ€™t get married.â€ Later, the â€œShakespeare in Loveâ€ actor notes she â€œfinally found the Brad I was supposed to marry,â€ referring to screenwriter and producer Brad Falchuk, whom she wed in 2018. â€œIt just took me 20 years,â€ she quips. As for Pitt, he tells Paltrow, â€œItâ€™s lovely to have you as a friend now,â€ adding, â€œAnd I do love you.â€ The â€œOnce Upon a Time in Hollywoodâ€ star also has fond memories of Bruce Paltrow, who died in 2002. â€œOne of the many things I loved about Bruce â€• because he did have a profound effect on me and is someone I still think about â€• was he really fostered your voice, your independence,â€ Pitt said. â€œThat man was funny. He was funny. And you guys were so funny together, ripping across the table, which was a rarity that I hadnâ€™t experienced much, and I loved it.â€ Paltrow and Pitt have each been married twice. From 2003 to 2016, Paltrow was married to Coldplay singer-songwriter Chris Martin, with whom she shares daughter Apple, 18, and son Moses, 16. Pitt was previously married to Jennifer Aniston from 2000 to 2005 and Angelina Jolie from 2014 to 2019. He and Jolie have six children: Maddox, 19; Pax, 17; Zahara, 16; Shiloh, 15; and twins Knox and Vivienne, 12. In a 2020 interview with Harperâ€™s Bazaar, Paltrow said she and Pitt were very much on â€œfriendlyâ€ terms. â€œI donâ€™t have any really bad blood,â€ she added. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jon Cryer Shares What Charlie Sheen Was Like Before Things Went â€˜Off The Railsâ€™
content: Reporter, HuffPost Before the tiger blood, Charlie Sheen seemed like a pretty cool cat. At least according to Jon Cryer. Cryer and Sheen co-starred on the incredibly successful CBS sitcom â€œTwo and a Half Menâ€ in the early 2000s before Sheen was fired from the show after a string of strange behavior and sparking a public feud with the seriesâ€™ creator, Chuck Lorre. Cryer told Entertainment Tonight in an interview published Monday that when the show started in 2003, Sheen was a â€œjoy.â€ â€œWe got along great, he had been sober for two years when we started the show, and it was really important to him to keep sober,â€ Cryer told the outlet. â€œAnd for those first few years, the show was also going so smoothly.â€ Cryer admitted that he was often â€œstruck by how great Charlie Sheen was at performing in front of an audience.â€ â€œHe just had it straight out of the box like it was genetically programmed into his body. That was fun and very self-assured,â€ he said. â€œFor those first couple of years, it was, you know, an incredible joy.â€ Sheenâ€™s charm paid off â€” literally. By the time he was fired from the show in 2011, he had become the highest-paid actor on TV, Forbes reported. Cryer told ET that Sheenâ€™s transformation from a charismatic star into full-fledged warlock didnâ€™t happen overnight. Cryer said that despite Sheen relapsing and splitting from his wife, â€œReal Housewives of Beverly Hillsâ€ star Denise Richards, in 2005, he â€œwas still lovely to work with,â€ knew all his lines and showed up to work on time. â€œBut you could tell that there was some trouble brewing,â€ Cryer said. Cryer described Sheen suddenly having issues with the showâ€™s writing, which Cryer said he couldnâ€™t quite understand. â€œI would say, â€˜This is the kind of joke you had no problem with a year and a half ago, and suddenly now itâ€™s an issue?â€™â€ Cryer recalled. â€œSo, you know, it was very subtle. It took a while before it started really going off the rails.â€ Sheenâ€™s behavior, which included talking disparagingly about Lorre in public, became increasingly erratic. Cryer said this is why he started talking to Lorre about ending the show altogether. â€œI think there was a moment where Chuck Lorre and I were looking at each other and we said, â€˜Itâ€™s not worth this show going on if going on enables Charlie Sheen to kill himself. If giving him enough money to do whatever the thing is that ends his life, you know, we donâ€™t want to be a part of that,â€™â€ he said. â€œAnd I think, actually, when Charlie was let go from the show, the first thought amongst most of us was, â€˜OK, weâ€™re done. This has been a great thing, but weâ€™re done at this point.â€™â€ The show didnâ€™t end, however. Ashton Kutcher was brought on to replace Sheen, and the series concluded in 2015 after 11 seasons. Ten years after his departure, Sheen said he regretted his behavior. â€œThere [were] 55 different ways for me to handle that situation, and I chose number 56,â€ he told Yahoo! Entertainment in February 2021. â€œAnd so, you know, I think the growth for me post-meltdown or melt forward or melt somewhere â€” however you want to label it â€” it has to start with absolute ownership of my role in all of it,â€ Sheen explained. He added: â€œAnd it was desperately juvenile.â€ Despite feeling remorse for his actions on the show, Sheen hasnâ€™t exactly been â€œwinningâ€ since he left â€œTwo and a Half Menâ€ in 2011. In 2020, actor Corey Feldman accused Sheen of sexually assaulting his friend, the late actor Corey Haim, while the two were working on the 1986 film â€œLucas.â€ Sheen has denied Feldmanâ€™s allegations, which were featured in Feldmanâ€™s documentary â€œ(My) Truth: The Rape of Two Coreys.â€ These allegations were not new, however. Sheen sued the National Enquirer for libel in 2017 after the tabloid printed Feldmanâ€™s rape allegations. (The parties settled in 2018.) Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Polish Teen Makes A Prophet Of Simon Cowell In Knockout 'AGT' Performance
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Singer Sara James had a lot to live up to on â€œAmericaâ€™s Got Talentâ€ Tuesday. (Watch the video below.) Before the 13-year-old from Poland performed, judge Simon Cowell told her, â€œIâ€™ve got a good feeling about you for some reason.â€ James validated Cowellâ€™s vibe from her first breakout note of Billie Eilishâ€™s â€œLovely.â€ â€œIâ€™ve heard a lot of singers over the years, but wow,â€ Cowell said afterward, adding: â€œYou have a real star glow about you.â€ Cowell pressed the Golden Buzzer to catapult James to the live rounds. Jamesâ€™ performance had garnered more than 1.3 million views on the â€œAGTâ€ YouTube channel by Wednesday morning. She has major talent show experience, having won â€œThe Voice Kidsâ€ in Poland and placing second in the Junior Eurovision contest. And it shows. Check out her â€œAGTâ€ debut: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Donald Trump Jr.'s New Grift 'Sounds Like A Threat' To Stephen Colbert
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Stephen Colbert reckons Donald Trump Jr.â€™s mail-order meat promotion sounds more frightening than it does appetizing. â€œUntil they face consequences, the ex-presidentâ€™s family is still out there peddling their wares,â€ Colbert said on Tuesday nightâ€™s â€œLate Show.â€ For example, Trump Jr. recently made a post on Instagram promoting Good Ranchers, a MAGA-friendly mail-order meat company. â€œIf you havenâ€™t heard about Good Ranchers before, you need to. Theyâ€™re one of the only companies out there delivering 100% American meat to your door 100% of the time,â€ Trump Jr. said in the video, which offered the code â€œMAGAKINGâ€ for two free ribeye steaks. Colbert was a little disturbed by this vow. â€œOne hundred percent of the time, there will be meat at your door. Every time you open it â€• Boom! More meat. Like it or not, meat there! Youâ€™re gonna have to walk over the meat every time you open your door,â€ he joked. â€œThat sounds less like a delivery and more like a threat. â€˜Hey, snitches get rib tips. All Iâ€™m saying is Iâ€™d hate to see your wife and kids end up with infinite meat.â€™â€ â€œGiven this familyâ€™s whole deal, whatâ€™s the grift here? Is it gopher meat?â€ Colbert added. As it turns out, the business saw its Better Business Bureau accreditation revoked last year after it failed to deal with numerous customer complaints â€œwith integrity, good faith and intent to do what is reasonably expected,â€ among other issues. Watch more of Colbertâ€™s monologue below: Senior Reporter, HuffPost
