topic: Steph Curry Defends Wife Ayesha Curry Against Haters With Hilarious Shirt
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Stephen Curry is letting critics know not to mess with his wife. On Monday, the all-star stood up for his wife by wearing a T-shirt that read â€œAyesha Curry CAN cook.â€ Curry sported the endearing shirt during his postgame press conference after the Golden State Warriors conquered the Boston Celtics in Game 5 of the 2022 NBA Finals in San Francisco, California. The NBA starâ€™s eye-catching fashion choice appeared to be a jab at a Boston bar that took shots at the cookbook author by showcasing a sign outside its building last week that said, â€œAyesha Curry Cant Cook.â€ You stay classy Boston pic.twitter.com/ZcIyNVcNNS Game On!, a bar near Fenway Park, also fired off another trolling message about Curryâ€™s family with a displayed sign that read, â€œDuece Tatum > Riley Curry,â€ a nod toward the son of Celtics player Jayson Tatum. The incorrectly spelled sign (his name is actually spelled Deuce) said that Tatumâ€™s son was greater than Curryâ€™s daughter. Although Curry made his dislike for the diss clear with his shirt choice, he didnâ€™t have much to add about his fashion statement, allowing the shirt to speak for itself. When a reporter asked him about the meaning behind his top, Curry evaded the question and replied: â€œYou got to ask around the room and ask Twitter.â€ â€œAyesha Curry can cookâ€ ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚ğŸ˜‚Steph and absolute legend pic.twitter.com/v8RzyLXOKl Ayesha and Stephen Curry have been married for over a decade. The mother of three launched her successful culinary career in 2014. Stephen Curry currently holds three championship titles and multiple MVP awards with the Warriors. The point guard racked up 16 points against Boston in Mondayâ€™s victory for the team. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Tom Hanks Defends 'Forrest Gump' Over Controversial Best Picture Oscar Win
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Unlike life, you almost always know what youâ€™re going to get with a Best Picture Oscar winner: a crowd-pleasing movie with an ooey-gooey, message-filled center. Sure, there have been deviations over the years, but for every â€œParasite,â€ thereâ€™s a â€œGreen Book,â€ â€œCrash,â€ â€œDriving Miss Daisyâ€ or yes, â€œForrest Gump,â€ to balance out the scales. Tom Hanks, however, considers his 1994 drama to be an outlier, despite movie fans arguing that either â€œPulp Fictionâ€ or â€œThe Shawshank Redemptionâ€ were more deserving of the Best Picture win. Speaking with The New York Times in wide-ranging profile published last week, the actor defended the film against critics who only regard it as a â€œtotem of boomer nostalgia.â€ â€œThe problem with â€˜Forrest Gumpâ€™ is it made a billion dollars. If weâ€™d just made a successful movie, Bob and I would have been geniuses,â€ he told the outlet, referring to film director Robert Zemeckis. â€œBut because we made a wildly successful movie, we were diabolical geniuses,â€ Hanks continued. â€œIs it a bad problem to have? No, but thereâ€™s books of the greatest movies of all time, and â€œForrest Gumpâ€ doesnâ€™t appear because, oh, itâ€™s this sappy nostalgia fest.â€ Hanks went on to note that he regularly sees articles that argue Quentin Tarantinoâ€™s â€œPulp Fictionâ€ shouldâ€™ve triumphed in the category, conceding that the film is a â€œmasterpiece without a doubt.â€ But he said â€œForrest Gumpâ€ should also get its due. â€œLook, I donâ€™t know, but there is a moment of undeniable heartbreaking humanity in â€˜Forrest Gumpâ€™ when Gary Sinise â€” heâ€™s playing Lieutenant Dan â€” and his Asian wife walk up to our house on the day that Forrest and Jenny get married,â€ Hanks said, adding that the â€œmagic legsâ€ scene conveys â€œall they had been through and feel gratitude for every ounce of pain and tragedy that they survived.â€ â€œThatâ€™s some intangible [expletive] right there,â€ he continued. â€œThat is not just running along to Duane Eddyâ€™s â€˜Rebel Rouser.â€™â€ â€œForrest Gumpâ€ essentially swept the 67th Academy Awards, winning six Oscars, including Best Picture, Best Adapted Screenplay, Best Visual Effects, Best Film Editing, Best Director for Zemeckis and Best Actor for Hanks. Along with â€œPulp Fictionâ€ and â€œThe Shawshank Redemption,â€ the film beat out nominees â€œFour Weddings and a Funeralâ€ and â€œQuiz Showâ€ for Best Picture. Tarantinoâ€™s boundary pushing, blood-soaked extravaganza, meanwhile, was seen as an experimental underdog by comparison, ultimately only taking home a prize at the ceremony for Best Screenplay Written Directly for the Screen. Hanks is set to reunite with Zemeckis, who also worked with the actor on â€œCast Away,â€ in Disneyâ€™s upcoming live-action version of â€œPinocchio.â€ But first heâ€™s aiming for Oscars glory once again in the upcoming â€œElvisâ€ biopic out later this month. For the role of the singerâ€™s manager Colonel Tom Parker, Hanks donned prosthetics and hefty cosmetics, rendering him nearly unrecognizable. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Tyler Perry Reveals Will Smith's State Of Mind Right After Oscars Slap
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Filmmaker Tyler Perry said Monday that Will Smith â€œcouldnâ€™t believe what happenedâ€ when Perry approached the actor onstage after he slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars in March. The â€œMadeaâ€ mogul added that he wasnâ€™t comforting the â€œKing Richardâ€ star, even if photos with Denzel Washington might suggest otherwise. â€œWhen we walked over to him, he was devastated,â€ Perry said of Smith at the Tribeca Film Festival, per People. â€œHe couldnâ€™t believe what happened. He couldnâ€™t believe he did it. Iâ€™m looking at this man in his eyes going, â€˜What are you doing? This is your night.â€™â€ In the Directors Series interview, CBSâ€™s Gayle King asked Perry if he was comforting Smith. Perry said he was â€œdeescalatingâ€ while making it clear to Smith that what he did was â€œwrong.â€ â€œThereâ€™s a difference between comforting and deescalating, thatâ€™s No. 1,â€ he said, according to People. â€œAnd I left early to get to Chris to make sure he was OK. Being friends with both of them has been very difficult.â€ Perry believed the outburst stemmed from Smithâ€™s unresolved issues in being unable to protect his mother as a child, which he wrote about in a book. â€œI know that feeling of being a man and thinking about the little boy,â€ Perry said, according to Variety. â€œAnd if that trauma is not dealt with right away, as you get older it will show up in the most inappropriate, most horrible time. I know Will. I know him well.â€ The slap heard around the world is still echoing. Rock, whose â€œG.I. Janeâ€ crack about Jada Pinkett Smithâ€™s shaved head prompted Smithâ€™s onstage attack, jokes about the incident during stand-up gigs but has yet to go in depth. Smith apologized and incurred a 10-year suspension from the Oscars. And Pinkett Smith recently asked the two men to reconcile in a statement assuming no culpability on the part of her husband. Vivica A. Fox even called out Pinkett Smith for her lack of accountability. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Seth Meyers Points Out Jared Kushner's Tell In Jan. 6 Testimony
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Jared Kushnerâ€™s silence was deafening after one particular question posed by the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021 attack, Seth Meyers said. In its second hearing on Monday, the committee laid out evidence that former President Donald Trump and his inner circle knew his claims of a rigged election were false but pushed them anyway. On the night of the 2020 election, Trump reportedly ignored his campaign advisers and, on the advice of his intoxicated personal attorney, Rudy Giuliani, falsely declared victory while votes were still being counted. In one snippet from the testimony, Kushner, Trumpâ€™s son-in-law and former White House adviser, was asked if heâ€™d ever shared his perspectives on Giuliani with Trump. After a long pause, Kushner said he had. Then when asked what he told his father-in-law, he said: â€œUh, basically, not the approach I would take if I was you.â€ â€œThat was a very long pause. You could tell Kushner did not want to answer the question. Iâ€™m shocked he didnâ€™t break out into a song called â€˜We donâ€™t talk about Rudy,â€™â€ Meyers said on â€œLate Nightâ€ Monday. â€œThatâ€™s definitely the length of the pause you take when someone asks you about a friend who was super drunk at a party, especially a friend you invited.â€ Watch Meyersâ€™ roast below: Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Jimmy Kimmel Presents 'Drunk Giuliani' Compilation After Jan. 6 Panel's Detail
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Thereâ€™s no way late-show hosts werenâ€™t going to pounce on this detail from the Jan. 6 House select committee hearings. Jimmy Kimmelâ€™s team promptly offered up a compilation Monday after the committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol revealed that on the night of the 2020 election, Donald Trump falsely declared victory on the advice of his drunk personal attorney, even though votes were still being counted. â€œPresident Trump rejected the advice of his campaign experts on election night, and instead followed the course recommended by an apparently inebriated Rudy Giuliani to just claim he won and insist the vote-counting stop, to falsely claim everything was fraudulent,â€ committee co-chair Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.) said at Mondayâ€™s proceedings. Cheneyâ€™s comments were followed by video testimony from former Trump aide Jason Miller, who said Giuliani was â€œdefinitely intoxicatedâ€ when they spoke that night. â€œEveryone pretty much told Trump he lost, but he didnâ€™t want to hear that. He wanted to hear what Rudy Giuliani told him,â€ Kimmel said. â€œAnd how would Trump know Giuliani was drunk? I mean, does this seem like a drunk person to you?â€ Check out the compilation below on â€œJimmy Kimmel Live.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Matthew Morrison Speaks Out About His Firing From 'So You Think You Can Dance'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Matthew Morrison has offered his own explanation for text correspondence thatâ€™s reportedly at the center of his firing as a judge on â€œSo You Think You Can Dance.â€ A source told People earlier this week that the â€œGleeâ€ actor was dismissed from the dance competition show for sending a female contestant â€œflirtyâ€ direct messages on social media that she said had made her uncomfortable. Morrison announced his departure last week, saying he had violated â€œcompetition production protocols, preventing me from being able to judge the competition fairly.â€ â€œItâ€™s really unfortunate that I have to sit here and defend myself and my family against blatantly untrue statements made anonymously, but I have nothing to hide,â€ Morrison said Thursday in a video posted on Instagram. â€œSo, in the interest of transparency, I will read to you the one message I wrote to a dancer on the show.â€ According to Morrison, that single message said: â€œHey, itâ€™s Matthew. If you donâ€™t mind, would love to get your number and talk you through some things.â€ â€œThe end,â€ he said. â€œI sent this because this dancer and I both share a mutual respect for a choreographer that Iâ€™ve known for over 20 years and I was trying to help her get a job as a choreographer on the show.â€³ â€œGossip is toxic,â€ he added, concluding by saying he didnâ€™t want the incident to take away from the show. He wished the remaining judges and contestants on the show â€œall the best.â€ A post shared by Matthew Morrison (@matthewmorrison) A source close to the Fox reality show had told People that Morrisonâ€™s conduct was investigated after the woman, who reportedly received multiple messages, alerted producers. Morrison will be replaced as a judge. However, many of the episodes were pre-taped, meaning he will be seen on the show through mid-June. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Wildhood' Breaks New Ground As A 2-Spirit Coming-Of-Age Tale
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost A teen learns to embrace his true self after a life-changing road trip in â€œWildhood,â€ which is being screened virtually as part of the NewFest Pride film series this week ahead of its Hulu premiere. Directed by Bretten Hannam, â€œWildhoodâ€ follows Link (played by Phillip Lewitski), who lives under the eye of his stern, anti-LGBTQ father (Joel Thomas Hynes) in Canada. Link soon discovers that his mother Sarah â€• long believed to be dead â€• might still be alive. So he and his younger half-brother, Travis (Avery Winters-Anthony), embark on a journey along Canadaâ€™s eastern coast to find her, as well as reconnect with their Indigenous roots. After some time on the road, Link finds himself drawn to Pasmay (Joshua Odjick), a young person who is Two-Spirit, meaning they identify as having both a masculine and a feminine spirit. Soon, Link and Pasmay are exchanging longing glances and flirty quips. Whether romance is in the stars for the pair, however, remains to be seen. Catch the trailer for â€œWildhoodâ€ below. Hannam, who is Two-Spirit and nonbinary, said they began writing the screenplay for â€œWildhoodâ€ more than a decade ago. In 2019, they released â€œWildfire,â€ a short film based on an abridged version of the script. Though some of the events portrayed were inspired by the filmmakerâ€™s life, the film as a whole reflects the â€œexperiences of a community that Iâ€™m part of,â€ they said, and isnâ€™t intended as a coming-out story. â€œTwo-Spirit identity is an intersection of the relationship to land, gender, sexuality, ceremony, and culture,â€ Hannam told Salon last year. â€œItâ€™s hard in English to summarize or speak about those things succinctly. For Link going on this journey, he is finding out where he fits in all of these aspects, and what it means to be part of a community.â€ â€œWildhoodâ€ will showcased as part of NewFest Pride, a five-day series of in-person and virtual screenings curated by the organizers of New Yorkâ€™s annual LGBTQ film festival that runs Thursday to June 6. Other highlights of the series include â€œFire Island,â€ starring Joel Kim Booster and Bowen Yang, and â€œGirl Picture,â€ a drama that follows three Finnish women as they explore their sexuality over several weekends. Peacockâ€™s hotly anticipated reboot of the landmark LGBTQ series â€œQueer as Folkâ€ will also have its New York premiere as part of the event. After the virtual New York engagement, â€œWildhoodâ€ will debut on Hulu June 24 following a weeklong theatrical run at the Lumiere Music Hall in Beverly Hills, California. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Johnny Depp Gave Parenting Tips To Pregnant Bar Manager Before Verdict
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost A bar manager in the United Kingdom shared that she had spoken with actor Johnny Depp just before the verdict was announced in his defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Lauren Whittington, who is the general manager of the Bridge Tavern bar in Newcastle, England, described the encounter on Wednesday to ITV News. â€œNone of us could believe it,â€ Whittington told the British television network, adding that it took a while for bar-goers to notice the actor. Depp â€œwent unnoticed for maybe an hour before anyone realized it was him and Jeff Beck just [sitting] eating fish and chips together in the corner,â€ said Whittington. She added that Depp noticed she was pregnant and asked her how long she had left in her pregnancy before offering some parenting tips. â€œHe was giving me some advice on [diapers], lack of sleep and the first few weeks of parenthood, saying itâ€™ll be the greatest gift I ever receive and I wonâ€™t know love like it until I look into her eyes for the first time,â€ Whittington said. â€œHe was also talking about his kids, who are grown up now, and how magical being a parent is,â€ she added. According to Whittington, Depp departed from the bar â€œabout an hour before the verdictâ€ was announced in court in Fairfax, Virginia. â€œ[He] said he had a Zoom call about [the verdict], so we wished him luck and thanked him for being so kind, and he thanked us for having him,â€ she said. The jury decided primarily in favor of Depp, awarding the actor $15 million in total damages, however, Heard will only have to pay $10.35 million due to a Virginia law capping punitive damages. Heard was granted $2 million in compensatory damages in her countersuit for a statement by Deppâ€™s attorney that was found to be defamatory. In court filings, Depp had requested $50 million in damages, while Heard countersued for $100 million. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: ABC News Gets Flak For Oddly Critical Marion Barber III Death Tweet
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost By most measures, the late Dallas Cowboys running back Marion Barber III had a successful NFL career. He rushed for 4,780 yards and 53 touchdowns, and collected 179 receptions for 1,330 yards and six touchdowns in seven seasons â€• the last of which he spent with the Chicago Bears in 2011. But ABC News wrote a curiously negative tweet about the star, who was reportedly found dead in his apartment Wednesday after someone called police to check on his welfare. He was 38. The outlet wrote that Barber â€œscored plenty of touchdowns without recording a 1,000-yard season.â€ Barberâ€™s lesser yardage, while mentioned deep in The Associated Press article linked in ABCâ€™s tweet, seemed to be an odd fact to highlight in an obituary headline. ABC News didnâ€™t immediately reply to a request for comment on Friday and apparently deleted the tweet. The networkâ€™s tweet downright ticked off some fans and sports reporters, who called it insensitive and disrespectful. This is like satire level of bad. Who the fuck read this and thought this was a good tweet? So do you all just maintain a level of infinite insensitive reporting on purpose?  Who vetted this report out? Once again, unless a person is a monster, there's no reason to neg them in their obituary https://t.co/Y8mZPc7gtF Wtf is this headline. Show some respect please pic.twitter.com/tvHwasjADV pic.twitter.com/ZEXb4DDj5w Today's edition of Tasteless Headlines: https://t.co/EjYMMfB2ql This is poor taste.....Condolences to Marion. I donâ€™t have a damn journalism degree but I fixed the tweet for you. Hire me to run your social media @ABC pic.twitter.com/EXpCg4g046 General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Spike Lee's Bling And The Boston Celtics Win NBA Finals Game 1
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Spike Leeâ€™s accessory game was on fire for Game 1 of the NBA Finals in San Francisco on Thursday. The Oscar-winning filmmaker wore a giant â€œMARSâ€ necklace to rep his famous hoops-loving character Mars Blackmon from his 1986 movie â€œSheâ€™s Gotta Have It.â€ The character also starred in the â€œItâ€™s gotta be the shoes!â€ commercials with Michael Jordan. The white suit, golden footwear and captainâ€™s hat put Leeâ€™s ensemble over the top as the sartorial victor, while the Boston Celtics won the game over the Golden State Warriors. The visitors, who trailed by 15 late in the third quarter, outscored the Warriors 40-16 in the fourth quarter to win 120-108. Lee made his run for fashion glory before the game, and ESPN loved it. Can I just say I'm obsessed with the Mars Blackmon that Spike Lee is wearing to the NBA Finals? https://t.co/Yybn0AqbmM pic.twitter.com/hLCQ2XwoIb What will you wear for Game 2? H/T For the Win General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

content: content

topic: U. Of South Carolina Now Home To Boatload Of Hootie & The Blowfish Memorabilia
content: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) â€” Hootie & the Blowfish got its start at the University of South Carolina and the school is now home to a boatload of the Grammy Award winning rock bandâ€™s memorabilia. Longtime fan Rick Noble on Friday donated his collection of all things Hootie & the Blowfish â€” including CDs, ticket stubs, an autographed guitar and T-shirts â€” to the school where the band was formed in 1986. â€œThe story of Hootie and Blowfish is forever entwined with the University of South Carolina â€“ itâ€™s one of the exciting pieces of our modern history,â€ Interim President Harris Pastides said in a news release. â€œRickâ€™s collection will help capture that story and preserve it for future generations. We are so grateful for his foresight, dedication and generosity in sharing a gift that increases the stature of the University Librariesâ€™ music collections.â€ Noble, who is now retired from a career in nonprofit work, including as the long-time CEO of Richland County First Steps, said heâ€™s been collecting the bandâ€™s memorabilia since 1993, a year before the band released its debut album, â€œCracked Rear View.â€ He said he first became interested in the band after listening to his daughterâ€™s copy of an early album. Then he connected with band members and its management when they performed at a benefit concert Noble organized. â€œThey just started giving me T-shirts and other merchandise,â€ Noble recalled. â€œAnd I just went on from there. It was a treasure hunt.â€ The band merchandise is the second contemporary music memorabilia collection to come to the University Libraries. A large collection of guitars, photographs and costumes from the rock band KISS was donated in 2020. Libraries Dean Tom McNally said special collections help attract scholars and students to the university and he hopes other collectors and musicians will continue to donate items for display, teaching and research. Library staff is in the process of organizing, appraising and preserving the donated items, which also includes drumsticks, a Hootie candle and golf balls. Once complete, a public viewing will be scheduled. Nobleâ€™s donation comes shortly after the University of South Carolina Press released a book about the history of the band, â€œOnly Wanna Be with You: The Inside Story of Hootie & the Blowfish.â€ â€œItâ€™s such a special, full-circle moment to see his collection come home to the UofSC library and we couldnâ€™t be more thankful to him for supporting both our band and our university,â€ Darius Rucker, the bandâ€™s lead singer, said.

topic: Charlie Puth Says He Regrets How He Lost His Virginity: 'I Never Saw Her Again'
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Music and sex go hand-in-hand for Charlie Puth. The â€œLight Switchâ€ singer sat down with Bustle for an amusing interview full of TMI moments. While the chat was likely meant to promote his recent hit singles and forthcoming album, â€œCharlie,â€ it quickly veered into more, um, physical matters. Puth divulged to the publication that he lost his virginity at age 21 to a fan who had attended one of his early performances in Boston and, from the sounds of it, his first sexual experience wasnâ€™t quite as monumental as he might have hoped. â€œThis girl came up to me and was like, â€˜Can you sign my chest?â€™ I was like, I feel like a rock star,â€ he said. â€œI never saw her again. She was lovely, but it makes me sad sometimes because I wish the older version of me was like, â€˜Hey, you might want to just make this like a little more memorable.â€™â€ Elsewhere in the chat, Puth revealed that the first song he ever â€œjerked off toâ€ was Maroon 5â€™s â€œThis Loveâ€ â€• a point which he says that bandâ€™s frontman, Adam Levine, finds â€œreally weird.â€ Most of the time, however, he canâ€™t listen to music while hitting the sheets. â€œI will analyze the music playing in the background,â€ he told Bustle, â€œand Iâ€™ll start to see the music notes in my head and I will not be able to get hard.â€ Such details probably wonâ€™t come as much of a surprise to Puthâ€™s fans, as the four-time Grammy nominee is known for his steamy TikTok videos and Instagram posts, some of which show him in various stages of undress. Last month, he showed a bit of derriÃ¨re in what appeared to be a behind-the-scenes snapshot from a recent photo shoot. And Puth â€• who has previously described â€œCharlieâ€ as his â€œmost authenticâ€ album to date â€• isnâ€™t fazed by the speculation into his personal life that his work as an artist draws. â€œIâ€™m really horny,â€ he said. â€œI think to be a creative, you have to be a little bit.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Alicia Witt Reveals She Began Cancer Treatments When Her Parents Tragically Died
content: Reporter, HuffPost Alicia Witt is shedding new light on what she was going through during her parentsâ€™ sudden death. Just six months after her parents were discovered dead in their Massachusetts home, the â€œOrange Is the New Blackâ€ actor posted a slideshow on Instagram Wednesday that revealed she recently underwent treatment for breast cancer, including chemotherapy and a mastectomy. She also said that she began these treatments when her parents died in December. In the first video in her slideshow, the â€œFunâ€ star rings a gong to signify that she has completed chemotherapy. â€œJust a little over 2 months ago, I had my last round of chemical therapy prior to my mastectomy,â€ Witt wrote. A post shared by Alicia Witt (@aliciawitty) â€œAlthough we didnâ€™t yet know for absolute certain until after the mastectomy that the disease was completely healed from my left breast,â€ Witt said, this â€œmarked the endâ€ of her treatment with chemotherapy drugs carboplatin and taxotere. She said her treatment with the immunotherapies Herceptin and Perjeta â€œwill continue ... through the end of this year,â€ citing the treatment protocol for HER2-positive breast cancer. The slideshow also features a photo of her proudly holding up her chemotherapy certificate of completion. The Hallmark holiday movie queen gave a shoutout to her â€œbeloved, brilliant, collaborative, communicative doctorâ€ in the caption of her post. Witt, 46, also wrote that she was surrounded by a â€œtiny crew of human angelsâ€ who kept spirits high throughout her journey. In the slideshow, the â€œUrban Legendâ€ star is seen wearing a Penguin Cold Cap, a scalp cooling process that is known to minimize hair loss. She emphasized what that cap meant to her, as well. â€œWhile keeping hair was obviously the last of my concerns on a larger level, i did deeply wish to keep my diagnosis private until it was 100% healed, god willing,â€ she wrote. Witt made sure to thank those who â€œhonoredâ€ her during her treatment by keeping it private and said that â€œthese caps can truly play a huge role in allowing a patient to reveal her journey on her own time, when she is ready.â€ â€œFor me, this was such a needed part of my healing â€• particularly given the horribly public tragedy that had happened in our family just as i was beginning my treatments.â€ Wittâ€™s parents, Robert Witt, 87, and Diane Witt, 75, were found dead in their home late last year by police after the actor asked a relative to check on them because she hadnâ€™t heard from them in several days. The cause of their death was â€œprobable cardiac dysrhythmiaâ€ due to the cold, according to the death certificates, The Telegram & Gazette reported. Police said at the time the homeâ€™s heating system was not working, according to The Associate Press. Witt said in a Facebook post in January that she had repeatedly offered her parents help, but was always turned down. She called her parents â€œfiercely stubbornâ€ and said she had no idea they were without heat. â€œEvery time I offered to have something repaired for them, they refused to allow workers into their house,â€ she wrote. â€œI begged, cried, tried to reason with them, tried to convince them to let me help them move â€” but every time, they became furious with me, telling me I had no right to tell them how to live their lives and that they had it all under control.â€ She concluded her post lovingly. â€œOur last words to each other were â€˜I love you,â€™â€ she wrote. â€œThat part was simple; never in doubt. They loved me so. I loved them so.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Michael B. Jordan, Lori Harvey Reportedly Call It Quits After Over 1 Year Together
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost The internetâ€™s cutest couple, Michael B. Jordan and Lori Harvey, have closed the curtains on their relationship after dating for more than a year and a half. The modelâ€™s father, Steve Harvey, confirmed the breakup on Mondayâ€™s episode of â€œThe Steve Harvey Morning Show,â€ saying he was â€œTeam Lori, 1,000%.â€ He didnâ€™t offer much in the way of detail of why they ended their relationship, which started in November 2020. Calling Jordan a â€œcool guy,â€ the host shared, â€œIâ€™m pretty sure theyâ€™ll be fine. People break up all the time.â€ Rumors began to surface on Saturday that Jordan and Lori Harvey broke up, and People verified the news the same day. â€œMichael and Lori are both completely heartbroken,â€ a source close to the couple told People. â€œThey still love each other.â€ The source explained, â€œMichael matured a lot over the course of their relationship and was ready to commit for the long term. He let down his guard with her, opening up emotionally in a romantic relationship for the first time...They had great times together and brought out the best in each other.â€ A post shared by Michael B. Jordan (@michaelbjordan) The stylish duo officially announced their relationship and became â€œInstagram officialâ€ in January of 2021. The two were not shy about sharing their love on social media and celebrated their first anniversary in November. A month later, in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Jordan confessed his love for Harvey and expressed how the relationship positively influenced his life. â€œLong story short, I think itâ€™s just the timing of everything. It was the right time for me,â€ he said, smiling. â€œYeah. Iâ€™m happy.â€ â€œI finally found what love was,â€ the leading man added. It appeared Harvey shared the same love for Jordan, telling the ladies of â€œThe Realâ€ back in September, â€œwhen you know, you know.â€ â€œWe just really balance each other,â€ Harvey said at the time. â€œI really do believe in the statement when they say, â€˜When you know you know.â€™ And I think that really applies to our situation and we just have a really good time together.â€ However, last month, Harvey was spotted solo in Cannes for the screening of â€œFinal Cut (Coupez!)â€, which sparked rumors that things were rocky between the pair. Neither Jordan nor Harvey had publicly addressed the news as of Monday morning, but the SKN founder appears to have deleted all trace of Jordanâ€™s presence from her Instagram after news of their split broke. Photos of the two remain on Jordanâ€™s Instagram page, including a tribute from March to their extravagant night at the Vanity Fair Oscar party. A post shared by Michael B. Jordan (@michaelbjordan) On Sunday, Jordan was spotted  at the 2022 NBA Finals in San Francisco with rapper Cordae. Steve Harvey previously told the Ellen Show that he was happy for his daughter. On Monday, the host noted the challenges of trying to have a successful relationship in the public eye. â€œLook, as long as everybody can walk away in peace, be friends ... I ainâ€™t heard nobody say they busted no windows or nothing,â€ he said. â€œAs long as you donâ€™t put your hands on my daughter, I donâ€™t give a damn what you do.â€ Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: These Republicans Resisted Trumpâ€™s Attempt To Steal The Election. Theyâ€™d Vote For Him Again.
content:
Reporter, HuffPost Rusty Bowers, the Republican speaker of the Arizona state House of Representatives, on Tuesday detailed his efforts to thwart former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to steal the 2020 presidential election in stirring testimony to a select congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6 insurrection at the U.S. Capitol. Bowers told the committee that Trump and his lawyers failed to produce any evidence of fraud, and that they asked him to ignore the law and overturn the election anyway. He became emotional, at times, as he described the barrage of violent threats he and his family have faced since. Bowers read from a journal entry he wrote in December 2020, in which he completely dismissed the then-presidentâ€™s efforts to undermine democracy: â€œI do not want to be a winner by cheating,â€ he wrote. â€œI will not play with laws I swore allegiance to.â€ Hours later, Bowers said he would vote for Trump again. â€œIf he is the nominee, if he was up against Biden, Iâ€™d vote for him again,â€ Bowers told The Associated Press. â€œSimply because what he did the first time, before COVID, was so good for the county. In my view it was great.â€ Bowers was among a small group of Republican elected officials who broke with Trump and refused to go along with the plot to overturn the 2020 election. Now, he is the latest among them to suggest that he would still support Trump in a future contest, even as the former president and his Republican allies intensify their efforts to undermine American democracy. Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, who refused Trumpâ€™s infamous request to â€œfindâ€ the votes necessary to overturn his stateâ€™s election results, did not rule out another vote for Trump in an interview with HuffPost last year. â€œI think thatâ€™s so far out in the future, I donâ€™t even think heâ€™s announced heâ€™s running yet,â€ Raffensperger, who testified alongside Bowers on Tuesday, said in November. â€œSo letâ€™s circle back and talk about that in the future.â€ Raffensperger did not immediately respond to HuffPostâ€™s inquiry on Wednesday. And former Attorney General Bill Barr, who tried to convince Trump that his fraud claims were baseless, said in March that he would support his old boss if Trump were the 2024 Republican nominee. â€œI certainly have made it clear I donâ€™t think he should be our nominee, and Iâ€™m going to support somebody else for the nomination,â€ Barr said on the â€œTodayâ€ show. But, he added, â€œbecause I believe that the greatest threat to the country is the progressive agenda being pushed by the Democratic Party, itâ€™s inconceivable to me that I wouldnâ€™t vote for the Republican nominee.â€ During Tuesdayâ€™s hearing, Bowers described Trumpâ€™s haphazard attempt to overturn the 2020 election as a â€œtragic parody.â€ But since his unwilling departure from the presidency, Trump and his allies within the GOP have launched a far more coordinated and deliberate assault on democracy, with the apparent aim of taking control of the countryâ€™s electoral system in a way that could make it far more likely that a future attempt to undermine an election actually succeeds. Republican election deniers have lined up to run for major statewide offices and congressional seats across the country, with the key swing states that decided the 2020 contest as their chief focus. Candidates who have spread conspiracies about Trumpâ€™s defeat have already won primaries in major battlegrounds: The GOP nominee for governor in Pennsylvania attempted to overturn the 2020 results in his state, while the Republican winner in Nevadaâ€™s secretary of state primary questioned the legitimacy of the outcome and has built a coalition of like-minded candidates in an attempt to â€œtake backâ€ control of the American election system. Dozens of Republicans who have embraced Trumpâ€™s lies have won congressional primaries, and the GOP is likely to nominate election deniers in statewide primaries in Colorado, Michigan, Minnesota and Wisconsin. In May, Raffensperger survived a Republican primary against a Trump-endorsed challenger who twice voted to contest the results of the 2020 election in Congress, and accused Raffensperger of â€œcompromisingâ€ Georgiaâ€™s elections by refusing to help Trump overturn it. In Bowersâ€™ Arizona, meanwhile, upcoming GOP primaries for governor and secretary of state have been dominated by candidates who have spread conspiracies about the last election or refused to commit to the certification of future contests. The grip Trump and his election lies hold on the GOP has inspired deep fears among experts who worry that American democracy is far more vulnerable ahead of the next presidential contest than it was in 2020, especially as the former president sets the stage to run again. Trump has continued to hold campaign-style rallies since he left the White House, and he hinted at a possible 2024 run as recently as last week. A majority of Republican voters said they would support him in the GOP primary if he does run, according to a recent poll from Morning Consult. And Trump has made it clear that his loss in the 2020 election â€” as well as his failed effort to overturn the results â€” would be the driving theme in his next campaign. â€œWeâ€™re not forgetting 2020,â€ Trump said at a Georgia rally in October. â€œThe most corrupt election in the history of our country. Most corrupt election in the history of most countries, to be followed by an even more glorious victory in November of 2024.â€ Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Trevor Noah Roasts CNN For Overusing Breaking News Alerts: 'Boy Who Cried Wolf'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Trevor Noah poked fun at CNN on Tuesday for overusing its breaking news banner after its new leader directed staffers to cut back on the practice. â€œFor years, CNN has been notorious for overhyping every story like itâ€™s the zombie apocalypse,â€ â€œThe Daily Showâ€ host said. â€œItâ€™s like, â€˜BREAKING NEWS: The midterm elections are now six months away!â€™â€ â€œAnd not surprisingly, this approach has started to backfire, as viewers have learned to tune it out. Like the boy who cried wolf. Or in this case, the Wolf who cried wolf,â€ Noah added, as an image of veteran CNN anchor Wolf Blitzer appeared on screen. Chris Licht, the new chairman of CNN, recently told employees that moving forward, the breaking news banner would be reserved only for major news, according to The New York Times. CNN updated its standards guide to state that a story must qualify as â€œâ€˜Stop what you are doing and watchâ€™ newsâ€ to secure the â€œBreaking Newsâ€ label. Watch Noahâ€™s roast below: Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Adam Sandler Says His Black Eye Was The Result Of A 'Bed Accident'
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Adam Sandler is on the mend after what he described as an unusual incident involving a hotel bed and his cell phone. The Golden Globe- and Emmy-nominated actor stopped by â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ on Monday to promote his new movie, â€œHustle.â€ Before he could chat about the film, however, he was asked by co-host Michael Strahan to explain a bruise and scab that had formed just below his left eye. The incident, Sandler explained, had taken place as he attempted to retrieve his phone in the middle of the night. â€œSomebody tucked in the sheets too much,â€ he said. â€œI had my phone in the middle of the bed. I kicked my feet up [to] untuck it. The phone went flying, hit me in the head.â€ Watch Adam Sandlerâ€™s â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ appearance below. Though Sandler said he â€œfelt bloodâ€ immediately afterward, he â€œrefused to acknowledgeâ€ his wound until the next morning. â€œThereâ€™s nothing cool about this thing,â€ he quipped. â€œWhen Iâ€™m on the streets of New York, I see people going: â€˜Oh, OK. He likes to fight, that guy.â€™ Iâ€™m like: â€˜It was a bed accident.â€™â€ Sandlerâ€™s injury was a hot topic yet again during his Monday night appearance on â€œThe Tonight Show,â€ during which he shared some slightly more gruesome details with host Jimmy Fallon. â€œI was bleeding terribly,â€ he said. â€œIt was pitch black in the room and I feel wetness and I go, â€˜Yes, Iâ€™m gonna trick myself. Those are probably just thick tears.â€™ ... I didnâ€™t want to get up because I was tired. And I was like: â€˜Ah, weâ€™ll fix that later.â€™ Then I woke up, it was horrible. There was blood on the bed and all that stuff.â€ In better news, Sandler is winning raves for his role in the basketball drama â€œHustle,â€ which hits Netflix Wednesday. The Hollywood Reporter praised the movieâ€™s â€œdepth of feelingâ€ and â€œdisarming sincerity,â€ while the Los Angeles Times compared Sandlerâ€™s performance favorably to that of Tom Cruise in 1996â€™s â€œJerry Maguire.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson Reveals Intense Superhero Look In 'Black Adam' Trailer
content: Dwayne â€œThe Rockâ€ Johnson has debuted a fierce superhero look in the trailer for his upcoming DC Comics film â€œBlack Adam.â€ The flick follows the anti-hero of the same name who â€“ after roughly 5,000 years of imprisonment â€“ becomes free to â€œunleash his unique form of justice on the modern world,â€ according to the trailerâ€™s description. Johnson expressed interest in playing the character in 2007 and was set to make his first DC Extended Universe appearance in the 2019 superhero film â€œShazam!,â€ a film about Black Adamâ€™s enemy. Those plans, however, were scrapped in favor of the spinoff film for Johnsonâ€™s character. Watch the trailer for â€œBlack Adam,â€ set for an October 19 release date, below: â€œBlack Adamâ€ marks one of two superhero movies expected to feature Johnson in 2022. He is also going to provide the voice of Supermanâ€™s dog Krypto in the upcoming film â€œDC League of Super-Pets.â€ â€œBlack Adamâ€ is directed by Jaume Collet-Serra, who directed â€œJungle Cruiseâ€ featuring Johnson last year. In an interview with Variety, Collet-Serra called Black Adam the â€œDirty Harry of superheroesâ€ in a reference to the 1971 Clint Eastwood thriller.

topic: Woman's Lost Dachshund Is Found ... In Hilary Swank's Lap
content: ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) â€” Chelsea Blackwellâ€™s dachshund, Blue, disappeared Monday, and the distraught owner went in search. But when she came upon a line of squad cars and people with cameras near the Greyhound bus station, she set aside her search to investigate. â€œI noticed there were like eight police cars and people with cameras â€” I thought maybe somebody got shot,â€ Blackwell told her local paper, the Times Union. Fortunately, tragedy did not lurk â€” Blackwell had stumbled upon a movie crew â€” but ended in a one-in-a-million lucky happenstance. Long story short: Her dog of 15 years was found â€” by a movie star with a history of rescuing dogs. You wonâ€™t believe this, the crew told her, but a celebrity had found her pooch. â€œI asked them if anyone saw a little brown dog, and they said, â€˜Yes, weâ€™ll call her.â€™â€ An hour later, a gray car pulled up, and there was tiny Blue sitting in the lap of two-time Oscar winner Hilary Swank. â€œI was like, â€˜No way,â€™â€ Blackwell said. â€œAs soon as she got out of the car, I kissed Blue and said, â€˜Thank you so much.â€™â€ Blackwell asked Swank for her autograph, but Swank did better: They took a picture. And Blackwell, wanting to be sure Swank got proper credit, posted the photo on Facebook. â€œIâ€™d stopped and asked if someone seen a little brown dog? A man walked over to my car and said, yes, this woman picked him up,â€ she wrote in her post. â€œI said who? He replied, a celebrity,â€ Blackwell wrote. â€œHe called the person who had him. And they said sheâ€™s on her way back. Youâ€™ll never guess who had him?â€ The Million Dollar Baby herself. â€œSheâ€™s not the type of person,â€ Blackwell said, â€œwhoâ€™s going to blow the horn telling people what she did.â€ Swank is no stranger to rescuing dogs. â€œEvery dog Iâ€™ve ever rescued and also shared my life with have all had their unique way of being in the world,â€ said Swank, who has adopted numerous dogs, in a YouTube video posted by People magazine. Swank established a foundation, Hilaroo â€” a portmanteau of her name and the name of a dog she adopted, Karoo â€” that matches abandoned dogs with children whom the foundation says â€œhave been given up on by society.â€

topic: Stephen Colbert Spots Toughest Part Of Prison For Trump-Loving Proud Boy Rioters
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Stephen Colbert celebrated the indictments against five members of the far-right street gang called the Proud Boys for their alleged role in the Jan. 6, 2021 assault on the U.S. Capitol. The â€œLate Showâ€ host noted on Tuesday that the charges for seditious conspiracy carry maximum potential sentences of up to 20 years in prison. â€œI gotta tell you,â€ he said, â€œseeing those guys arrested makes this boy proud.â€ But Colbert also mentioned some unusual rules the gang has, such as only being allowed to masturbate once a month. â€œThatâ€™s gonna make those 20 years in prison seem pretty long,â€ he cracked. â€œBut I do understand why theyâ€™re so angry.â€ See more in his Tuesday night monologue: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Biden Jokes With Kimmel About Republican Rule-Breakers: 'You Gotta Send 'Em To Jail'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost President Joe Biden told Jimmy Kimmel he wonâ€™t bend the rules, as some Republicans do, because if he does, â€œour democracy will literally be in jeopardy.â€ The â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ host asked Biden during an in-studio interview Wednesday whether he would consider issuing an executive order in response to gun violence, considering how former President Donald Trump â€œpassed those out like Halloween candyâ€ during his tenure. â€œI have issued executive orders within the power of the presidency to be able to deal with these, everything having to do with guns and gun ownership ... all the things that are within my power,â€ Biden replied. â€œWhat I donâ€™t want to do â€• and Iâ€™m not being facetious â€• I donâ€™t want to emulate Trumpâ€™s abuse of the Constitution and the constitutional authority.â€ â€œI often get asked: Look, the Republicans donâ€™t play it square. Why do you play it square? Yeah, well, guess what? If we do the same thing they do, our democracy will literally be in jeopardy,â€ he said. Kimmel pushed back, saying he understood the argument but said it was like playing Monopoly with someone who wonâ€™t play by the rules. â€œHow do you ever make any progress if theyâ€™re not following the rules?â€ he asked. â€œYou gotta send â€™em to jail,â€ Biden replied. President @JoeBiden on issuing an Executive Order in response to gun violenceâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/KUXsyNfZrW Bidenâ€™s appearance on the show marked his first in-studio late-night appearance as president. He taped the interview in Los Angeles during his visit for the Summit of the Americas. His first late-night interview as president was in December, when he virtually appeared on â€œThe Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost
