content: content

topic: Foo Fighters Planning 2 Tribute Concerts For Taylor Hawkins
content: NEW YORK (AP) â€” Foo Fighters will honor the rock bandâ€™s late drummer Taylor Hawkins with a pair of tribute concerts in September â€” one in London and the other in Los Angeles. The twin shows will take place Sept. 3 at Londonâ€™s Wembley Stadium and Sept. 27 at The Kia Forum in Inglewood, California, featuring â€œhis bandmates and his inspirations playing the songs that he fell in love with, and the ones he brought to life,â€ the band said in a statement. Lineups for each show will be announced at a later date. Hawkins died March 25 during a South American tour with the rock band. He was 50. Taylorâ€™s wife, Alison, took to social media to thank the band and its fans for their support. â€œIn celebration of his life, is now up to all of us who loved him most to honor Taylorâ€™s legacy and the music he gave us.â€ Hawkins was Alanis Morissetteâ€™s touring drummer when he joined Foo Fighters in 1997, first appearing with the band on the tour supporting its sophomore album â€œThe Colour & The Shape.â€ He made his recording debut with Foo Fighters on 1999â€²s â€œThere Is Nothing Left To Lose.â€ Hawkins played on every subsequent band album, including â€œOne by Oneâ€ and â€œIn Your Honor,â€ and on hit singles like â€œBest of You.â€ The band canceled its tour after Hawkinsâ€™ death. At the Grammy Awards on April 3, an extended tribute to Hawkins played before the showâ€™s In Memoriam segment honoring artists and music industry figures whoâ€™ve died. Billie Eilish paid homage to Hawkins during her performance by sporting a black T-shirt with his image.

topic: Adam Sandler's Story Of Swimming At A Nude Beach Goes Off The Rails
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Adam Sandler said Monday he was the â€œSandman just floating aroundâ€ in the sea in Spain when he came upon a nude beach. (Watch the video below.) So he did as the Spaniards do â€• well, at least the ones at the naked Mediterranean enclave â€• and stripped off his shorts. But instantly he thought he â€œshouldnâ€™t do this.â€ â€œSomeone is gonna take my picture and ruin my life,â€ he told host Jimmy Fallon on â€œThe Tonight Show.â€ The salty water kept his bits in view even when he tried pushing down, he claimed, and they caught the attention of seagulls. This is where fact and shtick seem to blur, as the â€œHustleâ€ star described a conversation in which the hungry birds debated whether it was a worm or a McDonaldâ€™s fry. â€œI was a guest in their country,â€ Sandler said. â€œI gave it to â€™em. I said, â€˜You have a good time.â€™â€ Sandlerâ€™s new basketball movie â€œHustle,â€ which was partially shot in Spain, arrives Wednesday on Netflix. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Black Bird' Trailer Offers Chilling Look At Ray Liotta's Final TV Role
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Apple TV+ has unveiled a first look at Ray Liottaâ€™s final television performance with the trailer for â€œBlack Bird,â€ due out July 8. The six-episode true crime series stars Taron Egerton as Jimmy Keene, a high school football hero who is convicted of a crime and sentenced to 10 years in jail. Once behind bars, however, Jimmy is given an unusual choice by prosecutors: he can either serve his full sentence without the possibility of parole, or transfer to a maximum-security prison to befriend a suspected serial killer, Larry Hall (Paul Walter Hauser), and get him to confess to additional murders. Liotta, who died last month at age 67, plays James â€œBig Jimâ€ Keene, Jimmyâ€™s anguished father and a former police officer. â€œI never wanted this for you,â€ the character tells his son in the opening scene of the trailer. â€œI wanted a totally different life â€” a steady paycheck, kids, a family.â€ Catch the â€œBlack Birdâ€ trailer below. â€œBlack Birdâ€ is based on the younger Keeneâ€™s 2010 memoir, â€œIn With the Devil: A Fallen Hero, a Serial Killer, and a Dangerous Bargain for Redemption.â€ The series was developed and executive-produced by author Dennis Lehane, best known for â€œMystic Riverâ€ and â€œGone, Baby, Gone,â€ both of which were adapted into successful films. While â€œBlack Birdâ€ is being touted as Liottaâ€™s last TV role, the â€œGoodfellasâ€ actor recently completed work on at least two films, â€œEl Tontoâ€ and â€œCocaine Bear,â€ which have yet to be released. At the time of his death, Liotta was filming â€œDangerous Waters,â€ a thriller co-starring Eric Dane and Odeya Rush. He died in his sleep in the Dominican Republic, where that movie was being shot. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Weird Al' Yankovic's Raucous 'God Save The Queen' Is The Perfect Royal Antidote
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Royal fatigue may be setting in because the Sex Pistolsâ€™ legendary anti-royal anthem â€œGod Save The Queenâ€ just reached the top of the British singles charts â€• 45 years after it was released. The band rereleased the track to coincide with Queen Elizabethâ€™s Platinum Jubilee celebration. On its initial 1977 release â€• during the queenâ€™s Silver Jubilee â€• the song peaked at number 2 on the charts despite being banned for poor taste. But thereâ€™s another version of the track that was created during a different royal event thatâ€™s also worth celebrating. And itâ€™s by â€œWeird Alâ€ Yankovic. â€œThis is kind of inappropriate the day after a royal wedding,â€ Yankovic joked before launching into the song at a concert in Napa, California on May 20, 2018, one day after Prince Harryâ€™s wedding to Meghan Markle. The track is from his Ridiculously Self-Indulgent Ill-Advised Vanity Tour, in which he largely eschewed the parodies heâ€™s best known for in favor of his original music. Listen as his band â€• famed for being able to mimic just about any style â€• goes punk while Yankovic breaks out his best growl, even rolling his â€œrâ€ just as Johnny Rotten (John Lydon) did on the original: Yankovic is currently on the road with The Unfortunate Return of The Ridiculously Self-Indulgent Ill-Advised Vanity Tour, and heâ€™s once again focusing on his originals (and performing a straight cover toward the end of every show). Lydon, for his part, has insisted heâ€™s not against the queen as a person, only the monarchy as an institution. He even offered congrats to Queen Elizabeth for the jubilee. â€œGod bless the Queen,â€ Lydon wrote in an op-ed earlier this month. â€œSheâ€™s put up with a lot.â€ Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Man Who Filmed Self Screaming His Name In Capitol Riot Sentenced
content: Reporter, HuffPost Former West Virginia state lawmaker Derrick Evans was sentenced to three months on Wednesday for his part in the U.S. Capitol attack last year. Evans had livestreamed himself joining the throng of Donald Trump supporters as some individuals smashed their way into the building and then opened the Rotunda doors for the rest of the mob. He narrated his exploits as he went along, shouting â€œTrump,â€ â€œThe doorâ€™s cracked,â€ and â€œWeâ€™re goinâ€™ in!â€ â€œWeâ€™re in! Derrick Evans is in the Capitol!â€ he said once he made it though the doors. Evans later deleted the video, but it featured prominently in prosecutorsâ€™ case against him. After initially pleading not guilty, defending himself by saying he â€œcommitted no criminal act,â€ Evans took a plea deal. He told Judge Royce C. Lamberth that he accepts responsibility for his actions, seated nearby a large Evans family photo, according to NBC News. Lamberth reportedly wished Evans well, telling him that he considered sentencing Evans to six months behind bars. Evansâ€™ attorney had asked for no jail time. â€œI just canâ€™t give you probation in a case like this ... it doesnâ€™t reflect the feeling in the country,â€ the judge said, according to CBS News reporter Rob Legare. â€œI donâ€™t want another riot in the next election,â€ Lamberth added. At the time of the riot, the father of four had recently been elected to represent West Virginians in the stateâ€™s House of Delegates. Three days later, he was forced to resign. After releasing a very brief statement announcing his resignation, Evans released a second, slightly longer statement expressing regret, writing, â€œI take full responsibility for my actions, and deeply regret any hurt, pain or embarrassment I may have caused my family, friends, constituents and fellow West Virginians.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' Asks Hollywood Boulevard To Identify Odd Stuff â€” And It Gets Weird
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ sought some street wisdom from people on Hollywood Boulevard Monday to identify odd items. (Check out the video below.) In a game of â€œWhat Is This Thing?â€ inspired by Reddit, passersby were shown several products and guessed that they were a â€œpenis protector,â€ an â€œanal openerâ€ and even a slingshot. No, â€œeel killerâ€ didnâ€™t come to us either. Watch the weirdness: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Beavis And Butt-Head Do The Universe' Clip Reunites Duo In â€˜Dumbest Sci-Fi Movie Everâ€™
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost The troublesome pair are back in a new futuristic flick. â€œBeavis and Butt-Head Do the Universe,â€ which will debut on Paramount+ on June 23, follows the animated slackers as they embark on a space mission with NASA for what the creators of the film are calling the â€œdumbest science fiction movie ever made.â€ A sneak peak of the movie debuted at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards on Sunday: An exclusive clip from #BeavisandButtHead Do the Universe? COMING RIGHT UP ğŸ¬  #MTVAwards pic.twitter.com/xTt4skBix3 In the film, Beavis and Butt-Head are sentenced to space camp in 1998, and after getting sucked into a black hole, find themselves 24 years into the future. The pair get into a series of hijinks, including struggling to use iPhones and failing to pick up any babes. The crass characters, originally created by Mike Judge for the MTV animated anthology series â€œLiquid Television,â€ last appeared on the big screen in the 1996 film â€œBeavis and Butt-Head Do America.â€ The â€œBeavis and Butt-Headâ€ show, which aired from 1993 to 1997, returned for a one-season revival in 2011. Judge announced the latest installment in the animated franchise earlier this year on Twitter alongside a behind-the-scenes preview of the artwork: Beavis and Butt-Head will be returning this year with a brand new movie and more on Paramount+. No exact date yet, but soon. They need some time to get back in shape. pic.twitter.com/tN5rePP9Kn In 2020, Comedy Central announced its plans to reboot the popular series. Judge signed on to create episodes, spin-offs and specials, which are still in the works. Judge, who directed and wrote the movie, also reprises his role as the voice of Beavis and Butt-Head, in the reboot. Paramount+ also announced plans to add the full library of the showâ€™s original run on the same day â€œBeavis and Butt-Head Do the Universeâ€ drops on the streaming platform. Watch the full trailer below: Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Dave Chappelle Donates All Proceeds From Buffalo Show To Families Of Mass Shooting Victims
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Dave Chappelle is donating all proceeds from his show in Buffalo, New York on Sunday to honor the families of the 10 people slain in last monthâ€™s racially-motivated mass shooting at a supermarket. Before wrapping up his performance at Sheaâ€™s Performing Arts Center, Chappelle, who booked a last-minute show in Buffalo, made the announcement on-stage. â€œHe said, and Iâ€™m paraphrasing, (he) came here to Buffalo to recognize the victims and for these families,â€ said Kevin Sweeney, director of marketing and communications for Sheaâ€™s Performing Arts Center. At the end of his set, Chappelle acknowledged the family members of the victims who were in the audience per his invitation. Saw @DaveChappelle last night! Great show and he donated all proceeds to families of the shooting at Tops in Buffalo â™¥ï¸ pic.twitter.com/5Li2Yn2icJ The show was a spur of the moment, according to Sweeney. â€œItâ€™s my understanding that heâ€™ll do things last-minute,â€ he added. Sweeney said his team was â€œnotified on Wednesdayâ€ about the performance. Tickets went on sale on the Live Nation website at 10 a.m. on Saturday and were completely sold out within an hour. HuffPost has reached out to Chappelleâ€™s rep for further details. Last month, an 18-year-old opened fire outside and inside the Tops Friendly Market, killing 10 people. The market is in a predominantly Black neighborhood in Buffalo. Following the deadly mass shooting, it was revealed that the gunman lived about 200 miles outside of the area and had documented in a diary that he intended on livestreaming an attack on Black people. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Trevante Rhodes Is Mike Tyson In Fighting Form On New Hulu Series
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Trevante Rhodes is ready to duke it out as boxer Mike Tyson in the first footage of a new and unauthorized series about the heavyweight championâ€™s life. Hulu on Wednesday gave fans a first look at the â€œMoonlightâ€ actor in fighting form with the release of a teaser for â€œMike,â€ due out Aug. 25. The eight-episode series is billed as a â€œno-holds-barred lookâ€ at Tyson, both in and out of the ring, and promises to be â€œone wild ride.â€ According to press notes, â€œMikeâ€ also â€œexamines class in America, race in America, fame and the power of media, misogyny, the wealth divide, the promise of the American Dream and ultimately our own role in shaping [Tysonâ€™s] story.â€ Catch the teaser for â€œMikeâ€ below. By all accounts, Tyson is a divisive figure in pop culture at large. In 1992, the New York native was convicted of rape and sentenced to six years in prison, serving three. His boxing license was briefly revoked in 1997 after he bit off a part of opponent Evander Holyfieldâ€™s ear during a match. From the looks of the clip, â€œMikeâ€ wonâ€™t shy away from any of those controversies. And series screenwriter Steven Rogers is known for capturing the nuances of complicated athletes. His screenplay for 2017â€™s â€œI, Tonya,â€ about disgraced Olympic figure skater Tonya Harding, received numerous accolades and a BAFTA Award nomination. Speaking to Entertainment Weekly, Rogers said he wanted to present Tyson as a â€œcompelling, contradictory, and complexâ€ figure, not a heroic one. â€œI think the thing people responded to in â€˜I, Tonyaâ€™ was, we took a story everyone thought they knew and we tried to show thereâ€™s much more to it than just the sound bites the media gives us,â€ he said. â€œIn some ways, [Tysonâ€™s life is] a cautionary tale of the American Dream.â€ â€œYou can find the roots of a lot of issues weâ€™re grappling with today like #MeToo, Black Lives Matter, prison reform, mental health issues in it,â€ he added. â€œIt seemed like a good time to tell it.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Steve-O Goes Full â€˜Jackassâ€™ On Ryan Reynolds At The MTV Movie & TV Awards
content: Reporter, HuffPost At least Ryan Reynolds didnâ€™t ask Steve-o to show him how to chug a live goldfish and then throw it back up. Reynolds won the award for Best Comedic Performance for his film â€œFree Guyâ€ at the MTV Movie & TV Awards Sunday night. Although the actor didnâ€™t attend the ceremony, he sent a prerecorded acceptance speech that was delivered by Steve-o of â€œJackassâ€ fame. â€œHey MTV, Iâ€™m Steve-o, accepting this award on Ryan Reynoldsâ€™ behalf because sadly, he wasnâ€™t just unable to appear in person, he canâ€™t even do his video acceptance speech,â€ Steve-o said: Comedy at its finest ğŸ‘ You voted and @VancityReynolds won Best Comedic Performance at the #MTVAwards! pic.twitter.com/GUd3uqK9pn Steve-o then thanked a bunch of Reynoldsâ€™ co-stars from â€œFree Guy,â€ including Jodie Comer, Lil Rel Howery and Joe Keery. As Steve-o struggled to remember Utkarsh Ambudkarâ€™s last name, the camera panned back to reveal Reynolds texting in the background. â€œAmbudkar,â€ Reynolds said. â€œSuper talented.â€ After Steve-o talked about how personal making â€œFree Guyâ€ was for Reynolds, he asked the actor if there was anything else heâ€™d like to include in the acceptance speech. â€œNo,â€ Reynolds said, â€œI just want you to kick me in the balls.â€ To see what transpires, check out the video above. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Tim Burton Roasts Warner Bros. Over Batsuit, Reflects On â€˜Batman Returnsâ€™ 30th Anniversary
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Director Tim Burton is opening up about his rift with Warner Bros. amid the â€œBatman Returnsâ€ 30th anniversary. During a recent interview with Empire magazine, the fantasy and gothic visionary ripped the entertainment company that had replaced him for the third film after declaring â€œBatman Returnsâ€ was â€œtoo dark.â€ Despite the 1992 movieâ€™s popularity, Warner Bros. decided to nix Burton from directing any more movies about the caped crusader and swapped him with Joel Schumacher for â€œBatman Foreverâ€ and â€œBatman & Robin.â€ â€œThey went the other way,â€ said Burton. â€œThatâ€™s the funny thing about it. But then I was like, â€˜Wait a minute. Okay. Hold on a second here. You complain about me, Iâ€™m too weird, Iâ€™m too dark, and then you put nipples on the costume? Go fuck yourself.â€™ Seriously. So, yeah, I think thatâ€™s why I didnâ€™t end upâ€ doing a third film. Nodding to the newest installment of the franchise, this yearâ€™s edgy rendition of Gothamâ€™s protector from Matt Reeves, â€œThe Batmanâ€ demonstrated just how deranged the character could get. Burton pointed out the irony of the latest film, telling Empire: â€œIt is funny to see this now, because all these memories come back of, â€˜Itâ€™s too dark,â€™ So, it makes me laugh a little bit.â€ Even though â€œBatman Returnsâ€ has its share of ballsy moments (exploding penguins and latex galore), Burton said he appreciates the film beyond just the darkness itâ€™s been popularized for. â€œIâ€™m not just overly dark. That represents me in the sense thatâ€¦ thatâ€™s how I see things. Itâ€™s not meant as pure darkness. Thereâ€™s a mixture,â€ he said. â€œI feel really fondly about it because of the weird experiment that it felt like.â€ Revisit the â€œBatman Returnsâ€ trailer below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: topic
content: content

topic: â€˜Fire Islandâ€™ Remixes A Classic Jane Austen Tale â€” While Blazing Its Own Path
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost The long journey of getting â€œFire Islandâ€ to the screen began with some vacation reading. In the summer of 2015, comedians and friends Joel Kim Booster and Bowen Yang went to Fire Island, the gay mecca off the coast of Long Island, New York. Booster brought a copy of Jane Austenâ€™s â€œPride and Prejudiceâ€ to read during the trip. â€œAs I was reading it on the island, it really struck me that Austenâ€™s observations about class and the ways in which people interact with each other across class lines felt really prescient and really current to me, especially in the setting that we were in,â€ Booster said in an interview. Austenâ€™s characters are often subtle and petty in their cruelty, â€œin ways that leaves them plausible deniability about how cruel theyâ€™re actually being,â€ he said. â€œI think itâ€™s very current. I mean, itâ€™s shade, you know?â€ Once Booster saw the parallels between the rigid social dynamics and unspoken rules that Austen critiques in her novels and the ones that play out every summer on Fire Island, he couldnâ€™t unsee them. That became the basis for â€œFire Island,â€ which Booster wrote and stars in as Noah, a character inspired by Austenâ€™s Elizabeth Bennet. Noah is also the movieâ€™s narrator, guiding the audience through the islandâ€™s social scene, which is rife with classism and racism. As he explains at a party early in the movie: â€œA lot of people think you have to be successful, white and rich, with 7% body fat, to vacation on Fire Island. Those people are all at this party.â€ â€œFire Island,â€ premiering on Hulu on Friday, continues the great tradition of movies that cleverly remix Austen tropes into modern retellings, like â€œBridget Jonesâ€™ Diaryâ€ and â€œClueless.â€ The latter was a north star for Booster when writing â€œFire Island.â€ At the same time, the movie is charting a new path. Released just in time for Pride Month, â€œFire Islandâ€ is a rom-com with four queer Asian American stars: Booster and Yang as best friends Noah and Howie, Conrad Ricamora as Noahâ€™s Mr. Darcy-like love interest Will, and Margaret Cho as Erin, who serves as a matriarch to Noah, Howie and their friends. Erin has fallen on hard times and is about to lose her modest house, where Noah and Howieâ€™s friend group stays every summer. By contrast, Will and his mostly white, finance bro friends have much fancier digs. The movieâ€™s release marks the beginning of a big June for Booster, who joked: â€œItâ€™s going to be the month of Joel. If I make it to the end of the month, if I survive it, it will be a miracle.â€ He also co-stars in the new Apple TV+ comedy series â€œLoot,â€ premiering June 24 and created by TV comedy veterans Alan Yang and Matt Hubbard. Maya Rudolph stars as the ex-wife of a tech CEO. She decides to apply her massive fortune toward charitable causes (Ã  la MacKenzie Scott). Booster plays her loyal and long-suffering assistant, helping her navigate her new lifestyle and redefine her public image. That same week, on June 21, Netflix will release â€œJoel Kim Booster: Psychosexual,â€ his first filmed stand-up special since 2017. â€œPart of the reason I think I waited so long to do another special was because, for me, stand-up specials are really tricky because I didnâ€™t want it to just be, like, my show with three cameras,â€ he said. Instead, he wanted to try â€œmaking it feel almost like a meta-commentary on the idea of shooting a stand-up special,â€ such as showing his interactions with the crowd and talking directly to the camera crew. â€œI didnâ€™t want to just pretend the cameras werenâ€™t there.â€ â€œIt might work. It might be a huge failure,â€ Booster said. â€œBut I think comedy specials are, for me anyways, the perfect place to experiment with stuff thatâ€™s not just your regular show.â€ In some ways, â€œFire Islandâ€ also began kind of experimentally. At first, the idea was a running joke. Every time Booster and his friends returned to Fire Island, he continued noticing the parallels between the social mores on the island and those of Austenâ€™s world. â€œI kept jokingly being like, â€˜Oh, wouldnâ€™t it be funny if I wrote a â€˜Pride and Prejudiceâ€™ adaptation that took place on Fire Island?â€™â€ Booster said. â€œAnd everyone was like, â€˜That sounds really dumb.â€™ And I was like, â€˜Yeah, but like, it would be funny, right?â€™â€ A few years later, Penguin Random House asked him to write an essay about Austenâ€™s enduring power, in which he wrote about those observations heâ€™d collected on Fire Island. When Booster was between a couple of stalled projects, his agent suggested writing a movie or TV show based on the essay. Booster initially bristled at the idea, thinking heâ€™d â€œget dragged so hard for writing â€˜Gay Pride and Prejudice.â€™â€ Then, one day, while bored on a long flight, he opened his laptop, and out came a half-hour pilot script. No one was really interested in it, except for Quibi. At the time, he was starring in the sadly short-lived NBC sitcom â€œSunnyside,â€ and according to Booster, his contract delineated he couldnâ€™t do other TV work. But because Quibi â€œtechnically wasnâ€™t TV, it technically wasnâ€™t really a movie, there was a lot of gray area in terms of my contract with NBC,â€ Booster said. â€œSo we went with Quibi, and the rest is history.â€ (RIP, Quibi.) In 2021, Searchlight Pictures bought the project, and it was reborn as a feature film, with Andrew Ahn coming on board as director. Ahn, who, like Booster, is gay and Korean American, loved how Boosterâ€™s script was all about queer joy and friendship. â€œI really wanted to make something that showed the experience of being gay and Asian American and silly with your best group of friends,â€ Ahn said, noting that he had already â€œmade my sad gay Asian American movieâ€ with his directorial debut â€œSpa Night.â€ â€œItâ€™s something that Iâ€™ve done before and I think is really valuable and Iâ€™ll probably do again, because yeah, itâ€™s important to acknowledge the difficulties. With â€˜Fire Island,â€™ thatâ€™s definitely a part of the film,â€ Ahn said. â€œBut the main focus really is the joy. And that for me is also so valuable, so Iâ€™m really glad that I could get this opportunity to really focus on that.â€ In developing the look and feel of â€œFire Island,â€ Ahn turned to stories about great friends and comedies that blend humor with â€œa lot of heart and humanity,â€ including â€œThe Wedding Banquet,â€ â€œRomy and Micheleâ€™s High School Reunion,â€ and â€œBroad City.â€ While Booster and Ahn sought to make something new and one of a kind, itâ€™s impossible not to be inspired by the many Austen adaptations and modern retellings. â€œThe source material is so good, and the adaptations have been so good. It would be foolish of us to throw that out the window and try and, like, create something from scratch,â€ Ahn said. In the all-important debate over the two most famous â€œPride and Prejudiceâ€ screen adaptations, Booster said heâ€™s a â€œBBC miniseries loyalist,â€ referring to the 1995 Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle version. Ahn prefers the 2005 film adaptation, starring Keira Knightley and Matthew Macfadyen and directed by Joe Wright. The latter was particularly influential in creating the will-they-wonâ€™t-they tension between Noah and Will. For instance, another parallel between Austenâ€™s world and the islandâ€™s social scene is that â€œthe big marquee moments happen at parties,â€ Booster said. The â€œFire Islandâ€ version of Austenâ€™s Netherfield Ball is the movieâ€™s recreation of the islandâ€™s famed underwear party, where Noah and Will find themselves dancing together, getting closer and closer. Booster wrote the scene after he and Ahn remembered a moment from Wrightâ€™s adaptation â€œwhen Darcy is helping Elizabeth into a carriage, and itâ€™s very subtle. Theyâ€™re just touching hands. But it is this moment of such electricity,â€ Booster said. â€œAnd itâ€™s so clear that despite what they might think about each other, there is an undeniable chemistry between these two people and undeniable attraction.â€ Therefore, Noah and Will similarly needed that moment where they â€œfeel a certain chemistry, even if they donâ€™t totally understand it,â€ Ahn said. In addition to Austen tropes, â€œFire Islandâ€ also cleverly references classic rom-com tropes. Thereâ€™s the enemies-to-lovers plotline. There are meet-cutes and pratfalls. Someone will write a letter. Someone will attempt a grand (and potentially colossally stupid) romantic gesture. There may be some kissing in the rain. As Booster said, thereâ€™s something classic about â€œthe juxtaposition of feeling miserable but still feeling sexy.â€ â€œI grew up and still do worship at the altar of Nora Ephron. I love classic rom-coms, I grew up watching them,â€ Booster said. â€œThey completely colonized my brain in a very specific way that made dating and actually falling in love very difficult because I had such high expectations for what that should look like and what that should feel like.â€ In â€œFire Island,â€ Howie embodies that conflict, trying to fight his idealized rom-com impulses about love â€” but eventually giving in to them. By contrast, Noah, whoâ€™s a bit more cynical and pragmatic, represents â€œthe more grounded side of myself,â€ Booster said. â€œItâ€™s like, â€˜Where is this going? What are we doing?â€™ And the magic of Fire Island is overriding those more logical impulses in the character.â€ Howie gets his classic rom-com ending, while Booster wanted Noah and Willâ€™s budding romance to end with more ambiguity. The two, who live in different cities, now have to figure out how to make their relationship work. Ironically, as with the idea for the movie, real life intervened. Booster changed the ending after he, like Noah, met his now-boyfriend while on vacation. â€œI just thought it was a more honest way to end on the ambiguity of â€˜Whatâ€™s next?â€™â€ he said. By giving its characters the best of both worlds, â€œFire Islandâ€ nods toward the neat and pat endings of Austen novels, which typically end with happily ever after, and conventional rom-coms, which often end that way, too. However, it also recognizes that real life is more complicated. Magical vacations have to end â€” but they can also be new beginnings. â€œFire Islandâ€ premieres on Hulu on Friday. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Michael B. Jordan, Lori Harvey Reportedly Call It Quits After Over 1 Year Together
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost The internetâ€™s cutest couple, Michael B. Jordan and Lori Harvey, have closed the curtains on their relationship after dating for more than a year and a half. The modelâ€™s father, Steve Harvey, confirmed the breakup on Mondayâ€™s episode of â€œThe Steve Harvey Morning Show,â€ saying he was â€œTeam Lori, 1,000%.â€ He didnâ€™t offer much in the way of detail of why they ended their relationship, which started in November 2020. Calling Jordan a â€œcool guy,â€ the host shared, â€œIâ€™m pretty sure theyâ€™ll be fine. People break up all the time.â€ Rumors began to surface on Saturday that Jordan and Lori Harvey broke up, and People verified the news the same day. â€œMichael and Lori are both completely heartbroken,â€ a source close to the couple told People. â€œThey still love each other.â€ The source explained, â€œMichael matured a lot over the course of their relationship and was ready to commit for the long term. He let down his guard with her, opening up emotionally in a romantic relationship for the first time...They had great times together and brought out the best in each other.â€ A post shared by Michael B. Jordan (@michaelbjordan) The stylish duo officially announced their relationship and became â€œInstagram officialâ€ in January of 2021. The two were not shy about sharing their love on social media and celebrated their first anniversary in November. A month later, in an interview with The Hollywood Reporter, Jordan confessed his love for Harvey and expressed how the relationship positively influenced his life. â€œLong story short, I think itâ€™s just the timing of everything. It was the right time for me,â€ he said, smiling. â€œYeah. Iâ€™m happy.â€ â€œI finally found what love was,â€ the leading man added. It appeared Harvey shared the same love for Jordan, telling the ladies of â€œThe Realâ€ back in September, â€œwhen you know, you know.â€ â€œWe just really balance each other,â€ Harvey said at the time. â€œI really do believe in the statement when they say, â€˜When you know you know.â€™ And I think that really applies to our situation and we just have a really good time together.â€ However, last month, Harvey was spotted solo in Cannes for the screening of â€œFinal Cut (Coupez!)â€, which sparked rumors that things were rocky between the pair. Neither Jordan nor Harvey had publicly addressed the news as of Monday morning, but the SKN founder appears to have deleted all trace of Jordanâ€™s presence from her Instagram after news of their split broke. Photos of the two remain on Jordanâ€™s Instagram page, including a tribute from March to their extravagant night at the Vanity Fair Oscar party. A post shared by Michael B. Jordan (@michaelbjordan) On Sunday, Jordan was spotted  at the 2022 NBA Finals in San Francisco with rapper Cordae. Steve Harvey previously told the Ellen Show that he was happy for his daughter. On Monday, the host noted the challenges of trying to have a successful relationship in the public eye. â€œLook, as long as everybody can walk away in peace, be friends ... I ainâ€™t heard nobody say they busted no windows or nothing,â€ he said. â€œAs long as you donâ€™t put your hands on my daughter, I donâ€™t give a damn what you do.â€ Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Trevor Noah Roasts CNN For Overusing Breaking News Alerts: 'Boy Who Cried Wolf'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Trevor Noah poked fun at CNN on Tuesday for overusing its breaking news banner after its new leader directed staffers to cut back on the practice. â€œFor years, CNN has been notorious for overhyping every story like itâ€™s the zombie apocalypse,â€ â€œThe Daily Showâ€ host said. â€œItâ€™s like, â€˜BREAKING NEWS: The midterm elections are now six months away!â€™â€ â€œAnd not surprisingly, this approach has started to backfire, as viewers have learned to tune it out. Like the boy who cried wolf. Or in this case, the Wolf who cried wolf,â€ Noah added, as an image of veteran CNN anchor Wolf Blitzer appeared on screen. Chris Licht, the new chairman of CNN, recently told employees that moving forward, the breaking news banner would be reserved only for major news, according to The New York Times. CNN updated its standards guide to state that a story must qualify as â€œâ€˜Stop what you are doing and watchâ€™ newsâ€ to secure the â€œBreaking Newsâ€ label. Watch Noahâ€™s roast below: Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Adam Sandler Says His Black Eye Was The Result Of A 'Bed Accident'
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Adam Sandler is on the mend after what he described as an unusual incident involving a hotel bed and his cell phone. The Golden Globe- and Emmy-nominated actor stopped by â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ on Monday to promote his new movie, â€œHustle.â€ Before he could chat about the film, however, he was asked by co-host Michael Strahan to explain a bruise and scab that had formed just below his left eye. The incident, Sandler explained, had taken place as he attempted to retrieve his phone in the middle of the night. â€œSomebody tucked in the sheets too much,â€ he said. â€œI had my phone in the middle of the bed. I kicked my feet up [to] untuck it. The phone went flying, hit me in the head.â€ Watch Adam Sandlerâ€™s â€œGood Morning Americaâ€ appearance below. Though Sandler said he â€œfelt bloodâ€ immediately afterward, he â€œrefused to acknowledgeâ€ his wound until the next morning. â€œThereâ€™s nothing cool about this thing,â€ he quipped. â€œWhen Iâ€™m on the streets of New York, I see people going: â€˜Oh, OK. He likes to fight, that guy.â€™ Iâ€™m like: â€˜It was a bed accident.â€™â€ Sandlerâ€™s injury was a hot topic yet again during his Monday night appearance on â€œThe Tonight Show,â€ during which he shared some slightly more gruesome details with host Jimmy Fallon. â€œI was bleeding terribly,â€ he said. â€œIt was pitch black in the room and I feel wetness and I go, â€˜Yes, Iâ€™m gonna trick myself. Those are probably just thick tears.â€™ ... I didnâ€™t want to get up because I was tired. And I was like: â€˜Ah, weâ€™ll fix that later.â€™ Then I woke up, it was horrible. There was blood on the bed and all that stuff.â€ In better news, Sandler is winning raves for his role in the basketball drama â€œHustle,â€ which hits Netflix Wednesday. The Hollywood Reporter praised the movieâ€™s â€œdepth of feelingâ€ and â€œdisarming sincerity,â€ while the Los Angeles Times compared Sandlerâ€™s performance favorably to that of Tom Cruise in 1996â€™s â€œJerry Maguire.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Man Who Filmed Self Screaming His Name In Capitol Riot Sentenced
content: Reporter, HuffPost Former West Virginia state lawmaker Derrick Evans was sentenced to three months on Wednesday for his part in the U.S. Capitol attack last year. Evans had livestreamed himself joining the throng of Donald Trump supporters as some individuals smashed their way into the building and then opened the Rotunda doors for the rest of the mob. He narrated his exploits as he went along, shouting â€œTrump,â€ â€œThe doorâ€™s cracked,â€ and â€œWeâ€™re goinâ€™ in!â€ â€œWeâ€™re in! Derrick Evans is in the Capitol!â€ he said once he made it though the doors. Evans later deleted the video, but it featured prominently in prosecutorsâ€™ case against him. After initially pleading not guilty, defending himself by saying he â€œcommitted no criminal act,â€ Evans took a plea deal. He told Judge Royce C. Lamberth that he accepts responsibility for his actions, seated nearby a large Evans family photo, according to NBC News. Lamberth reportedly wished Evans well, telling him that he considered sentencing Evans to six months behind bars. Evansâ€™ attorney had asked for no jail time. â€œI just canâ€™t give you probation in a case like this ... it doesnâ€™t reflect the feeling in the country,â€ the judge said, according to CBS News reporter Rob Legare. â€œI donâ€™t want another riot in the next election,â€ Lamberth added. At the time of the riot, the father of four had recently been elected to represent West Virginians in the stateâ€™s House of Delegates. Three days later, he was forced to resign. After releasing a very brief statement announcing his resignation, Evans released a second, slightly longer statement expressing regret, writing, â€œI take full responsibility for my actions, and deeply regret any hurt, pain or embarrassment I may have caused my family, friends, constituents and fellow West Virginians.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Woman's Lost Dachshund Is Found ... In Hilary Swank's Lap
content: ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) â€” Chelsea Blackwellâ€™s dachshund, Blue, disappeared Monday, and the distraught owner went in search. But when she came upon a line of squad cars and people with cameras near the Greyhound bus station, she set aside her search to investigate. â€œI noticed there were like eight police cars and people with cameras â€” I thought maybe somebody got shot,â€ Blackwell told her local paper, the Times Union. Fortunately, tragedy did not lurk â€” Blackwell had stumbled upon a movie crew â€” but ended in a one-in-a-million lucky happenstance. Long story short: Her dog of 15 years was found â€” by a movie star with a history of rescuing dogs. You wonâ€™t believe this, the crew told her, but a celebrity had found her pooch. â€œI asked them if anyone saw a little brown dog, and they said, â€˜Yes, weâ€™ll call her.â€™â€ An hour later, a gray car pulled up, and there was tiny Blue sitting in the lap of two-time Oscar winner Hilary Swank. â€œI was like, â€˜No way,â€™â€ Blackwell said. â€œAs soon as she got out of the car, I kissed Blue and said, â€˜Thank you so much.â€™â€ Blackwell asked Swank for her autograph, but Swank did better: They took a picture. And Blackwell, wanting to be sure Swank got proper credit, posted the photo on Facebook. â€œIâ€™d stopped and asked if someone seen a little brown dog? A man walked over to my car and said, yes, this woman picked him up,â€ she wrote in her post. â€œI said who? He replied, a celebrity,â€ Blackwell wrote. â€œHe called the person who had him. And they said sheâ€™s on her way back. Youâ€™ll never guess who had him?â€ The Million Dollar Baby herself. â€œSheâ€™s not the type of person,â€ Blackwell said, â€œwhoâ€™s going to blow the horn telling people what she did.â€ Swank is no stranger to rescuing dogs. â€œEvery dog Iâ€™ve ever rescued and also shared my life with have all had their unique way of being in the world,â€ said Swank, who has adopted numerous dogs, in a YouTube video posted by People magazine. Swank established a foundation, Hilaroo â€” a portmanteau of her name and the name of a dog she adopted, Karoo â€” that matches abandoned dogs with children whom the foundation says â€œhave been given up on by society.â€

topic: Biden Jokes With Kimmel About Republican Rule-Breakers: 'You Gotta Send 'Em To Jail'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost President Joe Biden told Jimmy Kimmel he wonâ€™t bend the rules, as some Republicans do, because if he does, â€œour democracy will literally be in jeopardy.â€ The â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ host asked Biden during an in-studio interview Wednesday whether he would consider issuing an executive order in response to gun violence, considering how former President Donald Trump â€œpassed those out like Halloween candyâ€ during his tenure. â€œI have issued executive orders within the power of the presidency to be able to deal with these, everything having to do with guns and gun ownership ... all the things that are within my power,â€ Biden replied. â€œWhat I donâ€™t want to do â€• and Iâ€™m not being facetious â€• I donâ€™t want to emulate Trumpâ€™s abuse of the Constitution and the constitutional authority.â€ â€œI often get asked: Look, the Republicans donâ€™t play it square. Why do you play it square? Yeah, well, guess what? If we do the same thing they do, our democracy will literally be in jeopardy,â€ he said. Kimmel pushed back, saying he understood the argument but said it was like playing Monopoly with someone who wonâ€™t play by the rules. â€œHow do you ever make any progress if theyâ€™re not following the rules?â€ he asked. â€œYou gotta send â€™em to jail,â€ Biden replied. President @JoeBiden on issuing an Executive Order in response to gun violenceâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/KUXsyNfZrW Bidenâ€™s appearance on the show marked his first in-studio late-night appearance as president. He taped the interview in Los Angeles during his visit for the Summit of the Americas. His first late-night interview as president was in December, when he virtually appeared on â€œThe Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson Reveals Intense Superhero Look In 'Black Adam' Trailer
content: Dwayne â€œThe Rockâ€ Johnson has debuted a fierce superhero look in the trailer for his upcoming DC Comics film â€œBlack Adam.â€ The flick follows the anti-hero of the same name who â€“ after roughly 5,000 years of imprisonment â€“ becomes free to â€œunleash his unique form of justice on the modern world,â€ according to the trailerâ€™s description. Johnson expressed interest in playing the character in 2007 and was set to make his first DC Extended Universe appearance in the 2019 superhero film â€œShazam!,â€ a film about Black Adamâ€™s enemy. Those plans, however, were scrapped in favor of the spinoff film for Johnsonâ€™s character. Watch the trailer for â€œBlack Adam,â€ set for an October 19 release date, below: â€œBlack Adamâ€ marks one of two superhero movies expected to feature Johnson in 2022. He is also going to provide the voice of Supermanâ€™s dog Krypto in the upcoming film â€œDC League of Super-Pets.â€ â€œBlack Adamâ€ is directed by Jaume Collet-Serra, who directed â€œJungle Cruiseâ€ featuring Johnson last year. In an interview with Variety, Collet-Serra called Black Adam the â€œDirty Harry of superheroesâ€ in a reference to the 1971 Clint Eastwood thriller.

topic: Stephen Colbert Spots Toughest Part Of Prison For Trump-Loving Proud Boy Rioters
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Stephen Colbert celebrated the indictments against five members of the far-right street gang called the Proud Boys for their alleged role in the Jan. 6, 2021 assault on the U.S. Capitol. The â€œLate Showâ€ host noted on Tuesday that the charges for seditious conspiracy carry maximum potential sentences of up to 20 years in prison. â€œI gotta tell you,â€ he said, â€œseeing those guys arrested makes this boy proud.â€ But Colbert also mentioned some unusual rules the gang has, such as only being allowed to masturbate once a month. â€œThatâ€™s gonna make those 20 years in prison seem pretty long,â€ he cracked. â€œBut I do understand why theyâ€™re so angry.â€ See more in his Tuesday night monologue: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Johnny Depp To Release Joint Album With Jeff Beck Next Month
content: NEW YORK (AP) â€” Fresh off his legal battle with his ex-wife, Johnny Depp has announced that he and legendary guitarist Jeff Beck will release an album of mostly covers next month. The duoâ€™s 13-track album is titled â€œ18â€ and will drop on July 15. They said they titled the album after the creative outburst they felt working together. â€œWe would joke about how we felt 18 again, so that just became the album title, too,â€ Beck said in a statement. The album contains covers of The Velvet Undergroundâ€™s â€œVenus In Furs,â€ the Everly Brothersâ€™ ballad â€œLet It Be Meâ€ and Marvin Gayeâ€™s soul classic â€œWhatâ€™s Going On.â€ There also are versions of Davy Spillaneâ€™s â€œMidnight Walkerâ€ and two songs from the Beach Boysâ€™ masterpiece, â€œPet Soundsâ€ â€” â€œCaroline, Noâ€ and â€œDonâ€™t Talk (Put Your Head On My Shoulder).â€ Depp supplied two originals, including â€œThis Is A Song For Miss Hedy Lamarr,â€ the setâ€™s first single. The cover of the album â€” a sketch of two young men in white T-shirts â€” was designed by Beckâ€™s wife, Sandra. Depp, long a member of the rock group Hollywood Vampires with Alice Cooper and Joe Perry, started recording with Beck in 2019, and Depp has joined Beckâ€™s current European tour. Earlier this month, a jury sided with Depp in his defamation lawsuit against ex-wife Amber Heard, awarding the â€œPirates of the Caribbeanâ€ actor more than $10 million and vindicating his allegations that Heard defamed him by accusing him of abusing her before and during their brief marriage. But in a split decision, the jury also found that Heard was defamed by one of Deppâ€™s lawyers, who accused her of creating a detailed hoax that included roughing up the coupleâ€™s apartment to look worse for police. The jury awarded her $2 million.

topic: 'Ms. Marvel' Star Reveals 'Super Sketchy' Way She Found Out About The Job
content: The star of â€œMs. Marvelâ€ earned her breakthrough role after receiving a â€œsuper sketchyâ€ message from a family member. Iman Vellani, a 19-year-old Pakistani-Canadian actor, will play Ms. Marvel (a.k.a. Kamala Khan) â€• the first Muslim superhero in the Marvel Cinematic Universe â€• in the new coming-of-age Disney+ series of the same name. Khan is a Pakistani-American girl and fan of superheroes who has â€œan oversized imagination â€“ particularly when it comes to Captain Marvel,â€ per Disney+â€™s description of the series. On â€œThe Tonight Showâ€ Tuesday, Vellani told host Jimmy Fallon how she landed her first acting role after graduating high school. â€œMy aunt forwarded me a WhatsApp of the casting call. Super sketchy, I donâ€™t know what casting calls look like but Iâ€™m like obsessed with Marvel [Comics], Iâ€™m obsessed with â€˜Ms. Marvel,â€™ I read all the comics in high school, dressed up as her on Halloween,â€ Vellani said. After she sent in a self-recorded audition tape for the role, Vellani received the Zoom call that would eventually lead to the superhero role: Vellani will also play Khan in â€œThe Marvels,â€ a Marvel film set for 2023. Sana Amanat, who co-created the Khan character, told Empire how Vellani showed interest in the character during a Zoom audition. â€œShe showed me every corner of her room and it was covered with Avengers,â€ Amanat said. â€œThen she said, â€˜Oh wait, Iâ€™m not done,â€™ opened up her closet and there was more Marvel everywhere.â€ Watch Vellaniâ€™s full interview with Fallon below:
