topic: Britney Spears' Ex Jason Alexander Arrested Trying To Crash Her Wedding To Sam Asghari
content: Assignment editor, HuffPost Britney Spearsâ€™ ex-husband partook in some truly toxic behavior on Thursday, crashing the preparations for the pop starâ€™s wedding to Sam Asghari. Jason Alexander (no connection to the â€œSeinfeldâ€ actor) live-streamed the bizarre incident on Instagram from Spearsâ€™ property in Thousand Oaks, California, where the wedding was reportedly slated to take place later in the day. In the videos, he can be heard asking, â€œWhereâ€™s Britney at?â€ and saying heâ€™s there to â€œcrash the weddingâ€ but also claiming that Spears invited him. At other points, he says of Spears, â€œSheâ€™s my first wife, my only wifeâ€ and refers to the planned nuptials as a â€œbullshit wedding.â€ Police responded to a call of trespassing at the property, TMZ was the first to report. The Ventura County Sheriffâ€™s Department told NBC News it had arrested Alexander on suspicion of an outstanding felony warrant from 2016. Spears and Alexander were childhood friends who married in 2004, but the marriage was annulled after 55 hours. She later married Kevin Federline, with whom she has two children. Spears and Asghari announced their engagement in September after dating for four years. They shared the news not long after her father, Jamie Spears, had filed documents to end the conservatorship that had controlled most of the pop starâ€™s personal and professional life for more than a decade. Assignment editor, HuffPost

topic: Britney Spears And Madonna Recreate Their Famous Kiss At Spears' Wedding
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Britney Spears married Sam Asghari on Thursday, but she and fellow pop idol Madonna said â€œI doâ€ to a redux of their famous kiss. Photos of the nuptials published by People show the two pop legends smooching at the reception. (Check out other wedding pics with guests including Selena Gomez, Paris Hilton, Drew Barrymore and Donatella Versace.) Spears and Madonna previously locked lips to much fanfare at the 2003 MTV Video Music Awards. â€œI didnâ€™t know it was going to be that long and everything,â€ Brit said back in the day. â€œIâ€™ve never kissed a woman before.â€ Nineteen years later, the two engaged in another, more chaste buss. Spears and Asghari tied the knot at her home in Thousand Oaks, California â€• but not without some early drama. Her first husband Jason Alexander (not the â€œSeinfeldâ€ actor) attempted to parlay their 55-hour marriage in 2004 into an attention-grabbing stunt on Thursday. He tried to crash the wedding preparations on her property while live-streaming his alleged trespass. He was arrested on an outstanding warrant. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Writer Claims 'Fire Island' Fails The Bechdel Test, And Twitter Users Have Thoughts
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost The stars of Huluâ€™s â€œFire Islandâ€ found themselves at the center of a social media frenzy this week after a writer argued that the LGBTQ-inclusive romantic comedy didnâ€™t accurately represent women. Directed by Andrew Ahn, â€œFire Islandâ€ is a contemporary reimagining of Jane Austenâ€™s â€œPride & Prejudice.â€ The film stars Joel Kim Booster (who also wrote the screenplay) and Bowen Yang as two friends who embark on a group vacation to the Pines, a section of Fire Island, New York, known as a mecca for the LGBTQ community. Flirtation and drama ensue after the guys catch the eye of two significantly wealthier men, played by actors Conrad Ricamora and James Scully. Catch the â€œFire Islandâ€ trailer above. On Monday, writer Hanna Rosin tweeted that â€œFire Islandâ€ failed to pass the Bechdel test, an unofficial and nonscientific metric used to judge films on whether they feature at least two female characters who talk to each other about something other than their relationships to men. â€œ[â€˜Fire Islandâ€™] gets an F- on the Bechdel test in a whole new way,â€ wrote Rosin, who is the author of 2013â€™s â€œThe End of Men: And the Rise of Womenâ€ and the editorial director for audio at New York Magazine. â€œDo we just ignore the drab lesbian stereotypes bc cute gay Asian boys? Is this revenge for all those years of the gay boy best friend?â€ Rosinâ€™s since-deleted tweet was met with backlash. Many fans took issue with the fact that she singled out â€œFire Island,â€ which has been otherwise praised for its exclusively LGBTQ cast that includes many actors of color. Others felt her use of the term â€œcute gay Asian boysâ€ to be condescending toward Booster, Ricamora and Yang. I loved FIRE ISLAND, even though it wasnâ€™t â€œforâ€ me or â€œaboutâ€ me and apparently doesnâ€™t pass the Bechdel test. Crazy, I know. I havenâ€™t seen #FireIslandMovie but can we not do this, please? This movie features several queer Asian men â€” who are vastly underrepresented in media and shown only as flat, stereotypical, supporting characters when sporadically present â€” as complex and nuanced leads. https://t.co/j5pLst4Hdu Before long, Rosinâ€™s tweet caught the eye of comedian Margaret Cho, who has a supporting role in the film and is bisexual. â€œI didnâ€™t realize I was drab,â€ she tweeted. â€œI donâ€™t identify as drab. Bitch Iâ€™m fab!â€ Alison Bechdel, the award-winning cartoonist who developed the Bechdel test, also chimed in, tweeting that she was amending her criteria specifically in response to the film. Okay, I just added a corollary to the Bechdel test: Two men talking to each other about the female protagonist of an Alice Munro story in a screenplay structured on a Jane Austen novel = pass. #FireIsland #BechdelTest By Tuesday afternoon, Rosin deleted her tweet and offered a lengthy apology. I deleted a tweet that many of you rightly pointed out was offensive. Iâ€™ve read your responses and I hear you. My tweet was careless and thoughtless. Truly. The movie was telling a story about queer AAPI men, whose experiences donâ€™t show up enough in movies or anywhere else 1/3 pic.twitter.com/FEI0sDqXJe â€œWhat I had to say was beside the point, not to mention a buzzkill on a fun summer movie,â€ she continued. â€œItâ€™s a cliche but the fact that I didnâ€™t see it coming means I have a lot to learn. ... The last thing I want to do is pit members of my community against each other. I sincerely apologize to those who were hurt by my words.â€ Rosinâ€™s criticisms aside, â€œFire Islandâ€ has received mostly positive reviews, with Ahn telling Gay Times heâ€™d be on board with a sequel. â€œI think, for me, thereâ€™s something really special about that group of friends, both as characters and also as people,â€ he said. â€œI really hope that we get to hang out again and at the very least, maybe we can actually just go on vacation and not have to make a movie while weâ€™re doing it.â€ Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Post Malone And Seth Meyers Go Day-Drinking And It's Pure Barfly Inspo
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Seth Meyers and Post Malone exchanged declarations of â€œI love youâ€ in their day-drinking adventure on â€œLate Nightâ€ Tuesday â€• a sure sign this boozy bromance was in full bloom. (Watch the video below.) As long as the host and the â€œCirclesâ€ singer were downing beers, shots, ridiculously named cocktails and Maloneâ€™s own brand of rosÃ© for a nationally televised talk show, getting drunk might as well become the mission. Itâ€™s entertaining, itâ€™s relatable and it allows for hooch product placement, whether intended or not. So just watch the two get good and tanked, see them play fake trivia games as an excuse to guzzle more spirits and let Malone not quite impress while drawing tattoos on Meyersâ€™ face. The segment ends with a â€œCheersâ€ chaser â€• but youâ€™ll have to watch to find out what it is. All in all, these drinking buddies are definitely worth a round or two of your attention. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Tony Siragusa, Former NFL Star, Dead At 55
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Insurrectionists Complain About Being 'Profiled' In Scathing 'Daily Show' Sketch
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Trevor Noah taunted participants in the Jan. 6, 2021, insurrection Thursday for being upset that theyâ€™re facing the consequences of their actions. â€œThe Daily Showâ€ host offered his commentary on â€œthe day when white people visited the democracy store and demanded to speak to the managerâ€ as the House select committee investigating the attack prepared to lay out its findings in a live hearing Thursday evening. More than 800 people have been arrested for crimes related to the breach of the U.S. Capitol, carried out by supporters of former President Donald Trump in an effort to stop the certification of the 2020 election. Thursdayâ€™s hearing laid out how Trump and members of his inner circle executed the â€œconspiracyâ€ to hold on to power. â€œThis is a new experience for a lot of these white people. You know, all of a sudden theyâ€™re finding out what itâ€™s like to be on the bad side of the police and it turns out, they do not like it one bit,â€ Noah quipped. He illustrated his point with a sketch, in which two â€œTrump supportersâ€ spoke about their plight. â€œAs a Trump supporter in America, you already know that cops treat people like us differently. We can be profiled and misjudged anytime just trying to overthrow a free and fair election,â€ they said. â€œYou can be targeted solely because of how you look or what you chant or who youâ€™re assaulting with a flagpole.â€ Watch below via â€œThe Daily Show.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Jurassic World: Dominion' Stomps Out The Competition At The Box Office
content: Move over Maverick, the dinosaurs have arrived to claim their throne. â€œJurassic World: Dominionâ€ took a mighty bite out of the box office with $143.4 million in North American ticket sales, according to studio estimates Sunday. Including earnings from international showings â€” the film opened in various markets last weekend â€” â€œJurassic World: Dominion,â€ released globally by Universal Pictures, has already grossed $389 million. And itâ€™s just getting started. â€œWe couldnâ€™t be happier,â€ said Jim Orr, Universalâ€™s head of domestic distribution. â€œâ€˜Jurassic World: Dominionâ€™ had a very broad and ridiculously enthusiastic audience.â€ The hefty haul is yet another sign that the box office is continuing to rebound this summer. With the blockbuster successes of films like â€œDoctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness,â€ â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€ and now â€œJurassic World 3,â€ audiences are coming back to movie theaters more consistently. The film, which had a reported $185 million price tag not accounting for marketing and promotion costs, opened on 4,676 screens in the U.S. and Canada, starting with preview showings Thursday. Audiences were 56% male and 54% over the age of 25, according to Universal. Critics were not kind to the dino extravaganza, but audiences seem to be enjoying themselves based on exit polls. Moviegoers gave it an A- CinemaScore and an 81% audience score on Rotten Tomatoes, suggesting that word of mouth will be strong in the coming weeks. â€œYou want to see dinosaurs on the big screen, it doesnâ€™t matter what critics thought,â€ said Paul Dergarabedian, the senior media analyst for Comscore. And many moviegoers did opt for the biggest screens possible. Globally, IMAX showings of â€œJurassic World: Dominionâ€ represented $25 million of the total. The 3D format also accounted for around 25% of worldwide ticket sales. â€œThe appetite for the colossal creatures in this franchise is still voracious, and the way audiences want to experience this movie is in 3D,â€ said Travis Reid, the CEO and president of Cinema for RealD, in a statement. Both â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€ and â€œJurassic World: Dominionâ€ are an important caveat for an industry that continues to learn new lessons about pandemic-era moviegoing every week. Although both films are legacy sequels, neither are of the superhero variety, which, for a long time, had seemed like the only pandemic-proof genre. â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€ is still coasting in rarefied skies too: It fell only 44% in its third weekend with an estimated $50 million to take second place, bringing its North American total north of $393.3 million. â€œDoctor Strange 2,â€ in its sixth weekend, was a distant third with $4.9 million. This weekend is only the third of the pandemic era in which the total domestic box office surpassed $200 million, according to box office tracker Comscore. The others were â€œSpider Man: No Way Home,â€ in December, and â€œDoctor Strange 2,â€ in May. But this is the first time there has been space for two movies to do well. â€œPretty much all the big blockbuster weekends that weâ€™ve had over the pandemic have been dominated by one movie,â€ Dergarabedian said. â€œIn this case, we have two big blockbusters in theaters at once. This is the recipe for success that theater owners have been waiting for over the course of the pandemic. Itâ€™s an important milestone.â€ â€œDominion,â€ a co-production of Universal Pictures and Amblin Entertainment, is the third film in the â€œJurassic Worldâ€ trilogy, which began in 2015 and introduced characters played by Chris Pratt and Bryce Dallas Howard. The newest installment brings back actors Laura Dern, Sam Neill and Jeff Goldblum from Steven Spielbergâ€™s 1993 â€œJurassic Park.â€ Colin Trevorrow, who stewarded the â€œWorldâ€ trilogy and directed the first film, returned to direct â€œDominion,â€ in which dinosaurs are no longer contained and locusts are threatening the worldâ€™s food supply. The filmmakers have said â€œDominionâ€ is intended to be the last of the â€œJurassic Worldâ€ films, which have been enormously profitable with over $3 billion in ticket sales. The first earned over $1.7 billion globally alone. Including the original â€œJurassic Parkâ€ trilogy, that number skyrockets to $5 billion. â€œJurassic World 3â€ should continue performing throughout the summer, Orr said. Universal Pictures also has a number of diverse, high-profile and theatrical-only releases coming in the next few weeks, including the horror film â€œThe Black Phone,â€ â€œMinions: The Rise of Gruâ€ and Jordan Peeleâ€™s â€œNope.â€ And this vote of confidence in movie theaters is promising. â€œThis is a tremendous start to our summer,â€ Orr said. Estimated ticket sales for Friday through Sunday at U.S. and Canadian theaters, according to Comscore. Final domestic figures will be released Monday. 1. â€œJurassic World: Dominion,â€ $143.4 million. 2. â€œTop Gun: Maverick,â€ $50 million. 3. â€œDoctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness,â€ $4.9 million. 4. â€œThe Bobâ€™s Burgers Movie,â€ $2.3 million. 5. â€œThe Bad Guys,â€ $2.3 million. 6. â€œDownton Abbey: A New Era,â€ $1.7 million. 7. â€œEverything Everywhere All At Once,â€ $1.3 million. 8. â€œFirestarter,â€ $820,000. 9. â€œSonic the Hedgehog 2,â€ $710,000. 10. â€œAnte Sundaraniki,â€ $620,000.

topic: Rebel Wilson Finds Love With A Woman She Calls Her 'Disney Princess'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Rebel Wilson has found love with a woman she refers to as her â€œDisney Princess.â€ The â€œPitch Perfectâ€ star announced she is in a same-sex relationship on Thursday with an Instagram post featuring her and her girlfriend, fashion designer Ramona Agruma. â€œI thought I was searching for a Disney Prince â€¦ but maybe what I really needed all this time was a Disney Princess,â€ the 42-year-old actor wrote. Wilson alluded to her new relationship last month when speaking with People.com, but didnâ€™t specify her partnerâ€™s gender, saying only that they met â€œthrough a friendâ€ and â€œspoke on the phone for weeks before meeting.â€ She added that it â€œwas a really good way to get to know each other. It was a bit old-school in that sense â€” very romantic.â€ Although Wilson hadnâ€™t previously announced her new love was a woman, she said the big difference in the relationship compared to her past ones is that â€œitâ€™s great to have someone who feels like an equal partner and be in a healthy relationship.â€ She explained further: â€œThere were times â€” Iâ€™m not saying with all my exes, theyâ€™re great â€” but there were some times that I was probably putting up with that I shouldnâ€™t have. So it feels different to be in a really healthy relationship.â€ A post shared by Rebel Wilson (@rebelwilson) Wilsonâ€™s last public relationship before Agruma was with Jacob Busch, a member of the family that founded the Anheuser-Busch brewing company; they split in February. Agruma owns a sustainable clothing brand called Lemon Ve Limon based in Los Angeles, and, like Wilson, attended law school, according to InTouch Weekly. Wilson may not have publicly revealed she was dating Agruma until Thursday, but the designer has been the actorâ€™s plus-one at many recent events. Page Six notes that Agruma accompanied the actor to the Oscars in March. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Ms. Marvel' Is A Turning Point For Muslim American Visibility In Hollywood
content: Contributor In 2014, Marvel Comics introduced a new character that quickly became an international sensation. Unlike Thanos from the planet Titan or Dr. Strange, who wielded the powers of the Sorcerer Supreme, this young phenom was the product of a regular Muslim American family living in New Jersey. Kamala Khan, aka Ms. Marvel, possessed the coveted superpower of shapeshifting. But other than that, she was just a quirky high school kid navigating her blended identity. Many of my Muslim American peers and I were amazed by what finally appeared to be a positive and fun, yet powerful, representation of our community. Khanâ€™s infectious charm and steadfast strength slayed her nemeses in vivid color through the pages, her character unapologetically bucking the negative stereotypes impressed upon Muslim Americans. Eight years later, weâ€™re on the cusp of another groundbreaking milestone: the long-anticipated release of the Disney+ adaptation of the comic, with Iman Vellani playing Kamala Khan. On the show, the cosmic Ms. Marvel fights to protect the streets of Jersey City as she grapples with everyday coming-of-age challenges. A female Muslim superhero is a rather satisfying herald of progress â€” both for Hollywood diversity and Muslim visibility in general. The casting feels right, for once. Vellani lives out her characterâ€™s family dynamics at home to a T â€” and they feel familiar and even comforting. At school, sheâ€™s just trying to figure it all out. But the streets and her imagination are where the magic happens. In the trailer for the series (only one episode has dropped so far), sheâ€™s all at once tender, reverent and explosive. Khanâ€™s range is meaningful not just for all the brown girls out there trying to save the world, but for everyone whoâ€™s never felt totally seen. In an attempt at diversity, Marvel has shaken up its repertoire of box office-slaying superheroes in recent years, launching successful film franchises around the Black Panther or Shang-Chi. Yet, thereâ€™s still a lot of work to be done and â€œMs. Marvelâ€ feels like another step in the right direction. Itâ€™s not enough to be included on-screen; Our communities have to be represented in various ways to reflect our realities. There are currently 3.5 million Muslim-identifying people in the U.S. and Islam has been deemed the worldâ€™s fastest-growing religion, but itâ€™s safe to say that Muslim characters are often monolithic when portrayed in Hollywood. If represented at all, Muslim characters are negatively stereotyped and/or relegated to a supporting role with no backstory, according to research from USC Annenberg Inclusion Initiative, a leading think tank addressing inequality in entertainment. While Muslims are one of the most racially and socially diverse religious groups, their existences are all too often expressed by one-dimensional narratives associated with terrorism and orientalist tropes of oppression. Muslim American women face even larger hurdles around visibility. Fewer than one quarter of Muslim characters depicted in global movies are women. This type of gender erasure further amplifies what Dr. Stacey L. Smith, the founding director of the Annenberg Inclusion Initiative, calls an â€œepidemic of invisibility.â€ This is one of the reasons â€œMs. Marvelâ€ feels necessary. According to Marvel, show co-creator and executive producer Sana Amanat was inspired in part by her life experiences to take the hand of the average American viewer and introduce them to their Muslim American neighbors through an ultra-familiar vehicle: the modern teenager. The series, which includes predominantly Muslim and South Asian talent on and off-screen, emphasizes strong character relatability by showcasing a universally-accessible teenage experience while advancing a wholesome storyline around Muslim families. It colorfully serves as a mirror for young adults to see an empowering reflection of themselves. â€œâ€˜Ms. Marvelâ€™ is going to inspire generations of Muslims as well as bring understanding to so many others while connecting both groups in ways that are much needed today,â€ Khalid Latif, executive director and chaplain for the Islamic Center at New York University, told me. The unfortunate reality is that Hollywood is a hugely risk-averse business that has too often churned out formulaic stories. Yet, films such as â€œBlack Pantherâ€ and â€œCrazy Rich Asiansâ€ have demonstrated the profitability of diversity and inclusion, generating staggering revenues for film studios. A recent study from the UCLA-based Center for Scholars and Storytellers found that major Hollywood films lacking diversity within their cast and crew more often result in significant box office losses than those with diverse, authentic cast representation. â€œWith â€˜Ms. Marvelâ€™ tapping into international talent, there is an even significant potential to create a robust and an authentic ecosystem that can resonate with audiences globally and extend visibility into future series and other media crossovers,â€ says Serena Rasoul, founder of Muslim Casting, an agency that casts and consults for Muslim and SWANA talent. Khanâ€™s character expansion cross-media also serves as a model in investing in more diverse storylines about young, Muslim Americans. Kamala Khan lives out the vulnerabilities I felt as a teenager as well as the ones I experience today as I continue to navigate my sense of self. That said, the series has something to offer for everyone. Itâ€™s a moment to collectively recognize our humanity and boundless empathy. It gives us all a sense of belonging in a time we need it the most. Perhaps most importantly, â€œMs. Marvelâ€ proves that the greatest superpower of all could just be relatability. Contributor

topic: Justin Bieber Battling Virus That Has Paralyzed Half His Face
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Justin Bieber announced Friday that he is taking some time off from touring in order to deal with a virus that has paralyzed half his face. In a video posted on Instagram, the singer explained that heâ€™s postponed several shows after being diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt syndrome, a condition that has affected a nerve in his ear. As a result, heâ€™s unable to blink his right eye and can smile only on the left side of his face. â€œThis nostril will not move,â€ he added. As a result, Bieber said, heâ€™s â€œphysically unableâ€ to perform in concert for the time being. Instead, he will â€œrest and relaxâ€ until heâ€™s able â€œto do what I was born to do.â€ Ramsay Hunt syndrome occurs when the varicella-zoster virus â€• which also causes chicken pox and shingles â€• infects a nerve in the head. Treatment often involves steroids and/or antiviral medicines. Bieber didnâ€™t say if he was taking medicine. However, he said heâ€™s doing â€œall these facial exercisesâ€ to get his face back to normal. He added that he doesnâ€™t know how long that will take. You can see the complete video selfie below. A post shared by Justin Bieber (@justinbieber) This has been a rough year healthwise for Bieber and his wife, Hailey. In February, he was diagnosed with COVID-19 after the opening night of his world tour, and his wife suffered a blood clot in her brain the next month. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Ariana DeBose Kicks Off 2022 Tony Awards With Show-Stopping Broadway Mashup
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost â€œWest Side Storyâ€ star Ariana DeBose launched the 75th Tony Awards in style with a breathtaking mashup performance featuring tunes from classic Tony-winning musicals, including â€œPhantom of the Opera,â€ â€œCabaret,â€ â€œHairâ€ and â€œCompany.â€ The former Tony nominee opened the ceremony at Radio City Music Hall on Sunday night with an energetic performance, giving a â€œround of applauseâ€ to everyone on Broadway. DeBose donned a stunning, all-white ensemble inspired by Michael Jackson, the subject of â€œMJ: The Musical,â€ which received 10 nominations heading into the evening. â€œLetâ€™s just say, for many of you itâ€™s been a rollercoaster,â€ DeBose remarked in her opening monologue, noting how the coronavirus pandemic has upended the theater industry over the past two years. Now THAT is how you kick off the #TonyAwards! ğŸ‘ We give our round of applause right back to @ArianaDeBose. pic.twitter.com/fybuEJ0agQ â€œI am so proud that the theater is becoming more reflective of the community who adores it, and in doing so, has gained new performers, new creatives, new fans,â€ she continued. â€œIt has shown us stories that have broadened our world and opened our hearts and our minds.â€ â€œAnd while we have not solved all of our problems, I feel like the phrase â€˜Great White Wayâ€™ is becoming more of a nickname as opposed to a how-to guide.â€ Earlier this week, DeBose, who recently became the first openly queer woman of color to win an Academy Award for her work as Anita in Steven Spielbergâ€™s â€œWest Side Storyâ€ remake, took to Instagram to share her excitement leading up to her hosting debut. â€œRan into these two at rehearsal today. Theyâ€™re cookin up something good for the @thetonyawards pre-show,â€ she wrote on Instagram alongside a photo with Tony Awards pre-show hosts Darren Criss and Julianne Hough. A post shared by Ariana DeBose (@arianadebose) Alongside DeBoseâ€™s powerful performance, the evening also featured performances from the casts of â€œA Strange Loop,â€ â€œParadise Square,â€ â€œSIX,â€ â€œCompany,â€ â€œGirl from the North Country,â€ â€œMJ,â€ â€œMr. Saturday Nightâ€ and â€œMusic Man.â€ Bernadette Peters, Billy Porter, the New York City Gay Menâ€™s Chorus and the original cast of â€œSpring Awakeningâ€ also hit the stage with individual performances. Watch the full opening performance below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: TikTok Star Cooper Noriega Dead At 19
content: Reporter, HuffPost Beloved TikTok star Cooper Noriega has died, multiple outlets have confirmed. He was 19. His cause of death is unknown, according to E! News, which obtained a coroner case file. Foul play is not suspected, TMZ reports . A post shared by Cooper Noriega (@cooper.noriega) Law enforcement sources told TMZ that Noriega was discovered unconscious in a mall parking lot outside Los Angeles on Thursday. A passerby called 911 and paramedics were quick to arrive, but they were unable to revive Noriega. Hours before his death, Noriega posted a TikTok while lying in bed with the caption, â€œwho else b thinking they gon d!â‚¬ young af.â€ or dis j me Noriegaâ€™s last TikTok was a duet with Bryce Hall. Hall commented, â€œI love you so much,â€ on the post. Earlier this week, Noriega published a post on Instagram in which he announced he started a Discord account called â€œCoopâ€™s Adviceâ€ to â€œcreate a space built on spreading awareness and normalizing talking about mental illness.â€ He also opened up about his struggles with addiction that started when he was 9 years old. â€œMy goal is to eventually open a rehab where people arenâ€™t traumatized at the end of their recovery, and where the staff meetings are trusted people. One of the many things Iâ€™ve learnt while struggling with addiction was that surrounding yourself with negative people will only bring you down,â€ he wrote. A post shared by Cooper Noriega (@cooper.noriega) â€œMy heart hurts,â€ social media star Blake Gray wrote in the comments section of Noriegaâ€™s above Instagram post. â€œIt doesnâ€™t feel real. Please tell me itâ€™s not real. You always had the most positive energy no matter where we were. Rest easy coop.â€ Upon the news of Noriegaâ€™s death, photographer Bryant Eslava tweeted a screenshot showing his last phone call with Noriega, which happened to be about the TIkTok starâ€™s new Discord account. Rest in Peace Cooper Noriega ğŸ•ŠCoopers Advice discord: https://t.co/ibhGiav7lb pic.twitter.com/rWoDPn7n6j â€œI was just on FaceTime with him on Monday for 46 minutes,â€ Bryant wrote. â€œI was listening to everything he wanted to do with â€˜Coopers Advice,â€™â€ he added. â€œI was going to help him out with it. Thereâ€™s so much he wanted to do with it all â€• his vision and why he started this discord channel. Iâ€™m speechless, and Iâ€™m going to do everything I can to make sure this goes on and turns into what he envisioned it to be.â€ Noriega has 1.77 million followers on TikTok, and a substantial Instagram following as well. Just last week, he appeared on the â€œBarstoolâ€™s BFFs: Dave Portnoy, Josh Richards & Bri Chickenfryâ€ podcast. Need help with substance use disorder or mental health issues? In the U.S., call 800-662-HELP (4357) for the SAMHSA National Helpline. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Lady Gaga In Talks To Join 'Joker' Sequel, Which For Some Reason Will Be A Musical
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Lady Gaga might have met her method acting match in Joaquin Phoenix. Just when the swarms of flies had stopped following the pop star after her equal parts bizarre and hilarious â€œHouse of Gucciâ€ press tour, sheâ€™s considering a dive even deeper into another role for the much-anticipated â€œJokerâ€ sequel. The Oscar-winning â€œA Star Is Bornâ€ actor is in talks to play Harley Quinn in the follow-up to director Todd Phillipsâ€™ box-office smash about the maniacal Batman villain, according to multiple outlets. The sequel wonâ€™t contain just laughs, but songs, too, as the film will reportedly be a musical. But it will likely be a while before Gaga and Phoenix start two-stepping down a flight of stairs, as the project is still early in the development stage. Phoenix, who won a Best Actor Oscar for his portrayal of the titular baddie, has yet to officially sign on to the film, per The Hollywood Reporter, which notes that Warner Bros. is â€œdeep intoâ€ negotiations with the star. Phillips officially confirmed that a â€œJokerâ€ sequel was a go earlier this month. The director shared a cryptic Instagram post showing the cover page of a script titled â€œJoker: Folie Ã  Deuxâ€ alongside a photo of Phoenix reading the material. A post shared by Todd Phillips (@toddphillips) The title loosely translates into English as â€œshared psychosisâ€ and seemingly refers to a mental disorder â€œaffecting two or more individuals, usually the members of a close family.â€ Phillips, who produced Gagaâ€™s â€œA Star Is Bornâ€ remake, will once again direct and write the script alongside Scott Silver. Gaga would be the latest performer to step into Harley Quinnâ€™s laced pumps, as Margot Robbie has portrayed the character in multiple films to much acclaim, most recently appearing in 2020â€™s â€œBirds of Prey (and the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn).â€ Kaley Cuoco voices the psychiatrist-turned-henchwoman in HBO Maxâ€™s animated series â€œHarley Quinn.â€ â€œJoker,â€ however, takes place in a separate universe from the recent slate of DC superhero films, so the musical follow-up wonâ€™t step on any toes should Robbie choose to reprise the role. Despite a relatively modest $60 million budget, the gritty origin story of the supervillian raked in more than $1 billion at the box office, becoming the first R-rated film to reach the milestone. â€œJoker,â€ which also starred Zazie Beetz, Frances Conroy and Robert De Niro, went on to garner 11 Oscar nominations, including Best Picture, Best Director and Best Adapted Screenplay. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Me Too Founder Reacts To Depp-Heard Trial Verdict
content: Reporter, HuffPost Activist Tarana Burke spoke up Thursday to defend the Me Too movement she created after a jury sided largely with actor Johnny Depp in his defamation suit against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Some commenters on social media reacted to the verdict by saying that it had sounded the death knell for the movement, sparked by a viral hashtag in 2017 when women in Hollywood began accusing producer Harvey Weinstein of sexual abuse. Burke had been working to support sexual assault survivors since 2005, using the phrase â€œme tooâ€ to emphasize the pervasive nature of intimate partner violence. â€œ#MeToo is dead. Helluva job @ACLU,â€ Meghan McCain said Wednesday in a now-deleted tweet. â€œThe â€˜me tooâ€™ movement isnâ€™t dead, this system is dead,â€ Burke wrote in a statement. â€œThis is the same legal system that yâ€™all have been relying on for justice and accountability for decades to no avail.â€ A jury of five male and two female Virginians unanimously decided that Heard had defamed her ex-husband with the publication of a 2018 editorial stating she had been abused by Depp during their rocky relationship, although the piece did not explicitly name him. The jurors said Heard acted with â€œactual malice,â€ meaning that they believed she knew what she was writing was false. The panel wanted Heard to pay Depp a total of $15 million in damages, but Judge Penney Azcarate lowered the amount slightly to $10.35 million in accordance with state laws on financial penalties. In the wake of the verdict, some legal experts have said U.S. courts that rely on juries of regular people are not set up to fairly weigh questions about intimate partner violence, given how they can be swayed by misconceptions and emotion. Burke continued her message: â€œWhen you get the verdict you want, â€˜the movement worksâ€™ â€• when you donâ€™t, itâ€™s dead. When Weinstein went to jail it was, â€˜me too is winning!â€™ When Cosby came home it was, â€˜What a blow, me too is losing!â€™ In the meantime â€• millions of people who have never been able to utter the words â€˜it happened to meâ€™ have released the shame that wasnâ€™t theirs to carry in the first place, we have built the countryâ€™s first political agenda created solely by Survivors, and for the first time since Anita Hill took the stand three decades ago weâ€™ve had a sustained national dialogue about, not just sexual harassment, but the spectrum of sexual violence in this country. Thatâ€™s in addition to various laws and policies passed, etc. This movement is very much ALIVE. You all want to play ping pong and have your way with the hashtag because it doesnâ€™t mean anything to you so you try to kill it every few months. But it means something to millions and millions of folks. It means freedom. It means community. It means safety. It means power. You canâ€™t kill us. We are beyond the hashtag. We are a movement.â€ Many advocates for survivors of domestic abuse and sexual assault also worried that the ferocity with which Deppâ€™s fans discussed Heard online â€• combined with the highly publicized nature of the trial â€• would discourage other women from coming forward with their stories. More than six weeks of proceedings were streamed live online. While the jury was told not to read about the case, they were also not sequestered. pic.twitter.com/bbciGgjgUA Reporter, HuffPost

topic: James Patterson Once Spotted A Woman Stealing One Of His Books
content: Bestselling author James Patterson once spotted a woman checking out one of his earliest novels â€• and then she booked out of the store without paying for it. Patterson, who has since sold over 400 million books, said that particular novel was on The New York Times Best Seller list but he didnâ€™t believe it. So he was thrilled to see the woman pick up his book, glance at the back and walk away with it. â€œThis is the best, I want to go hug this woman,â€ Patterson told Seth Meyers on â€œLate Nightâ€ Wednesday. â€œShe puts it in her bag, she stole it. And all Iâ€™m going is: â€˜Does that count as a sale?â€™â€ Patterson released his latest book â€• a self-titled memoir â€• on Monday. Watch the rest of his interview below:

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Man Who Filmed Self Screaming His Name In Capitol Riot Sentenced
content: Reporter, HuffPost Former West Virginia state lawmaker Derrick Evans was sentenced to three months on Wednesday for his part in the U.S. Capitol attack last year. Evans had livestreamed himself joining the throng of Donald Trump supporters as some individuals smashed their way into the building and then opened the Rotunda doors for the rest of the mob. He narrated his exploits as he went along, shouting â€œTrump,â€ â€œThe doorâ€™s cracked,â€ and â€œWeâ€™re goinâ€™ in!â€ â€œWeâ€™re in! Derrick Evans is in the Capitol!â€ he said once he made it though the doors. Evans later deleted the video, but it featured prominently in prosecutorsâ€™ case against him. After initially pleading not guilty, defending himself by saying he â€œcommitted no criminal act,â€ Evans took a plea deal. He told Judge Royce C. Lamberth that he accepts responsibility for his actions, seated nearby a large Evans family photo, according to NBC News. Lamberth reportedly wished Evans well, telling him that he considered sentencing Evans to six months behind bars. Evansâ€™ attorney had asked for no jail time. â€œI just canâ€™t give you probation in a case like this ... it doesnâ€™t reflect the feeling in the country,â€ the judge said, according to CBS News reporter Rob Legare. â€œI donâ€™t want another riot in the next election,â€ Lamberth added. At the time of the riot, the father of four had recently been elected to represent West Virginians in the stateâ€™s House of Delegates. Three days later, he was forced to resign. After releasing a very brief statement announcing his resignation, Evans released a second, slightly longer statement expressing regret, writing, â€œI take full responsibility for my actions, and deeply regret any hurt, pain or embarrassment I may have caused my family, friends, constituents and fellow West Virginians.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jimmy Fallon's Cold Burn Of Fox News For Not Airing Jan. 6 Hearing Is Too Good
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Jimmy Fallon issued a cold burn of Fox News for refusing to air the Jan. 6 hearing on Thursday. (Watch the video below.) Now if â€œcold burnâ€ sounds like an oxymoron, well, it fits here. â€œThe Tonight Showâ€ host noted that the right-wing network apparently didnâ€™t think the probe into the insurrection was news, even though it was carried live by several major channels. â€œLetâ€™s see what they were focused on instead,â€ Fallon said. The show cut to a faux news alert with a serious voice intoning, â€œTonight on Fox News, is the new Wendyâ€™s pink Frosty trying to turn your kids gay?â€ Fallonâ€™s mockery of the conservative channel didnâ€™t stop there. Check it out: Fox Newsâ€™ prime-time star Tucker Carlson led the channelâ€™s denial fest in explaining why the channel did not carry the first public hearing on the Capitol riot to overthrow the 2020 election. â€œThey are lying and we will not let them do it,â€ he said Thursday. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Country Star Toby Keith Has Spent Past 6 Months Fighting Stomach Cancer
content: Country music star Toby Keith announced on Sunday that he has been diagnosed with stomach cancer. Keith revealed his diagnosis occurred in fall 2021 and said heâ€™s undergone chemotherapy and other treatment for cancer in the past six months. â€œSo far, so good. I need time to breathe, recover and relax,â€ he wrote: pic.twitter.com/TeADP7UN8h Keith has sold over 40 million albums in his career and had 61 singles hit Billboardâ€™s Hot Country Songs chart. The Oklahoma-born artist is known for a number of records, including â€œShouldâ€™ve Been a Cowboy,â€ â€œAmerican Soldierâ€ and â€œAs Good as I Once Was.â€ Keithâ€™s music career has accompanied a history of giving back through the Toby Keith Foundation, a nonprofit in his name that supports OK Kids Korral, a home for pediatric cancer patients.

topic: Hugh Jackman Diagnosed With COVID-19 Just Hours After Tony Awards Performance
content: Hugh Jackman, the star of Broadwayâ€™s â€œThe Music Man,â€ tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday, according to the showâ€™s producer Kate Horton. The positive test result comes less than a day after Jackman performed with his cast during Sundayâ€™s Tony Awards, Deadline reported. Itâ€™s unclear whether other members of the cast who joined Jackman on-stage tested positive as well. A post shared by @thehughjackman HuffPost reached out to â€œThe Music Manâ€ for further comment. This is the second time Jackman has battled COVID-19, per Entertainment Weekly. He had to bow out of performances for the musical to recuperate from his first bout with coronavirus in December 2021. Jackmanâ€™s understudy Max Clayton will fill in as Professor Harold Hill on the show from June 14 through June 21. â€œWeâ€™re excited to see [Clayton] perform alongside the wonderful Sutton Foster and we wish Hugh a speedy recovery,â€ Horton wrote.

topic: Snoop Dogg Gives His Full-Time Blunt Roller A Raise Amid Inflation: 'Their Salary Went Up!'
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Snoop Dogg understands how to treat a worker. On Tuesday, the iconic rapper revealed on Twitter that he gave his full-time blunt roller a raise due to inflation. Snoop first spilled the beans about hiring a personal blunt roller during an episode of â€œThe Howard Stern Showâ€ alongside Seth Rogen in 2019. â€œThat motherfucker is like Lurch from the â€˜Addams Family.â€™ â€˜You rang?â€™â€ he laughed at the time, referring to his employee always being prepared whenever the entertainer was ready to light up. When Stern asked Snoop if he specifically hired someone to roll blunts for him, the musician didnâ€™t hesitate to confirm: â€œThatâ€™s his J-O-B â€” his occupation. On his rÃ©sumÃ©, it says, â€™What do you do? Iâ€™m a blunt roller. P-B-R, professional blunt roller,â€ he told the host. @HowardStern @Sethrogen snoop dogg talking about his blunt roller pic.twitter.com/w4OLiXOGxV When it comes to knowing exactly when the hip-hop mogul needs a smoke break, Snoop added, â€œthat motherfuckerâ€™s timing is impeccable.â€ The legendary artist, known for his unwavering love of the green bud, shared at the time that the coveted position paid around $40,000 to $50,000 annually, in addition to sweet perks, like free weed. However, after the Twitter account UberFacts tweeted on Monday, â€œSnoop Dogg employs a full-time blunt roller who makes between $40,000 and $50,000 a year,â€ the crip-walking West Coast lyricist swiftly stepped in to share an update. â€œInflation. Their salary went up!!â€ he wrote. Inflation. Their salary went up!! https://t.co/BCtOVHMN4W Snoop isnâ€™t the only rapper whoâ€™s too booked to roll his own blunts. Kid Cudi, Waka Flocka Flame and G Herbo have also been vocal about their search for the perfect joint roller. The artists have yet to confirm if their employee hunt has been successful. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Robert Plant, Alison Krauss Give Iconic Led Zeppelin Song A Stunning Makeover
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Robert Plant and Alison Krauss kicked off their first tour together in more than a decade with a reimagined take on a Led Zeppelin classic. Performing on Wednesday night in Canandaigua, New York, the two broke out â€œRock and Rollâ€ for the first time together â€• but with a completely different arrangement from the 1971 Zeppelin hit: â€œRock and Rollâ€ is from Led Zeppelinâ€™s untitled fourth album, often simply called â€œLed Zeppelin IV.â€ Prior to embarking on the tour, Plant joked he now resembles the figure on the albumâ€™s cover: â€œIâ€™m now that guy,â€ he said on his Digging Deep podcast in April. â€œI pick up kindling everywhere I go and wrap it around with a piece of baling twine and shunt it on my back just in case anybodyâ€™s driving by, and they go, â€˜Thereâ€™s that bloke off the â€˜Led Zeppelin IVâ€™ album cover!â€™â€ Plant and Krauss released their second album together last year, â€œRaise the Roof,â€ a long-awaited follow-up to 2007â€²s â€œRaising Sand,â€ which took home five Grammy Awards, including Album of the Year. Hereâ€™s how Plant handled the song in concert nearly half a century ago with Zeppelin: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Cole Sprouse's Naked Butt Is All It's Cracked Up To Be In Goofy Instagram
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œRiverdaleâ€ star Cole Sprouse on Tuesday cracked wise in sharing a mirror selfie of his butt. â€œGood morning to my publicity team,â€ the actor joked in his Instagram caption. A post shared by Cole Sprouse (@colesprouse) The cheeky starâ€™s derriere appeared to be digitally altered. But whatever the case, the actor who plays Jughead on the CW series got plenty of love from co-stars, not to mention millions of views worldwide. His former â€œRiverdaleâ€ dad, Skeet Ulrich, posted several laughing emojis, and Mark Consuelos, who played the town villain Hiram Lodge, wrote simply, â€œYo.â€ â€œHate to see you go, love to watch you leave ğŸ˜ª,â€ â€œScreamâ€ star Mason Gooding wrote. The wiseass post should come as no surprise, given Sprouseâ€™s distaste for people who dispense too much information online. â€œPeople who share all of their personal life on social media. Those people genuinely scare me,â€ Sprouse told Interview Magazine recently. â€œIâ€™m firmly convinced that any form of social media is a performance. People who are willing to perform every aspect of their life there are truly a terrifying breed.â€ General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost
