topic: Yes, That's Emma Thompson As Miss Trunchbull In First 'Matilda The Musical' Trailer
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Sporting a Nicole Kidman-level nose prosthetic and yet another completely unnecessary fat suit, Emma Thompson is unrecognizable as Miss Trunchbull in the first trailer for â€œMatilda the Musical.â€ The Oscar-winner stars as the terrifying headmistress in Netflixâ€™s upcoming adaptation of the Tony and Olivier Award-winning musical based on Roald Dahlâ€™s beloved childrenâ€™s book of the same name. While the first look at the project retreads over familiar territory (whatâ€™s a â€œMatildaâ€ story without chocolate cake?), it provides a catchy rock score to the classic tale of the book-obsessed child prodigy, which, of course, also served as inspiration for the 1996 film adaptation of the novel. This big-screen treatment stars Alisha Weir as Matilda Wormwood, â€œan extraordinary girl who discovers her superpower and summons the remarkable courage, against all odds, to help others change their stories, whilst also taking charge of her own destiny,â€ per the official synopsis. Sheâ€™s sent to attend the â€œominous and oppressiveâ€ Crunchem Hall, which is ruled with an iron fist by the villainous Trunchbull, who hopes to rid the school of â€œrebelsâ€ one pigtailed student at a time. Luckily, Matilda finds solace in Miss Honey, played here by â€œCaptain Marvelâ€ star Lashana Lynch. In this version, Andrea Riseborough and Stephen Graham star as Matildaâ€™s uncaring, money hungry parents, taking over the roles from Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also produced the 1996 film adaptation. â€œHarry Potterâ€ alum Ralph Fiennes was attached to play Trunchbull before Thompson came aboard. The film reunites the creative team behind the musical, as Matthew Warchus and Dennis Kelly are on board to direct and write once again with original music and lyrics by Tim Minchin, and choreography by Ellen Kane. â€œMatilda The Musicalâ€ is the latest project to arise from Netflixâ€™s acquisition of the Roald Dahl Story Company, which granted the streaming service rights to create projects based on the authorâ€™s work across its platforms. The film arrives in theaters on Dec. 2 in the U.K., while a streaming release date has yet to be officially announced. Watch the trailer below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Seth Meyers Has A Field Day With Giuliani's 'Diet Pepsi' Claim
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Seth Meyers refuses to believe anyone â€• let alone Rudy Giuliani â€• drinks Diet Pepsi by choice. â€œRudy Giuliani wants you all to know he is very upset at the accusation leveled by former Trump aides in sworn testimony that he was wasted on election night,â€ the â€œLate Nightâ€ host said, referencing findings presented in Mondayâ€™s second hearing of the House select committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021 attack. Aides said Giuliani, who was Donald Trumpâ€™s personal attorney at the time of the 2020 election, was inebriated when he advised the then-president to falsely declare victory while votes were still being counted. Giuliani tweeted after the hearing that he was â€œdisgusted and outragedâ€ by the accusation he was drunk. â€œI REFUSED all alcohol that evening. My favorite drink..Diet Pepsi,â€ he wrote. According to Meyers, that was Giulianiâ€™s tell. â€œSorry, buddy. You just gave yourself away. No oneâ€™s favorite drink is Diet Pepsi,â€ he quipped. â€œIs your favorite cookie Lorna Doones? Diet Pepsi is what you drink on a flight when they donâ€™t have Diet Coke or lemonade or chocolate milk or coconut water or camel spit or regular Pepsi.â€ Watch more of his commentary below: Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Andrew Gillum, Former Candidate For Florida Governor, Facing Federal Charges
content:
TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) â€” Andrew Gillum, the 2018 Democratic nominee for Florida governor, is facing 21 federal charges related to a scheme to seek donations and funnel a portion of them back to him through third parties, the U.S. attorneyâ€™s office announced Wednesday. Gillum, 42, and co-defendant Janet Lettman-Hicks, 53, face 19 counts of wire fraud. Gillum is also charged with making false statements to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The U.S. attorneyâ€™s office said the pair â€œconspired to commit wire fraud, by unlawfully soliciting and obtaining funds from various entities and individuals through false and fraudulent promises and representations that the funds would be used for a legitimate purpose.â€ Lettman-Hicks then used her company to fraudulently give money to Gillum disguised as payroll payments, the office said in a press release. Itâ€™s the latest trouble for Gillum, who narrowly lost to Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis in a race that required a recount. Gillum served as mayor of Tallahassee before running for governor. In March 2020, Gillum was found intoxicated and unconscious in a hotel room with two men, including one who works as a male escort. Two days later he entered a rehabilitation center, and later did a television interview and said heâ€™s bisexual. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Man Who Filmed Self Screaming His Name In Capitol Riot Sentenced
content: Reporter, HuffPost Former West Virginia state lawmaker Derrick Evans was sentenced to three months on Wednesday for his part in the U.S. Capitol attack last year. Evans had livestreamed himself joining the throng of Donald Trump supporters as some individuals smashed their way into the building and then opened the Rotunda doors for the rest of the mob. He narrated his exploits as he went along, shouting â€œTrump,â€ â€œThe doorâ€™s cracked,â€ and â€œWeâ€™re goinâ€™ in!â€ â€œWeâ€™re in! Derrick Evans is in the Capitol!â€ he said once he made it though the doors. Evans later deleted the video, but it featured prominently in prosecutorsâ€™ case against him. After initially pleading not guilty, defending himself by saying he â€œcommitted no criminal act,â€ Evans took a plea deal. He told Judge Royce C. Lamberth that he accepts responsibility for his actions, seated nearby a large Evans family photo, according to NBC News. Lamberth reportedly wished Evans well, telling him that he considered sentencing Evans to six months behind bars. Evansâ€™ attorney had asked for no jail time. â€œI just canâ€™t give you probation in a case like this ... it doesnâ€™t reflect the feeling in the country,â€ the judge said, according to CBS News reporter Rob Legare. â€œI donâ€™t want another riot in the next election,â€ Lamberth added. At the time of the riot, the father of four had recently been elected to represent West Virginians in the stateâ€™s House of Delegates. Three days later, he was forced to resign. After releasing a very brief statement announcing his resignation, Evans released a second, slightly longer statement expressing regret, writing, â€œI take full responsibility for my actions, and deeply regret any hurt, pain or embarrassment I may have caused my family, friends, constituents and fellow West Virginians.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Ryan Gosling's Version Of Ken Is Giving Off Serious 'Earring Magic Ken' Vibes
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost The fact that the first photo of Ryan Gosling as â€œKenâ€ from the upcoming â€œBarbieâ€ movie was released during Pride Month probably wasnâ€™t a coincidence since he seems to resemble a version of the doll that has become a gay icon. Many people noticed that Goslingâ€™s denim vest and bleached blond hair made him the spitting image of â€œEarring Magic Ken,â€ a version of Barbieâ€™s best male friend, released in 1993. See the resemblance? â€œEarring Magic Kenâ€ reportedly arrived at a time when Mattel executives were looking to update Kenâ€™s image and surveyed children on what looked cool to them. However, the doll apparently became the bestselling version of Ken in Mattel history at the time thanks to its popularity with gay men. Thatâ€™s because Earring Magic Ken wore his accessory earring on the left earlobe, a lavender mesh shirt with a matching pleather vest, and, as Mel Magazine noted, a necklace that could possibly double as a â€œcock ring.â€ That particular fashion accessory turned out to be particularly challenging for the Mattel PR person who had to explain it in a way that was acceptable to parents unfamiliar with what was stylish in the gay community at the time. Lisa McKendall, who was the manager of marketing and communications of Mattel Toys, insisted to The Chicago Reader that her employer was â€œnot in the business of putting cock rings into the hands of little girls.â€ She added: â€œItâ€™s a necklace. It holds charms he can share with Barbie. Câ€™mon, this is a doll designed for little girls, something like that would be entirely inappropriate.â€ Although many moms bought Earring Magic Ken for their kids, it was also selling well in the gay community. But In the Know reported that after the article made the cock ring connection, Mattel recalled the doll. No one connected with the Barbie movie has explicitly connected Goslingâ€™s version to Earring Magic Ken, but many people on Twitter couldnâ€™t help but think it was intentional. I'm finding it interesting that they went with the Earring Magic Ken sans cockring for Ryan Gosling in this movie. https://t.co/cq3df8kh29 pic.twitter.com/I2bwqu9tsJ You can't tell me that Ryan Gosling Ken doesn't look like the infamous Earring Magic Ken. pic.twitter.com/5ZKgInsuKc 6/10. It looks A LOT like they're going for Earring Magic Ken, in which case he's missing the lilac mesh shirt and cock ring necklace. Which, given how badly Mattel wanted to bury that doll, means that the costume designer ABSOLUTELY needs to go all the way in that direction. This is Earring Magic Ken and itâ€™s the correct choice of Ken to go with for this absolutely homosexual film. https://t.co/zpT9Lj4hpO Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Chris Evans Blasts Haters Upset Over Gay Kiss In â€˜Lightyearâ€™: â€˜Those People Are Idiotsâ€™
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Chris Evans knows how to brush off the haters. The star of Disney and Pixarâ€™s â€œLightyearâ€ dished out harsh words for the naysayers who claim the movieâ€™s kissing scene between two female characters encourages a pro-gay agenda among children. â€œThe real truth is those people are idiots,â€ Evans said in an interview with Reuters Television. â€œThereâ€™s always going to be people who are afraid and unaware and trying to hold on to what was before. But those people die off like dinosaurs. I think the goal is to pay them no mind, march forward and embrace the growth that makes us human.â€ â€œEvery time thereâ€™s been social advancement as we wake up, the American story, the human story is one of constant social awakening and growth, and thatâ€™s what makes us good,â€ the leading man added. Evans voices the character Buzz Lightyear, whose intergalactic adventure inspires a sentient toy action figure with the same name in the long-running â€œToy Storyâ€ franchise. The animated film has recently come under fire from conservatives who claim that the LGBTQ representation, including a scene with a same-sex married couple kissing, was purposely marketed to influence children. The scene in question occurs between Hawthorne, Buzzâ€™s female best friend and commander voiced by Uzo Aduba, and another female character. On Monday, Variety reported that the scene would not be shown in Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Kuwait and certain other Asian countries, based on the inclusion of the same-sex kiss in the film. The UAEâ€™s youth and culture ministry confirmed in a tweet that the spinoff â€œis not licensed for public screening in all cinemas in the UAE, due to its violation of the countryâ€™s media content standards.â€ The Media Regulatory Office announced that the animated film Lightyear, which is scheduled for release on 16th June, is not licensed for public screening in all cinemas in the UAE, due to its violation of the countryâ€™s media content standards. pic.twitter.com/f3iYwXqs1D Previously, Disney had reportedly nixed the scene from the film entirely, but reinstated it after receiving backlash from its employees for its inaction on Floridaâ€™s â€œDonâ€™t Say Gayâ€ bill, Variety reported in March. Disney CEO Bob Chapek apologized at the time for the media companyâ€™s failure to take a more forceful stand against the bill. â€œSpeaking to you, reading your messages, and meeting with you have helped me better understand how painful our silence was,â€ Chapek wrote. â€œIt is clear that this is not just an issue about a bill in Florida, but instead yet another challenge to basic human rights.â€ â€œYou needed me to be a stronger ally in the fight for equal rights and I let you down,â€ the chief executive added. â€œI am sorry.â€ Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signed the bill in March. It bans public school teachers in Florida from holding classroom instruction about sexual orientation or gender identity. â€œLightyearâ€ is set to premiere in select theaters on Friday. Watch the trailer below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jimmy Kimmel Exposes Donald Trump Jr.'s Most 'Shameless' Hypocrisy Yet
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Jimmy Kimmel called out Donald Trump Jr. for talking tough about China while exploiting his own fans and his fatherâ€™s supporters by selling them overpriced merch made in China. â€œShameless, worthless grifters and leeches is what these people are,â€ Kimmel said on â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ on Thursday. â€œAnd remember that!â€ Kimmel ordered a bunch of items from Trump Jr.â€™s shop, including goods with deceptive language in the description, such as â€œdesigned and printed in the USA!â€ and then showed the labels so viewers could see where theyâ€™re really made. Check it out in his monologue: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Josh Brolin Interviews Himself In A Funny Swipe At Every Celebrity Chat Ever
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œOuter Rangeâ€ star Josh Brolin had to interview himself when fellow actor Jeremy Renner couldnâ€™t make it â€• and he nailed it. (Watch the video below.) Brolin turned the reflective Q&A for Varietyâ€™s â€œActors on Actorsâ€ series into a parody of celebrity sit-downs, from the reporter fawning to the actorâ€™s self-importance. â€œSorry, I donâ€™t mean to make you uncomfortable,â€ says the baseball-cap-wearing version of Brolin. â€œItâ€™s that when you respect somebody as much as I respect you ... Do you mind if I look at you in the eye, or do you want me to look down?â€ The other Brolin later complains with a straight face that his 1- and 3-year-old kids â€œare really trying to take the limelight from me right now and itâ€™s tough, you know? I bring them to school, and when Iâ€™m walking down the street, when somebody says, â€˜Hey, man, I love your work,â€™ it makes it all worth it for me. But right now, thereâ€™s been a lot of, like, â€˜Oh, my God, what a cute little kid,â€™ and Iâ€™m like, â€˜Hello?â€™â€ He revs up the vanity when discussing how he got the role of Thanos in the â€œAvengersâ€ franchise and appears to fall asleep at one point. â€œShould I wake him?â€ the interviewer Brolin asks. The man who was originally supposed to ask the questions praised Brolin. â€œHe crushed it as he always does,â€ Renner, his â€œAvengers: Endgameâ€ co-star, said. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: â€˜Lightyearâ€™ Stays Earthbound, â€˜Jurassic Worldâ€™ Holds No. 1
content: â€œLightyearâ€ did not go to infinity (or beyond) in its first weekend in theaters: Pixarâ€™s first major theatrical release since March 2020 blasted off with $51 million in its first weekend in North America, according to studio estimates on Sunday. Not only did it open lower than expected, but it also failed to conquer â€œJurassic World: Dominion,â€ which held on to the first-place spot with $58.7 million its second weekend. It is a mixed bag for Disney and Pixar as â€œLightyear,â€ an origin story about the movie that inspired the space ranger action figure in the â€œToy Storyâ€ movies, is one of the biggest launches for an animated family film over the pandemic. Including international showings, which grossed $34.6 million, â€œLightyearâ€™sâ€ global opening weekend totals to $85.6 million. But expectations were higher for a release this high-profile and based on a beloved character. The family audience has proved a little more reluctant than other segments to return to movie theaters. Many studios, including Disney and Pixar, have opted for streaming or hybrid releases for their animated titles. Since the beginning of the pandemic, the company has sent its Pixar titles â€” â€œSoul,â€ â€œLuca,â€ and â€œTurning Redâ€ â€” directly to Disney+ free for subscribers. Disneyâ€™s other big animated titles, â€œRaya and the Last Dragonâ€ and â€œEncantoâ€ got hybrid releases. Critics were mostly favorable to â€œLightyear,â€ which features Chris Evans as Buzz Lightyear and a supporting voice cast that includes Keke Palmer and Taika Waititi. Directed by Angus MacLane, it currently holds a 77% critics score on Rotten Tomatoes. Audiences gave it an A- CinemaScore. â€œJurassic World: Dominion,â€ meanwhile, has now earned over $622.2 million worldwide with $259.2 million of that coming from U.S. and Canadian theaters. Itâ€™s only the seventh movie released during the pandemic to surpass $600 million. And in its fourth weekend, â€œTop Gun: Maverickâ€ dropped only slightly, bringing in an additional $44 million. Its domestic total is now at $466.2 million. Globally, the high-flying sequel has grossed over $885 million.

topic: 'What Are You Talking About?!?': John Oliver Nails The Insanity Of GOP's Take On Guns
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost John Oliver tore into Republicans on Sunday night for their usual response to mass shootings. â€œWe all know what the key problem is here: Itâ€™s guns,â€ Oliver said. â€œItâ€™s because we let basically whoever wants to buy a gun in this country have one, which has led to tragic consequences.â€ Most mass shooters â€• including the gunman who killed 19 children and two teachers at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas, last month â€• obtain their weapons legally. â€œSo, we know what the answer to this problem is, too: Itâ€™s gun control,â€ the host of â€œLast Week Tonightâ€ said. â€œItâ€™s meaningful, effective gun laws.â€ Yet Republicans are â€œdesperately pitchingâ€ other solutions. Oliver then played clips of conservatives calling for everything from religion to â€œballistic blanketsâ€ in schools. â€œWhat are you talking about?!?â€ Oliver asked. â€œUse a blanket is not a strategy for stopping deaths during a school shooting. Itâ€™s barely a strategy for â€˜a bird got in the house.â€™â€ But one of the most common talking points â€• especially from the right â€• involves putting more police into schools, despite the fact that there are few instances of cops stopping would-be mass shooters. And in many instances, those same officers end up hurting the very kids theyâ€™re sworn to protect, especially children of color: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: topic
content: content

topic: Amber Heard Speaks Out On Trial, Says Social Media Was Unfair
content: Breaking News Reporter, HuffPost Actor Amber Heard, in her first sit-down interview after a jury unanimously concluded that she defamed her ex-husband Johnny Depp, criticized the role that she believes social media played in her trial, calling it unfair but saying she doesnâ€™t blame the jury. â€œI actually understand,â€ she told NBC Newsâ€™ Savannah Guthrie in a clip that aired Monday. â€œHeâ€™s a beloved character and people feel they know him. Heâ€™s a fantastic actor.â€ Heard was sued for $50 million in damages over a 2018 opinion piece she published in The Washington Post about, in her words, becoming a â€œpublic figure representing domestic abuse.â€ The essay did not mention Depp by name but his attorneys argued that it indirectly referred to their marriage. .@savannahguthrie sat down for an exclusive conversation with #AmberHeard. "You cannot tell me that you think that this has been fair,â€ Heard shared, in reference to social media representation. pic.twitter.com/56Ju7pYg1x Throughout the trial, jurors were instructed to stay off social media and not read related news coverage. They were not sequestered, however, and so Heardâ€™s attorneys, without supporting evidence, have insisted that the jury was undoubtedly influenced by the posts and videos that flooded social media with hashtags like #justiceforjohnnydepp and #amberheardisguilty. Heard, who plans to appeal the verdict, emphasized this. â€œEven somebody who is sure Iâ€™m deserving of all this hate and vitriol, even if you think that Iâ€™m lying, you still couldnâ€™t tell me â€” look me in the eye and tell me â€” that you think on social media thereâ€™s been a fair representation,â€ she told Guthrie. â€œYou cannot tell me that you think that this has been fair.â€ Guthrie reminded Heard that the jury ultimately did not believe the evidence her attorneys presented or her testimony. Heard suggested that efforts to paint her as non-credible blinded the jury. #AmberHeard shares with @savannahguthrie that she doesnâ€™t blame the jury: â€œI donâ€™t blame them. I actually understand. He's a beloved character and people feel they know him. He's a fantastic actor." pic.twitter.com/rjWY629MkG â€œHow could they [believe me] after listening to three and a half weeks of testimony about how I was a non-credible person. Not to believe a word that came out of my mouth,â€ she said. Deppâ€™s attorneys have denied that social media played any role in the juryâ€™s decision, insisting that the jury came to its decision through the evidence presented. â€œI donâ€™t think thereâ€™s any reason to believe that the jurors violated their oath,â€ attorney Ben Chew said in a previous interview with Guthrie. â€œThis was a decision made by the jury on the evidence presented by both sides.â€ More of Heardâ€™s interview with Guthrie is scheduled to air on Tuesday and Wednesday on NBCâ€™s â€œToday.â€ An hourlong special will air Friday on â€œDateline NBCâ€ at 8 p.m./7 p.m. CT. Breaking News Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Kim Kardashian Didn't Damage Marilyn Monroe's Dress, Ripley's Museum Says
content: NEW YORK (AP) â€” Ripleyâ€™s Believe It or Not! on Thursday denied claims that Kim Kardashianâ€™s wearing of the iconic Marilyn Monroe â€œHappy Birthdayâ€ dress left it with new damage. ChadMichael Morrisette, who owns a mannequin supply company and once handled the skintight sparkler briefly worn by Kardashian at the Met Gala, said he spotted fresh damage to the crystal-covered garment when he popped in for a look at a Ripleyâ€™s Los Angeles location. Morrisette shared photos taken on June 12 of the 60-year-old dress with a friend and fellow Monroe collector, who caused a stir earlier this week when he posted before and after shots on social media. â€œIt makes me sad. I ran out in tears,â€ Morrisette told The Associated Press. Kardashian changed into a replica after climbing the Grand Staircase of the Metropolitan Museum of Art on May 2. She wore the nude-colored dress for just a few minutes. Ripleyâ€™s purchased the dress for $4.8 million in 2016 at an auction. Morrisette said he was hired to stage Monroe memorabilia that included the look Monroe wore in 1962 to serenade then-President John F. Kennedy for his 45th birthday. â€œFrom the bottom of the Met steps, where Kim got into the dress, to the top where it was returned, the dress was in the same condition it started in,â€ Ripleyâ€™s Amanda Joiner, vice president of publishing and licensing, said in the statement. She was with the dress the day of the gala and during its transport from Orlando, Florida, where it was last displayed, to New York, according to Ripleyâ€™s. Morrisetteâ€™s photos, alongside pre-Met Gala images of the dress, lit up social media amid criticism at the time of the gala that Kardashian should not have been allowed to don the delicate and historically notable dress. It was made of a flammable fabric that is no longer on the market. Morrisette said he was stunned to see its condition. He said he saw the fabric stretched at the back zipper and hook enclosures with new hand-stitched crystals missing. He also said the shoulders appeared stressed. He said that level of damage wasnâ€™t present the more than a dozen times he has viewed the dress over the years. Ripleyâ€™s said soon after the gala that care was taken in the handling of the dress and no alterations were allowed. Kardashian changed into a replica after reaching the top of the stairs. She kept the back of the dress hidden under a white jacket, leading to speculation the gown wasnâ€™t zipped all the way up. According to Ripleyâ€™s, a report written on the dressâ€™s condition in early 2017 states that â€œa number of the seams are pulled and worn. This is not surprising given how delicate the material is. There is puckering at the back by the hooks and eyes,â€ among other instances of damage. The dress adorned with more than 2,500 crystals was custom made for Monroe. It was based on a sketch by the famed designer Bob Mackie, working for the costumer Jean Louis at the time. Asked for Kardashianâ€™s reaction to the damage controversy, a representative passed along Ripleyâ€™s statement with no additional comment. Ripleyâ€™s said it allowed Kardashian to wear the dress to keep Monroeâ€™s legacy alive. â€œOur mission is to both entertain and educate visitors and fans, and sparking conversations like the discourse around Marilyn Monroeâ€™s dress does just that,â€ the company said. â€œNo matter which side of the debate you are on, the historical importance of the dress has not been negated, but rather highlighted. A entirely new group of young people have now been introduced to the legacy of Marilyn Monroe.â€ ___ Follow Associated Press journalist Leanne Italie on Twitter at http://twitter.com/litalie

topic: Bryan Cranston Has A New Look And Twitter Is Loving It
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost The internet is thrilled about Bryan Cranstonâ€™s transformation. On Tuesday, the actor sat down with â€œTodayâ€ hosts Hoda Kotb and Jenna Bush Hager sporting a full, thick beard â€” and of course, people had questions. The typically clean-shaven Cranston didnâ€™t hold back the humor, joking that he wanted to â€œmake a pillowâ€ using the hair from his beard. â€œIâ€™m not shaving,â€ he said. Cranston said he grew out his beard to play his character Michael Desiato in the second season of Showtimeâ€™s â€œYour Honor.â€ The show follows a respected judge whose son is involved in a hit and run that involves an organized crime family. â€œThe first season was about a man who loses his soul and sells his principles off for what he thought was the greater good,â€ Cranston said. â€œThe second season of â€˜Your Honorâ€™ is really about redemption. Where can someone go? Is there a place for that kind of sincerity and apologies within our society?â€ The performer also showcased his beard at the Tony Awards on Sunday, which prompted a slew of gushing tweets from fans. Bryan Cranston with the beard can get it. #Tonys Bryan Cranstonâ€™s beard has arrived at #TonyAwards, and we welcome it. pic.twitter.com/zwfcwtWWrC Bryan Cranstonâ€™s beard is so majestic #TonyAwards pic.twitter.com/CxPFb8QpgE The actor said he has been learning â€œall these things about men with huge beardsâ€ while rocking his bushy look â€” namely, the fact that he can mimic a cartoon villain by twisting the ends of his mustache to make them curl upward. â€œItâ€™s a Chia Pet, sort of,â€ Hager said, causing Cranston to nod in agreement. The Emmy Award-winning actor said heâ€™ll begin shooting the drama series in a â€œcouple of weeks.â€ Watch the trailer below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 25 Of The Funniest Tweets About Cats And Dogs This Week
content: Reporter, HuffPost Woof â€” itâ€™s been a long week. If you feel like youâ€™ve been working like a dog, let us offer you the internet equivalent of a big pile of catnip: hilarious tweets about pets. We Shih Tzu not. Each week at HuffPost, we scour Twitter to find the funniest posts about our furballs being complete goofballs. Theyâ€™re sure to make you howl. (And if you want some more, no need to beg â€• check out last weekâ€™s batch right here.) welp, gonna be a hard evening. going to have the 'capitalism is collapsing' talk with my cats. this is the hardest part about having a cat Translation:Every time I order a burger, my cat haunts me and my burger, and I can't eat it peacefully. Can you please cook another mini burger for him by slicing 20 gram from my own burger. pic.twitter.com/YBtCg1lIAq Classic kitten trick: send out the smallest, cutest one to sucker someone in and thenâ€¦ BAM reveal that they need to adopt all 12 of ya. topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Eric Swalwell Shares Recording Of Death Threat After Marjorie Taylor Greene Attack
content:
Senior Reporter, HuffPost Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) shared an audio recording of a disturbing threat Wednesday that he said he received because of false statements made by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.). â€œMarjorie loves to play the victim. But sheâ€™s an inciter of violence. Her constant attacks â€” even after the FBI said I was never suspected of wrongdoing â€” lead to threatening calls like this,â€ he tweeted alongside the audio clip. â€œThis caller from today threatened to kill my three children.â€ In the recording, a manâ€™s voice said: â€œHey, you little cocksucker. You still banging the Chinese spy Fang Fang? ... Weâ€™re coming to your house this weekend. Gonâ€™ get you and them little mutant bastards, them little mutant offspring of yours. Weâ€™re gonâ€™ get ya.â€ Earlier Wednesday, Swalwell had shared a story about an interaction with a supporter of former President Donald Trump that happened while the congressman was giving a tour of the U.S. Capitol. He said a man shouted at him and then told his son, â€œThatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ Today I gave a tour in the Capitol and was stopped by a father with his young boy. The father yelled at me â€œHey Swalwellâ€ and then told his son, â€œthatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ I kept walking and felt sad for the boy. Heâ€™s being raised in a cult family. Greene responded to the tweet by saying there was â€œno way that happened.â€ â€œBecause we all know good Trump supporting fathers would say, â€œthatâ€™s the Democrat who had sex with a Chinese spy,â€ she tweeted. Swalwell has been targeted by right-wing disinformation over his past connection to a suspected Chinese intelligence operative named Fang Fang or Christine Fang. According to a 2020 Axios report, Fang targeted up-and-coming politicians in the Bay Area and the U.S., including Swalwell. Fang reportedly took part in fundraising activity for Swalwellâ€™s 2014 reelection campaign and recommended an intern for his office. Federal investigators said they alerted Swalwell to their concerns in 2015 and he immediately cut all ties with Fang, Axios reported. He was not accused of any wrongdoing or of passing on any classified intelligence. Fang allegedly had sexual relationships with at least two Midwestern mayors. Swalwell was not accused of having sex with her. Senior Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Arkansasâ€™ Israel Boycott Pledge Law Upheld By Appeals Court
content:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) â€” A federal appeals court on Wednesday upheld Arkansasâ€™ law requiring state contractors to pledge not to boycott Israel, finding the restriction is not an unconstitutional violation of free speech. The full 8th Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals reversed a 2-1 decision last year by a three-judge panel of the court that found the requirement to be unconstitutional. The Arkansas Times had sued to block the law, which requires contractors with the state to reduce their fees by 20% if they donâ€™t sign the pledge. â€œ(The law) only prohibits economic decisions that discriminate against Israel,â€ Judge Jonathan Kobes wrote in the courtâ€™s opinion. â€œBecause those commercial decisions are invisible to observers unless explained, they are not inherently expressive and do not implicate the First Amendment.â€ A federal judge in 2019 dismissed the Timesâ€™ lawsuit, ruling that the boycotts are not protected by the First Amendment. A three-judge panel of the appeals court reversed that ruling, and the state appealed to the full appeals court. The American Civil Liberties Union, which represented the Times, said it planned to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court. â€œWe hope and expect that the Supreme Court will set things right and reaffirm the nationâ€™s historic commitment to providing robust protection to political boycotts,â€ Brian Hauss, senior staff attorney for the ACLU Foundationâ€™s Speech, Privacy & Technology Project, said in a statement. The new ruling didnâ€™t give a breakdown of how judges decided, but at least one dissented, saying the law is written so broadly that it could go beyond boycotts. â€œOne could imagine a company posting anti-Israel signs, donating to causes that promote a boycott of Israel, encouraging others to boycott Israel, or even publicly criticizing the act with the intent to â€˜limit commercial relations with Israelâ€™ as a general matter,â€ Judge Jane Kelly wrote in her dissent. â€œAnd any of that conduct would arguably fall within the prohibition.â€ The Timesâ€™ lawsuit said the University of Arkansas Pulaski Technical College refused to contract for advertising with the newspaper unless the paper signed the pledge. The newspaper isnâ€™t engaged in a boycott against Israel. â€œToday is a resounding victory for Arkansasâ€™s anti-discrimination law and reinforces Arkansasâ€™s relationship with our long-time ally, Israel,â€ Republican Attorney General Leslie Rutledge, whose office defended the law, said in a statement. Republican legislators in Arkansas who drafted the 2017 law have said it wasnâ€™t prompted by a specific incident in the state. It followed similar restrictions enacted by other states in response to a movement promoting boycotts, divestment and sanctions of Israeli institutions and businesses over the countryâ€™s treatment of Palestinians. Israeli officials say the campaign masks a deeper goal of delegitimizing and even destroying the country. Similar measures in Arizona, Kansas and Texas that were blocked were later allowed to be enforced after lawmakers narrowed the requirement so it applied only to larger contracts. Arkansasâ€™ law applies to contracts worth $1,000 or more. Citing its anti-boycott law, Arizona last year sold off millions of dollars in Unilever bonds over subsidiary Ben & Jerryâ€™s decision to stop selling its ice cream in Israeli-occupied territories. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Reports: Paul Haggis Detained In Italy In Sex Assault Case
content: ROME (AP) â€” Film director Paul Haggis was detained on Sunday for investigation of allegations that he sexually assaulted a woman in southern Italy, Italian news media said, quoting local prosecutors. The Canadian-born, Oscar-winning Haggis, 69, has been in Italy for a film festival that begins on Tuesday in Ostuni, a tourist town in Puglia, the region that forms the â€œheelâ€ of the Italian peninsula. The news agency LaPresse and several other Italian media carried a written statement from prosecutors in the nearby city of Brindisi that they were investigating allegations a â€œyoung foreign womanâ€ was forced to have â€œnon-consensualâ€ sexual relations over two days. Prosecutors Antonio Negro and Livia Orlando, who are conducting the investigation, said in the statement that the woman was â€œforced to seek medical careâ€ following the sexual relations. After a couple of days â€œof non-consensual relations, the woman was accompanied by the manâ€ to Brindisi airport on Sunday and â€œwas left there at dawn despite (her) precarious physical and psychological conditions.â€ The Brindisi prosecutorsâ€™ office was closed on Sunday. Haggisâ€™s attorney didnâ€™t immediately respond to a request for comment. The prosecutors said airport staff and police noticed her â€œobvious confused stateâ€ and â€ and after lending initial treatment, took her to Brindisiâ€™s police headquarters, where officers accompanied her to a local hospital for examination. Police at headquartersâ€™ operations room said they werenâ€™t authorized to give out information about the case, including whether Haggis was being held at the police station or at a hotel or other lodging. Haggis is a director, producer and screenwriter. He won an Oscar in 2006 for best original screenplay for â€œCrash.â€ Prosecutors also were quoted as saying that the woman â€œformalized her complaint and cited circumstances which were subsequently looked into for confirmation by investigators.â€ They didnâ€™t cite her nationality or age.

topic: Everyone Couldn't Stop Flirting With Andrew Garfield At The Tony Awards
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Quickly becoming the award show guest most likely to go viral, Andrew Garfield made quite the impression at the Tony Awards on Sunday night. Weeks after he was caught texting at the Oscars, spawning many a meme across social media, the â€œSpider-Manâ€ star repeatedly stole the focus during Broadwayâ€™s biggest night, despite his best efforts to just get through the show. After arriving at the 75th annual ceremony in a double-breasted black velvet suit (more on that later), Garfield became an unsuspecting star in one of host Ariana DeBoseâ€™s musical numbers for the evening. Riffing on how audiences are forced to participate during award shows, the â€œWest Side Storyâ€ star traipsed through the crowd at Radio City Music Hall before quite literally settling on the British actor. â€œI am close to you, oh so close to you / I am touching you, thereâ€™s not a lot that you can do,â€ DeBose belted, as she poked Garfield directly in the face, before sitting on his lap. Turning previously undiscovered shades of red, a blushing Garfield leaned into the bit, pulling DeBose in for a hug, while she continued to sing. NO BECAUSE THIS LEGITIMATELY WOULD BE ME IF I EVER SAW ANDREW GARFIELD #TonyAwards pic.twitter.com/sPwC0XpzOZ Eventually, DeBose moved on to other unsuspecting audience members, but Garfield wasnâ€™t out of the woods just yet. Later in the evening, the actor took the stage with Nathan Lane to present the Tony Award for Best Play, which ultimately went to â€œThe Lehman Trilogy.â€ The two starred together in 2017â€™s â€œAngels in Americaâ€ revival, for which Garfield won the trophy for Best Actor in a Play and Lane took home the prize for Best Featured Actor in a Play. Seemingly abandoning whatever was written on the teleprompter, a looser-than-ever Lane opened the segment by joking that heâ€™s been â€œpounding Jell-O shots with Chita Rivera all night.â€ â€œAndrew, look at you. Darling dear, Andrew Garfield ... Iâ€™ve missed you so much,â€ Lane continued, remarking that working together on the revival was one of the â€œhighlights of my careerâ€ before praising his co-starâ€™s work in the recent â€œTick, Tick... Boom.â€ Lane then riffed on the filmâ€™s title at length, adding that he starred in a â€œmuch less successful film called â€œBoom, Boom... Tickâ€ and joking that he played an â€œexotic dancer afflicted with a huge facial twitch.â€ An increasingly uncomfortable Garfield played along, as Lane spasmed on stage, before turning his attention back to the Marvel star. â€œI love a man in a velvet suit,â€ Lane added, as Garfield, stifling a major giggle fit, attempted to rein him in by announcing the categoryâ€™s nominees. Andrew Garfield and Nathan Lane presenting Best Play at the 75th Annual Tony Awards pic.twitter.com/AzOwSf4CCo Naturally, Garfieldâ€™s presence at the ceremony provoked a slew of reactions online about his consistently delightful award show behavior. I respect Ariana DeBose for realizing what is the point of hosting an award show if you donâ€™t use that opportunity to sit on Andrew Garfieldâ€™s lap Three hours of Nathan Lane flirting with Andrew Garfield as Garfield blushes please the way andrew garfield has stolen the show at every award show this year pic.twitter.com/wsq1tOmUGo Andrew Garfield be blushing and smiling so hard when being flirted with on live tv #TonyAwards pic.twitter.com/MKkOIna1RJ Would watch a show where Nathan Lathan hits on Andrew Garfield until he's reduced to giggles. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Prince William And Kate Middleton Joke About Prince Louis' Hilarious Antics
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Prince Louis was the breakthrough hit at his great-grandmotherâ€™s Platinum Jubilee celebrations, and his parents are embracing it. The little royal captivated onlookers as he unabashedly acted his age, rotating between excited and cuddly, cheeky, bored and just plain over it during the festivities to celebrate Queen Elizabethâ€™s 70 years on the throne. â€œWhat a fantastic weekend of celebrations,â€ Prince William and Kate Middleton wrote on their official Twitter account Monday. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge thanked all those who participated in the festivities across London and the U.K. â€œWe all had an incredible time, especially Louisâ€¦ â€ they added. What a fantastic weekend of celebrations. Seeing people across the nation coming together with family, friends and loved ones has been extremely special. (1/3) pic.twitter.com/HnyN0wOn1l Thank you to everyone who turned out to show their gratitude to The Queen and her inspiring 70 years of leadership. From the crowds on the Mall to communities hosting street parties up and down the country, we hope you had a weekend to remember. (2/3) pic.twitter.com/H5NlpIIeAl We all had an incredible time, especially Louisâ€¦ ğŸ‘€ (3/3)W & C pic.twitter.com/HFgK72kU05 Prince Louis watched parts of the jubilee with his two siblings, Princess Charlotte and Prince George; his parents; his grandfather Prince Charles and Charlesâ€™ wife, Camilla, the Duchess of Cornwall. They all joined the 96-year-old queen for an appearance from her balcony Sunday. Prince Harry, Meghan Markle and their two children, Archie and Lilibet, were also in London to celebrate the milestone, but only appeared sporadically. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Princess Charlotte Slyly Corrects Prince George On Palace Balcony
content: Reporter, HuffPost A cute moment between two of the Cambridge kids was almost overlooked. Princess Charlotte was seen adorably correcting her older brother, Prince George, during their family balcony appearance on the last day of Queen Elizabeth IIâ€™s Platinum Jubilee celebrations. On Sunday, Queen Elizabeth stood on the balcony of Buckingham Palace alongside her son Prince Charles and his wife, Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall; grandson Prince William and his wife, Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge; and their children, George, 8, Charlotte, 7, and Prince Louis, 4. As the national anthem, â€œGod Save the Queen,â€ played, George was spotted placing his hand on the balcony ledge. Charlotte quickly noticed and slyly nudged her brother, appearing to say â€œArms down, George!â€â€‹â€‹ George then quickly drops his hand, places it by his side and stands up straight. You can watch the exchange in the video above. A similar moment took place Thursday, the first day of the jubilee, when the three great-grandchildren of the queen rode in a carriage with their mother and Duchess Camilla for the Trooping the Colour festivities. As they rode through the parade on a carriage, they all waved to the crowd. When they stopped waving, Louis enthusiastically continued to wave, causing Charlotte to place her hand on his hand and pull it down. Still, Louis took up his waving again just moments later, because, of course he did. As weâ€™ve all witnessed during the jubilee, Louis can be quite the ham. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jennifer Lopez Gets Emotional Talking About Her 'Ride Or Die' At The MTV Movie & TV Awards
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Jennifer Lopez let the emotions flow during her acceptance speech at the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards on Sunday. The â€œMarry Meâ€ actor was honored with the Generation Award at the ceremony. According to the long-running cable channel, the coveted award â€œcelebrates beloved actors whose diverse contributions to both film and television have turned them into household names.â€ â€œI look at those movies and I see all the wonderful people that Iâ€™ve been blessed to know and to work with. Youâ€™re only as good as the people that you work with,â€ Lopez said during her acceptance speech after a collection of clips from her 30-year-long career played. The always ğ“²ğ“¬ğ“¸ğ“·ğ“²ğ“¬ @JLo â€“ your 2022 #MTVAwards Generation Award Honoree â­ï¸ pic.twitter.com/K0py3rbWR9 â€œAnd if youâ€™re lucky, they make you better. And I have been very lucky in that regard. As an actor, Iâ€™m not any of the women that Iâ€™ve played, but thereâ€™s a part of what is deeply true to me in each one of those characters,â€ she continued. Lopez, whose run in Hollywood has spanned TV, music, film and fashion, had a special message for her haters. â€œI want to thank all the people who told me to my face or when I wasnâ€™t in the room that I couldnâ€™t do this. I really donâ€™t think I could have done it without you! And I know I couldnâ€™t have done it without the fans,â€ she said during her speech. The New York actor went on to sing praises for her manager, Benny Medina, who she said was â€œthe true meaning of ride or die.â€ Although Lopez rekindled her relationship with Ben Affleck last year and is currently engaged to him, he was not mentioned by name in her speech. Past recipients of the Generation Award include cinema heavy-hitters such as Jim Carrey, Tom Cruise, Robert Downey Jr., Adam Sandler, Sandra Bullock, Dwayne Johnson and Ben Stiller, among others. Lopez, who stars in â€œHALFTIMEâ€, a documentary about her career, releasing on Netflix on June 14, also currently holds the title as the only artist to have a No. 1 album and No. 1 movie simultaneously. Check out a full list of winners from the 2022 MTV Movie & TV Awards here. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jimmy Kimmel Finds The Perfect Soundtrack For The Jan. 6 Committee Hearings
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Former President Donald Trumpâ€™s attempt to overthrow U.S. democracy reminds Jimmy Kimmel of a certain messy TV drama about power, politics and money. â€œThis story gets crazier with each time. It really should be called â€œThey Did What-ergate?â€ because we learned today that Trump knew what he was trying to do was illegal and â€• youâ€™re not going to believe this â€• he went ahead and did it anyway,â€ Kimmel said Thursday on â€œJimmy Kimmel Live,â€ following the third hearing of the House select committee that investigated the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol insurrection. â€œSo it was the third of what will be six hearings, and theyâ€™re so dramatic, itâ€™s hard to believe it isnâ€™t scripted.â€ Kimmel then showed some of the most damning findings presented by the committee so far, set to the title theme from â€œSuccession.â€ â€œNow, of course, the difference between Logan Roy and Donald Trump is Logan actually gave his son a birthday card, and Ericâ€™s never had that,â€ he noted. Check out his roast below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost
