topic: Halsey Covers Kate Bushâ€™s â€˜Running Up That Hillâ€™ After â€˜Stranger Thingsâ€™ Resurgence
content: Reporter, HuffPost Weâ€™d like to imagine that Halsey spotted Sadie Sink in the crowd. The â€œBad at Loveâ€ singer covered Kate Bushâ€™s â€œRunning Up That Hill (A Deal with God)â€ to the festival stage as the Saturday headliner for New York Cityâ€™s Governors Ball Music Festival. The song has had a cultural resurgence thanks to heavy play and plot relevance on Season 4 of Netflixâ€™s â€œStranger Things.â€ insanity babes pic.twitter.com/ApexiTMLfM Not to give too much away, but in the latest season of the sci-fi series, Max Mayfield (Sadie Sink) listens to Bushâ€™s song on loop as she struggles to cope with the death of her brother, Billy Hargrove (Dacre Montgomery), who died in Season 3. The song later reveals a weakness in the seasonâ€™s new villain. Thanks to it playing numerous times on the show, â€œRunning Up That Hillâ€ has been sitting pretty at the top music charts since the showâ€™s season premiered on May 27. It is currently number one on Spotifyâ€™s Top 50 U.S. charts, number two on Amazon, number four on iTunes  and number eight on Billboardâ€™s Hot 100. So, itâ€™s very much a thing. And itâ€™s very cool that Bushâ€™s song is resonating strongly with a new generation of fans. But, when it comes to songs getting repopularized thanks to films and movies, stranger things have happened. Queenâ€™s 1975 song â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€ became a huge hit in the 1990s when it was lip synced with gusto by a bunch of metal heads in 1992â€™s â€œWayneâ€™s World.â€ And thanks to a very sexy wheel-throwing scene (which feels like a strange sentence to write in and of itself) the Righteous Brothersâ€™ 1965 song â€œUnchained Melodyâ€ also saw a surge due to 1990â€™s â€œGhost.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'Get A Vasectomy': Khloe Kardashian Reacts To Tristan Thompson's Cheating Scandal
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Tristan Thompsonâ€™s second, third, fourth, fifth and sixth chance officially ran out on â€œThe Kardashiansâ€ season finale when KhloÃ© Kardashian discovered with the rest of the world that heâ€™d cheated on her once again. The reality TV star and the basketball player, who share 4-year-old daughter True, have had the rockiest of romances since they were first linked in 2016, due to Thompsonâ€™s multiple cheating scandals. But just when the two had put the past behind them, Thompson admitted in January that he had fathered a child with Maralee Nichols while he was still in a relationship with Kardashian. The fallout from the paternity bombshell was documented on Thursdayâ€™s episode of the family Hulu reality series, with the Good American designer learning about Thompsonâ€™s infidelity in real time. Kim Kardashian was the first to break the news to her sister, whom cameras catch sobbing on the other end of a phone call. â€œI find out what Tristan is doing with the rest of the world,â€ KhloÃ© Kardashian said in a confessional interview. â€œA courtesy would be not doing it. But fine, if you do it, youâ€™re not even gonna [give me] a fucking heads-up before the rest of the world? Itâ€™s just an additional slap in my face. Itâ€™s humiliating. Iâ€™m embarrassed.â€ â€œIâ€™m replaying every event, every grand gesture, every trip, every dateâ€¦ all of that was a lie,â€ she continued. â€œI feel just not really in my own body; these things are just happening and Iâ€™m going through the motions. But when things happen to you a few times, you do kinda become immune to them, which is really sad.â€ Kardashian later said that she believes Thompson wouldâ€™ve never come clean about his deception had there not been another child involved. His admission came only after Nichols sued for child support and the results of a paternity test revealed that the NBA player was indeed the childâ€™s father. Nichols welcomed a baby boy in December 2021, which led Thompson to release an Instagram statement at the time in which he pledged to take â€œfull responsibility for my actionsâ€ and apologized to â€œeveryone Iâ€™ve hurt or disappointed throughout this ordeal both publicly and privately.â€ Thompson also shares a son, Prince, born in December 2016, with ex-girlfriend Jordan Craig. â€œEverything is an act of betrayal, everything is a lie. Itâ€™s manipulation, itâ€™s deceit,â€ Kardashian said in the episode. â€œThe entire thing is despicable.â€ The season finale showed family members rallying around Kardashian, with each of them reacting to the news of Thompsonâ€™s behavior. Kim Kardashian is tempted to â€œput him on blastâ€ and lashes out at the â€œtrolls on the internet that make KhloÃ© feel like the biggest piece of shit.â€ Momager Kris Jenner, meanwhile, called Thompsonâ€™s cheating â€œsuch a lack of respectâ€ and a â€œpattern of bad behavior.â€ â€œThis is not something that can be undone,â€ she continued. â€œIf heâ€™s in this pattern, why does she have to keep suffering? Thatâ€™s what breaks my heart.â€ Thompson previously cheated on Kardashian days before she gave birth to their daughter back in 2018. A year later, the NBA player was caught cheating again with Kylie Jennerâ€™s best friend, Jordyn Woods. The couple eventually reconciled again, only for reports to surface that Thompson was unfaithful at a birthday party in June 2021. #TheKardashiansÂ Â Â Â  #KardashiansÂ Â Â Â  #KardashiansonhuluÂ Â Â Â   s1e10Khloe on Tristan:You either wear a condom, get a vasectomy, or you donâ€™t f**k random people that you meet in other states.It is not like rocket science ğŸš€ ğŸ§ª pic.twitter.com/HlwySFLw0k Ultimately, KhloÃ© Kardashian said that sheâ€™s â€œnumbâ€ to the all-too-familiar sense of betrayal from Thompson. She eventually reached out to him at the end of the episode, saying it was â€œmore yelling on my end.â€ â€œYou either wear a condom, get a vasectomy, or you donâ€™t fuck random people that you meet in other states,â€ she said in a sit-down with Kim. â€œItâ€™s not rocket science.â€ â€œThereâ€™s not much to talk about, in my opinion,â€ she continued. â€œItâ€™s disgusting. Weâ€™re all over it. I didnâ€™t buy tickets to this fucking circus, but somehow Iâ€™m watching all these clowns act out in front of me. I want a refund, return to sender, I donâ€™t want to be at this show.â€ The episode marked the end of the 10-episode first season of the familyâ€™s new reality show on Hulu, which launched in April on the heels of â€œKeeping up with the Kardashiansâ€ coming to a close after 20 seasons on the E! network. But rest assured: More Kardashian drama is on the horizon, as Kim, Kourtney, KhloÃ©, Kris, Kendall and Kylie have all signed on for at least two seasons, with 40 episodes slated overall. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: David Harbour On Millie Bobby Brown: Fame At 11 â€˜Is Really Hard For The Psycheâ€™
content: Reporter, HuffPost David Harbour seems grateful that he found fame later in life. The Los Angeles Timesâ€™ podcast â€œThe Envelopeâ€ recently asked the â€œStranger Thingsâ€ actor about his relationship with his co-star Millie Bobby Brown. The outlet recognized that â€œwhat the kids on the show and Millie in particular have gone throughâ€ by becoming child stars â€œis just remarkable.â€ Most of the kids on the hit Netflix series started on the show, which debuted in 2016, as preteens and were relatively unknown. But thanks to the popularity of â€œStranger Things,â€ most of them â€” especially Brown â€” have become huge stars as teenagers. Harbour admitted that he worries whether his younger co-stars will know what itâ€™s like to lead normal lives and what kinds of effects their fame could have on them. â€œLike I see what these kids have to deal with and, look, whatever. I mean, thereâ€™s a lot of people that go through, I guess a lot worse stuff,â€ Harbour said. â€œBut mentally and psychologically, I think getting extremely famous and being so doted on at 11 years old is really hard for the psyche to reconcile with.â€ He then compared their experiences with his own. â€œIâ€™m lucky because it didnâ€™t happen to me â€™til I was 40,â€ he said. â€œSo I know what itâ€™s like to go to the mall. I know what itâ€™s like to be bullied and humiliated. â€¦ I know what itâ€™s like to have to find friends, not to have people come to me. I donâ€™t know that theyâ€™ll ever have that feeling.â€ He also admitted that his relationship with Brown isnâ€™t as close as the one between their characters. Harbourâ€™s character, Hopper â€” the former sheriff of a small Indiana town â€” acts as a father figure to Brownâ€™s Eleven. Eleven is a girl with supernatural psychic powers who is arguably the central figure on the show. â€œThat relationship is very, very â€” and sheâ€™s dependent on him in a way that Millie has a lot more people around her that sheâ€™s dependent on,â€ Harbour said. Brown has reached a level of celebrity that could be classified as â€œit girlâ€ status. Thanks to her starring role in â€œStranger Things,â€ she scored a role in Michael Doughertyâ€™s â€œGodzillaâ€ franchise. She was also able to produce and star in the successful â€œEnola Holmes,â€ a 2020 movie about the iconic detective Sherlock Holmesâ€™ younger sister â€” with a sequel set to debut this year. She even launched her own vegan skin care line, Florence by Mills. But her fame has come at a cost. At 18, sheâ€™s experienced plenty of sexualization and has spoken out about being bullied online. She also received backlash for faking her skin care routine in an online video to promote her brand when she was only 15 years old â€” which she later apologized for. â€œIâ€™m still learning the best way to share my routines as I get to know this space better â€” Iâ€™m not an expert,â€ the teenager wrote about the video at the time. She later disabled comments on the video on Instagram, which at the time had over 425,000 views. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Eric Swalwell Shares Recording Of Death Threat After Marjorie Taylor Greene Attack
content:
Senior Reporter, HuffPost Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) shared an audio recording of a disturbing threat Wednesday that he said he received because of false statements made by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.). â€œMarjorie loves to play the victim. But sheâ€™s an inciter of violence. Her constant attacks â€” even after the FBI said I was never suspected of wrongdoing â€” lead to threatening calls like this,â€ he tweeted alongside the audio clip. â€œThis caller from today threatened to kill my three children.â€ In the recording, a manâ€™s voice said: â€œHey, you little cocksucker. You still banging the Chinese spy Fang Fang? ... Weâ€™re coming to your house this weekend. Gonâ€™ get you and them little mutant bastards, them little mutant offspring of yours. Weâ€™re gonâ€™ get ya.â€ Earlier Wednesday, Swalwell had shared a story about an interaction with a supporter of former President Donald Trump that happened while the congressman was giving a tour of the U.S. Capitol. He said a man shouted at him and then told his son, â€œThatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ Today I gave a tour in the Capitol and was stopped by a father with his young boy. The father yelled at me â€œHey Swalwellâ€ and then told his son, â€œthatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ I kept walking and felt sad for the boy. Heâ€™s being raised in a cult family. Greene responded to the tweet by saying there was â€œno way that happened.â€ â€œBecause we all know good Trump supporting fathers would say, â€œthatâ€™s the Democrat who had sex with a Chinese spy,â€ she tweeted. Swalwell has been targeted by right-wing disinformation over his past connection to a suspected Chinese intelligence operative named Fang Fang or Christine Fang. According to a 2020 Axios report, Fang targeted up-and-coming politicians in the Bay Area and the U.S., including Swalwell. Fang reportedly took part in fundraising activity for Swalwellâ€™s 2014 reelection campaign and recommended an intern for his office. Federal investigators said they alerted Swalwell to their concerns in 2015 and he immediately cut all ties with Fang, Axios reported. He was not accused of any wrongdoing or of passing on any classified intelligence. Fang allegedly had sexual relationships with at least two Midwestern mayors. Swalwell was not accused of having sex with her. Senior Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Arkansasâ€™ Israel Boycott Pledge Law Upheld By Appeals Court
content:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) â€” A federal appeals court on Wednesday upheld Arkansasâ€™ law requiring state contractors to pledge not to boycott Israel, finding the restriction is not an unconstitutional violation of free speech. The full 8th Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals reversed a 2-1 decision last year by a three-judge panel of the court that found the requirement to be unconstitutional. The Arkansas Times had sued to block the law, which requires contractors with the state to reduce their fees by 20% if they donâ€™t sign the pledge. â€œ(The law) only prohibits economic decisions that discriminate against Israel,â€ Judge Jonathan Kobes wrote in the courtâ€™s opinion. â€œBecause those commercial decisions are invisible to observers unless explained, they are not inherently expressive and do not implicate the First Amendment.â€ A federal judge in 2019 dismissed the Timesâ€™ lawsuit, ruling that the boycotts are not protected by the First Amendment. A three-judge panel of the appeals court reversed that ruling, and the state appealed to the full appeals court. The American Civil Liberties Union, which represented the Times, said it planned to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court. â€œWe hope and expect that the Supreme Court will set things right and reaffirm the nationâ€™s historic commitment to providing robust protection to political boycotts,â€ Brian Hauss, senior staff attorney for the ACLU Foundationâ€™s Speech, Privacy & Technology Project, said in a statement. The new ruling didnâ€™t give a breakdown of how judges decided, but at least one dissented, saying the law is written so broadly that it could go beyond boycotts. â€œOne could imagine a company posting anti-Israel signs, donating to causes that promote a boycott of Israel, encouraging others to boycott Israel, or even publicly criticizing the act with the intent to â€˜limit commercial relations with Israelâ€™ as a general matter,â€ Judge Jane Kelly wrote in her dissent. â€œAnd any of that conduct would arguably fall within the prohibition.â€ The Timesâ€™ lawsuit said the University of Arkansas Pulaski Technical College refused to contract for advertising with the newspaper unless the paper signed the pledge. The newspaper isnâ€™t engaged in a boycott against Israel. â€œToday is a resounding victory for Arkansasâ€™s anti-discrimination law and reinforces Arkansasâ€™s relationship with our long-time ally, Israel,â€ Republican Attorney General Leslie Rutledge, whose office defended the law, said in a statement. Republican legislators in Arkansas who drafted the 2017 law have said it wasnâ€™t prompted by a specific incident in the state. It followed similar restrictions enacted by other states in response to a movement promoting boycotts, divestment and sanctions of Israeli institutions and businesses over the countryâ€™s treatment of Palestinians. Israeli officials say the campaign masks a deeper goal of delegitimizing and even destroying the country. Similar measures in Arizona, Kansas and Texas that were blocked were later allowed to be enforced after lawmakers narrowed the requirement so it applied only to larger contracts. Arkansasâ€™ law applies to contracts worth $1,000 or more. Citing its anti-boycott law, Arizona last year sold off millions of dollars in Unilever bonds over subsidiary Ben & Jerryâ€™s decision to stop selling its ice cream in Israeli-occupied territories. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Vivica A. Fox Unloads On Jada Pinkett Smith For 'No Accountability' In Slap
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œKill Billâ€ actor Vivica A. Fox criticized Jada Pinkett Smith for taking â€œno accountabilityâ€ for Will Smithâ€™s slap of Chris Rock at the Oscars. (Watch the video below.) Pinkett Smith, whose shaved head was the butt of Rockâ€™s Academy Awards joke riling Will Smith, called on the two men to talk it out and reconcile during a â€œRed Table Talkâ€ this week. But Fox blasted her comments as â€œcoldâ€ and â€œself-righteousâ€ on Thursdayâ€™s â€œWendy Williams Show.â€ â€œWill Smith was defending her honor, thatâ€™s the reason he walked on stage and slapped because he felt like his wife had been offended,â€ Fox said, adding that Pinkett Smith has expressed â€œno accountability as a partner.â€ â€œAlso, letâ€™s not forget, Chris Rock was assaulted. We cannot forget that for basically telling a joke that I really felt wasnâ€™t that bad,â€ she continued. Fox, who noted that she starred in â€œIndependence Dayâ€ with Smith and â€œSet It Offâ€ with Pinkett Smith, elaborated: â€œI have love for the Smiths. I know their children. Iâ€™ve watched them grow up. I just wish we could have had just a little more accountability and for it to not seem so self-righteous on Jadaâ€™s part, and thatâ€™s my feelings.â€ A post shared by Wendy Williams (@wendyshow) Will Smith and Rock have been the talk of Hollywood since the â€œKing Richardâ€ actor slapped Rock onstage at the Oscars in March for telling a â€œG.I. Janeâ€ joke about his wifeâ€™s shaved head. Pinkett Smith has experienced hair loss because of alopecia. Smith was banned for 10 years from the ceremony. â€œNow, about Oscar night, my deepest hope is that these two intelligent, capable men have an opportunity to heal, talk this out, and reconcile,â€ Pinkett Smith said on â€œRed Table Talkâ€ this week. â€œThe state of the world today, we need them both, and we all actually need one another more than ever. â€œUntil then, Will and I are continuing to do what we have done for the last 28 years, and thatâ€™s keep figuring out this thing called life together,â€ Pinkett Smith continued. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Stephen Colbert Names The 'Dumbest Person Ever To Sit In The United States Senate'
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Stephen Colbert gave one U.S. lawmaker a scathing new distinction on Wednesday. â€œMost historians agree: Ron Johnson is the dumbest person ever to sit in the United States Senate,â€ Colbert declared on â€œThe Late Show.â€ Newly revealed text messages showed the Wisconsin Republicanâ€™s chief of staff tried to arrange a meeting in which Johnson would hand-deliver a slate of fake electors to then-Vice President Mike Pence. Penceâ€™s office declined. This week, Johnson claimed â€œsome staff internâ€ wanted an envelope delivered to the vice president and his office tried to arrange it but he didnâ€™t know who sent it or what it was, according to The Washington Post. Colbert was incredulous: â€œSo, he has no idea where it came from, no idea who gave it to them, no idea what it is, but he canâ€™t wait to hand-deliver it to the second-in-command. There couldâ€™ve been anything in that envelope, he doesnâ€™t care: fake electors, angry bees, naked pictures of Mary Todd Lincoln. It donâ€™t matter to Ron! Heâ€™s just a delivery boy.â€ Colbert also said this situation answered a question heâ€™d always had. â€œYou know those announcements in the airport when they say, â€˜Do not carry onto the flight a package for someone you donâ€™t knowâ€™? Iâ€™ve always wondered who those announcements are for,â€ he said. â€œTurns out itâ€™s Ron Johnson.â€ See his full takedown below: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: World Stop: BeyoncÃ© Is Coming With A New Album Next Month
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Everybody say thank you, BeyoncÃ©. Six years after her industry-shaking album â€œLemonade,â€ the music superstar finally is set to drop a new album. BeyoncÃ© will release â€œRenaissanceâ€ on July 29, Columbia Records and Tidal revealed on Thursday. The project will include 16 tracks â€” and the announcementâ€™s subtitle â€œact iâ€ suggests perhaps even more music is on its way. Four collectible box sets are now available to purchase on the singerâ€™s website and will include a CD, T-shirt, poster and a 28-page photo booklet promised to start â€œshipping July 29 upon album release.â€ Along with the album drop announcement, the 28-time Grammy Award winner appeared on the cover of British Vogue in a suitably lavish fashion spread to hail the arrival of a new musical era. A post shared by TIDAL (@tidal) BEYONCÃ‰ | ACT I | RENAISSANCE | 16 tracks.July 29. pic.twitter.com/7q26zZo0ya In the cover story, the magazineâ€™s editor-in-chief Edward Enninful describes listening to the new album for the first time. â€œSoaring vocals and fierce beats combine and in a split second Iâ€™m transported back to the clubs of my youth,â€ Enninful writes. â€œI want to get up and start throwing moves. Itâ€™s music I love to my core. Music that makes you rise, that turns your mind to cultures and subcultures, to our people past and present, music that will unite so many on the dance floor, music that touches your soul. As ever with BeyoncÃ©, it is all about the intent.â€ Creating the album during the pandemic was a â€œlong process,â€ Enninful says the singer explained to him. That mirrors what BeyoncÃ© herself said in an interview with Harperâ€™s Bazaar last year. â€œIâ€™ve been in the studio for a year and a half. Sometimes it takes a year for me to personally search through thousands of sounds to find just the right kick or snare,â€ she told the outlet. â€œOne chorus can have up to 200 stacked harmonies. Still, thereâ€™s nothing like the amount of love, passion, and healing that I feel in the recording studio.â€ And in peak BeyoncÃ© fashion, she mentioned the word â€œrenaissanceâ€ in the same conversation, reminding us that she is always many, many, many steps ahead of the rest of us. â€œI feel a renaissance emerging, and I want to be part of nurturing that escape in any way possible,â€ she said at the time. Rumors have been swirling for weeks about another album release after the singer removed her profile picture from all of her social media pages. ğŸš¨BeyoncÃ© has removed her profile pictures across all social media accounts. pic.twitter.com/jzjXYFWgI3 And, while BeyoncÃ© has yet to unveil the album cover for â€œRenaissance,â€ some fans are convinced she snuck the image into a collage of album covers released by her BeyGOOD Foundation earlier this month. The image in question â€• a gloved red hand â€• is positioned next to Brandyâ€™s album â€œB7,â€ which many speculated was a reference to â€œRenaissanceâ€ being BeyoncÃ©â€™s seventh album. Fans think BeyoncÃ© is teasing her next album with BeyGood foundation Black Music Month tweet. An image, which is not recognized on Google, is pointing to Brandyâ€™s â€˜B7â€™ album. pic.twitter.com/8tANSsErq3 Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: 'My Policeman' Has Harry Styles As Closeted Gay Cop Caught Up In 1950s Love Triangle
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Harry Styles finds himself ensnared â€œin the shifting tides of history, liberty, and forgivenessâ€ in the first teaser for â€œMy Policeman,â€ a romantic drama due out this fall. Based on the novel by Bethan Roberts, â€œMy Policemanâ€ follows Tom Burgess (played by Styles), a closeted gay cop who begins a secret relationship with a museum curator, Patrick Hazelwood (David Dawson). Faced with the societal pressures of 1950s England, Tom is unable to embrace his truth, and marries a woman, Marion (Emma Corrin). Actors Linus Roache, Gina McKee and Rupert Everett portray older versions of Tom, Marion and Patrick, respectively, as â€œMy Policemanâ€ catches up with this trio of characters in the 1990s, when they are â€œstill reeling with longing and regret, but now they have one last chance to repair the damage of the past,â€ according to press notes. Catch the teaser for â€œMy Policemanâ€ below. Directed by Michael Grandage, â€œMy Policemanâ€ is one of two major acting projects in store for Styles this fall. In September, the Grammy winner will be seen in â€œDonâ€™t Worry Darling,â€ directed by his girlfriend Olivia Wilde and co-starring Florence Pugh. Appearing on â€œThe Howard Stern Showâ€ last month, Styles said shooting â€œMy Policemanâ€ made him feel â€œvulnerable,â€ but denied rumors he would bare all in the film. â€œI think the most important thing in that stuff is trust,â€ he said. â€œIâ€™d never kissed anyone on camera before and it felt like giving a part of myself away in some ways ... Thereâ€™s no peen in the final cut. The peen, it was pre-negotiated that that would remain my own.â€ â€œThe whole point of Tom is that he is a character who is confused,â€ Grandage told Vanity Fair in an interview published last week. â€œItâ€™s made more problematic by the fact that heâ€™s a policeman, and heâ€™s in a career that is about upholding the law. And the law in the country at the time is about everything he feels â€” the complexity of it is something that whoever was going to play younger Tom and older Tom needed to somehow understand and absorb.â€ â€œMy Policemanâ€ hits theaters Oct. 21. The film will be available for streaming on Amazon Prime Video Nov. 4. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Jennifer Lopez Felt Sharing Super Bowl Stage With Shakira Was 'Worst Idea In The World'
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost For fans, Jennifer Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s 2020 Super Bowl halftime show was a peak cultural moment in a year that came to be defined by both political divisions and a pandemic. Lopez, however, had a much different opinion on the massively hyped performance â€• or at least she did in the days leading up to it. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ the actor and singer is shown in rehearsals with her music director Kim Burse and appears visibly stressed over the time constraints. â€œWe have six fucking minutes,â€ Lopez proclaims, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œWe have 30 seconds of a song, and if we take a minute, thatâ€™s it, weâ€™ve got five left. But thereâ€™s got to be certain songs that we sing, though. We have to have our singing moments. Itâ€™s not going to be a dance fucking revue. We have to sing our message.â€ â€œThis is the worst idea in the world to have two people do the Super Bowl,â€ she continues. â€œIt was the worst idea in the world.â€ Elsewhere in â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez doesnâ€™t hold back as she maps out the logistics of the show with Shakira directly. â€œIf it was going to be a double-headliner, they should have given us 20 minutes,â€ she says. â€œThatâ€™s what they shouldâ€™ve fucking done.â€ Catch the trailer for â€œHalftimeâ€ below. In the end, Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s performance lasted about 14 minutes. By comparison, Madonna in 2012 and Lady Gaga in 2017 were each given about 14 minutes to perform in the Super Bowl show. This yearâ€™s halftime show, featuring Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Mary J. Blige, Eminem and Kendrick Lamar, clocked in at nearly 14 minutes. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to EW. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ In spite of their limited stage time, Lopez and Shakira each turned in a dazzling performance that won raves from critics and even managed to deliver a subtle political message. The Los Angeles Times applauded the divas for having â€œfused old-school razzle-dazzle with an of-the-moment sense of Latin American pride,â€ while Entertainment Weekly called it â€œpunchy, political, and flat-out electric.â€ â€œHalftime,â€ which premiered Wednesday at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York, follows Lopez as she â€œreflects on her milestones and evolution as an artist, and navigates the second half of her career continuing to entertain, empower and inspire,â€ according to press notes. Itâ€™s now available for streaming on Netflix. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Leah Remini Warns Against Scientology, Tom Cruiseâ€™s â€˜Charmâ€™ Amid â€˜Top Gunâ€™ Success
content: Reporter, HuffPost Actor Leah Remini wants to remind you that swapping shirtless volleyball for shirtless football isnâ€™t the only reason you should be wary of â€œTop Gun: Maverick.â€ Remini, who has been on a mission against Scientology since she left the church in 2013, warned audiences about getting too swayed by the box office hit and its charismatic star, Tom Cruise, in a tweet on Saturday. Cruise is possibly the organizationâ€™s most famous member, while Remini, who was raised a Scientologist, is known for being one of its biggest critics thanks to a book and docuseries on the topic. â€œDonâ€™t let the movie star charm fool you,â€ Remini wrote over the weekend. Thank you to my friend @claireheadley for your courage. You have continued to speak out despite the non-stop attacks from Scientology. And as Claire says in her post below, Tom Cruise knows exactly what goes on in Scientology. Donâ€™t let the movie star charm fool you. pic.twitter.com/zQKwJWuJLj â€œThe King of Queensâ€ star also praised her friend Claire Headley for accusing Cruise of â€œcrimes against humanity.â€ Headley and her husband, Marc Headley, are also former Scientologists. The Headleys filed a lawsuit against the church in 2012 alleging that it had violated human trafficking laws and human rights. Marc Headley, who worked closely with Cruise within the organization, wrote his own exposÃ© on Scientology, â€œBlown for Good.â€ â€œGlad all you Top Gun fans are enjoying the new movie,â€ Claire Headley wrote in a Facebook post that Remini shared a screenshot of. â€œPersonally, recent posts about this movie only serve to remind me of Tom Cruise and his crimes against humanity.â€ She continued: â€œExtreme, you may think? Destroying families is a crime against humanity. My opinion. Ask yourself: When is the last time Tom talked to his only biological daughter, Suri?â€ Headley also accused Cruise of promoting â€œa dangerous cult that destroyed my familyâ€ in her post. â€œSo no, I will not watch the movie, nor will I ever support or approve of this scam of a man,â€ she wrote, adding: â€œTrust me, Tom Cruise knows exactly who he is supporting and the abuses the organization perpetuates.â€ Reporter, HuffPost
