topic: â€˜Stranger Thingsâ€™ Creators Admit They Made Huge Continuity Error In Season 4
content: Reporter, HuffPost Will Byers (Noah Schnapp) may have gotten a ton of attention from his loved ones when he was stuck in the Upside Down on â€œStranger Things.â€ But not so much on his birthday. Warning: spoilers for Season 4 of â€œStranger Thingsâ€ below. Viral tweets have pointed out that the showâ€™s characters seem to have forgotten about Willâ€™s birthday in Season 4. Now, Matt and Ross Duffer, co-creators of the Netflix smash hit, have responded in an interview with Variety. â€œThe honest response is, clearly like the characters in the show, we also forgot about Willâ€™s birthday,â€ Matt Duffer said. â€œSo the debate now is whether we adjust Willâ€™s birthday or we just let it be really sad.â€ When the fourth season of the sci-fi series debuted on May 27, it didnâ€™t take fans long to notice that on the day that should have been Willâ€™s birthday, he was ignored by his best friend Mike (Finn Wolfhard), witnessed Eleven (Millie Bobby Brown) assault her bully with a roller skate, and was told by his mother Joyce (Winona Ryder) that she was leaving on a last-minute trip to Alaska without any acknowledgment of his birth. Hard-core fans of the show understood Willâ€™s birthday to be March 22, due to a scene in the second season in which Joyce tells Will a personal story about his birthday to save him from the Mind Flayerâ€™s control. wait they forgot willâ€™s birthday omg :( pic.twitter.com/Lwu448JKku Fast-forward to Season 4, Episode 2. In a scene where Will, Mike and Eleven go to a skating rink, Elevenâ€™s school bullies decide to pull a cruel â€œCarrieâ€-esque prank on her, which they record on a camcorder. When the scene is shown from the camcorderâ€™s perspective, itâ€™s time-stamped March 22, 1986 â€” which means the horrible scene occurred on Willâ€™s birthday. This was a shock to fans who remembered the date. Plus, as we mentioned before, it was a bummer of a day for poor Will: the saddest shit about this stranger things season is that absolutely NO ONE remembered will's birthday.NO ONE pic.twitter.com/UwaEeay4pq Stop i just realized the day mike arrived in california was willâ€™s birthday and they forgot abt it good fucking bye so not only EVERYONE forgot about will's birthday, he also had to deal with mike telling him that he ruined the day and joyce saying that she was leaving to alaska, wow well done duffer brothers you just showed that you hate your own character stranger things continuity issues keep piling up omg. will byers has 2 diff. birthdays + the duffers forgot them both. steve was said to only play basketball but then wait a minute he was captain of the swim team too? eddy is a 4x senior but somehow was in 8th grade w/ chrissy. wait what if will looked this happy because he thought mike was going to remember his birthday? pic.twitter.com/WhcXuEr6NA â€œIt was six years ago that I wrote that date!â€ Ross Duffer told Variety. He later added: â€œOf course that would mean his mom forgot his birthday! Itâ€™s too mean. It was obviously a mistake, and weâ€™re sorry. We apologize to the fans.â€ Matt Duffer said the show does not have someone making sure there are no continuity errors. â€œYou know how George R.R. Martin has somebody â€” I mean, his story is more vast â€” and Stephen King has someone who just keeps track of this stuff?â€ Matt Duffer said. â€œWe need that. We donâ€™t have that.â€ He added: â€œWe love Will, and I donâ€™t want people to think we donâ€™t love Will because we forgot â€” we do! But now we mentioned Dustinâ€™s birthday this season, so weâ€™re being very careful for people not to forget, in case the timelinesâ€¦â€ The Duffer Brothers then joked about how they could fix the continuity error by going back and dubbing in another month for Willâ€™s birthday. â€œWeâ€™re thinking his new birthday â€¦ is going to be May 22nd, because â€˜Mayâ€™ can fit in Winonaâ€™s mouth [in the Season 2 scene]. So that would be us George Lucas-ing the situation.â€ Sure, but donâ€™t go George Lucas-ing it too much. We donâ€™t need the Duffer Brothers to have Joyce needlessly scream â€œMay,â€ for instance. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Kim Cattrallâ€™s Samantha Jones Returns In â€˜And Just Like Thatâ€™ Season 2 ... Kinda
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost â€œAnd Just Like Thatâ€ fans will still be able to keep up with the Jones next season. As in Kim Cattrallâ€™s Samantha Jones. Michael Patrick King, showrunner of the HBO Max â€œSex and the Cityâ€ reboot, told Variety this week that the character made famous by Cattrall will continue to â€œappearâ€ through text message exchanges with Sarah Jessica Parkerâ€™s Carrie Bradshaw. The two appeared to work on patching up their friendship in the first â€œAJLTâ€ season through long-distance texts. Carrie and Samantha arranged to meet for cocktails after Carrie disposed of Bigâ€™s ashes in the Seine during the finale. â€œItâ€™s very funny, because every single one of the writers has a different version of what happened during that conversation,â€ King said of the offscreen get-together. â€œSo, I think there was some champagne. I think there was a grownup back and forth, and a love affair that they realized that somethingâ€™s more important than being afraid to heal,â€ King told Variety. â€œIâ€™m sure they had a great night. To me, they had a great night and things became resolved. Once Carrie let go of an old, old love, one of her current loves came back in.â€ But life is far from imitating art. Cattrall has apparently sworn off the franchise and rejected a script for a third â€œSex and the Cityâ€ movie amid reported feuding with Parker. As for her continued absence from the franchise, she recently alluded to it by noting the power of saying â€œno.â€ Cattrall said she wasnâ€™t invited back anyway. Parker said earlier this year that she wouldnâ€™t want Cattrall back because thereâ€™s â€œtoo much public historyâ€ of her negative sentiments. â€œI have no realistic expectation of Kim Cattrall ever appearing again,â€ King said previously. But even phantom Samantha is better than no Samantha at all, right? General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Kim Kardashian Discusses Pete Davidson's 'BDE' And It Gets A Little Hot In Here
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost Kim Kardashian said she was lured in by Pete Davidsonâ€™s â€œBDEâ€ and her readiness to have sex â€• and had no intention of building a longer-term relationship with the comedian. On â€œThe Kardashiansâ€ Thursday, the reality queen explained that when she kissed the former â€œSaturday Night Liveâ€ star in an â€œAladdinâ€ sketch last fall, she felt a â€œvibe.â€ She hoped to pursue the matter further at her â€œSNLâ€ after-party, but Davidson did not attend, BuzzFeed noted. So Kardashian asked an â€œSNLâ€ producer for Davidsonâ€™s number. â€œI text him,â€ she said, per People. â€œI wasnâ€™t even thinking like, â€˜Oh my God, Iâ€™m gonna be in a relationship with him.â€™ I was just thinking, â€™Heard about this BDE, need to get out there.â€ BDE, of course, is short for big dick energy. â€œI was just basically DTF,â€ or down to fuck, she confided. But their bond deepened. And now, Kardashian said, even her beauâ€™s sense of humor doesnâ€™t figure as prominently as many might think. â€œThatâ€™s, like, fourth on my list on why I like him,â€ she said, per Billboard. â€œHe always wants the best for people, can handle anything, always does it with grace. Heâ€™s really, really thoughtful and humble and genuine. I would say the best word to describe Pete is genuine.â€ Good to know â€• as is the eyewitness account of former Davidson fiancee Ariana Grande. General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Eric Swalwell Shares Recording Of Death Threat After Marjorie Taylor Greene Attack
content:
Senior Reporter, HuffPost Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) shared an audio recording of a disturbing threat Wednesday that he said he received because of false statements made by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.). â€œMarjorie loves to play the victim. But sheâ€™s an inciter of violence. Her constant attacks â€” even after the FBI said I was never suspected of wrongdoing â€” lead to threatening calls like this,â€ he tweeted alongside the audio clip. â€œThis caller from today threatened to kill my three children.â€ In the recording, a manâ€™s voice said: â€œHey, you little cocksucker. You still banging the Chinese spy Fang Fang? ... Weâ€™re coming to your house this weekend. Gonâ€™ get you and them little mutant bastards, them little mutant offspring of yours. Weâ€™re gonâ€™ get ya.â€ Earlier Wednesday, Swalwell had shared a story about an interaction with a supporter of former President Donald Trump that happened while the congressman was giving a tour of the U.S. Capitol. He said a man shouted at him and then told his son, â€œThatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ Today I gave a tour in the Capitol and was stopped by a father with his young boy. The father yelled at me â€œHey Swalwellâ€ and then told his son, â€œthatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ I kept walking and felt sad for the boy. Heâ€™s being raised in a cult family. Greene responded to the tweet by saying there was â€œno way that happened.â€ â€œBecause we all know good Trump supporting fathers would say, â€œthatâ€™s the Democrat who had sex with a Chinese spy,â€ she tweeted. Swalwell has been targeted by right-wing disinformation over his past connection to a suspected Chinese intelligence operative named Fang Fang or Christine Fang. According to a 2020 Axios report, Fang targeted up-and-coming politicians in the Bay Area and the U.S., including Swalwell. Fang reportedly took part in fundraising activity for Swalwellâ€™s 2014 reelection campaign and recommended an intern for his office. Federal investigators said they alerted Swalwell to their concerns in 2015 and he immediately cut all ties with Fang, Axios reported. He was not accused of any wrongdoing or of passing on any classified intelligence. Fang allegedly had sexual relationships with at least two Midwestern mayors. Swalwell was not accused of having sex with her. Senior Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Arkansasâ€™ Israel Boycott Pledge Law Upheld By Appeals Court
content:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) â€” A federal appeals court on Wednesday upheld Arkansasâ€™ law requiring state contractors to pledge not to boycott Israel, finding the restriction is not an unconstitutional violation of free speech. The full 8th Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals reversed a 2-1 decision last year by a three-judge panel of the court that found the requirement to be unconstitutional. The Arkansas Times had sued to block the law, which requires contractors with the state to reduce their fees by 20% if they donâ€™t sign the pledge. â€œ(The law) only prohibits economic decisions that discriminate against Israel,â€ Judge Jonathan Kobes wrote in the courtâ€™s opinion. â€œBecause those commercial decisions are invisible to observers unless explained, they are not inherently expressive and do not implicate the First Amendment.â€ A federal judge in 2019 dismissed the Timesâ€™ lawsuit, ruling that the boycotts are not protected by the First Amendment. A three-judge panel of the appeals court reversed that ruling, and the state appealed to the full appeals court. The American Civil Liberties Union, which represented the Times, said it planned to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court. â€œWe hope and expect that the Supreme Court will set things right and reaffirm the nationâ€™s historic commitment to providing robust protection to political boycotts,â€ Brian Hauss, senior staff attorney for the ACLU Foundationâ€™s Speech, Privacy & Technology Project, said in a statement. The new ruling didnâ€™t give a breakdown of how judges decided, but at least one dissented, saying the law is written so broadly that it could go beyond boycotts. â€œOne could imagine a company posting anti-Israel signs, donating to causes that promote a boycott of Israel, encouraging others to boycott Israel, or even publicly criticizing the act with the intent to â€˜limit commercial relations with Israelâ€™ as a general matter,â€ Judge Jane Kelly wrote in her dissent. â€œAnd any of that conduct would arguably fall within the prohibition.â€ The Timesâ€™ lawsuit said the University of Arkansas Pulaski Technical College refused to contract for advertising with the newspaper unless the paper signed the pledge. The newspaper isnâ€™t engaged in a boycott against Israel. â€œToday is a resounding victory for Arkansasâ€™s anti-discrimination law and reinforces Arkansasâ€™s relationship with our long-time ally, Israel,â€ Republican Attorney General Leslie Rutledge, whose office defended the law, said in a statement. Republican legislators in Arkansas who drafted the 2017 law have said it wasnâ€™t prompted by a specific incident in the state. It followed similar restrictions enacted by other states in response to a movement promoting boycotts, divestment and sanctions of Israeli institutions and businesses over the countryâ€™s treatment of Palestinians. Israeli officials say the campaign masks a deeper goal of delegitimizing and even destroying the country. Similar measures in Arizona, Kansas and Texas that were blocked were later allowed to be enforced after lawmakers narrowed the requirement so it applied only to larger contracts. Arkansasâ€™ law applies to contracts worth $1,000 or more. Citing its anti-boycott law, Arizona last year sold off millions of dollars in Unilever bonds over subsidiary Ben & Jerryâ€™s decision to stop selling its ice cream in Israeli-occupied territories. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Gloria Estefan Shades Jennifer Lopez Over Super Bowl Halftime Comments
content: Reporter, HuffPost Gloriaâ€™s gonna get you. Gloria Estefan had no qualms about poking a little fun at actor-singer Jennifer Lopez during an episode of â€œWatch What Happens Live With Andy Cohenâ€ on Tuesday. During one segment, Cohen asked the Cuban American icon what she thought about the comments Lopez made about the 2020 Super Bowl halftime show, in which she performed with Colombian singer Shakira. In her Netflix documentary â€œHalftime,â€ Lopez complained about the time constraints of having to share the stage, calling it â€œthe worst idea in the world.â€ In response, Estefan told Cohen that she was asked to join Lopez and Shakira on the Super Bowl stage but rejected the offer. â€œLook, this is the bottom line. You have very little time, like 12 minutes or something, to get things on and off the set,â€ Estefan explained. â€œSo, could you do it with one person? Yes, but I think they wanted to throw a Miami and Latin extravaganza, and they tried to pack it as much as possible.â€ And although Estefan said that the women â€œkilled itâ€ and that it was an â€œamazing show,â€ the â€œRhythm Is Gonna Get Youâ€ singer also took the opportunity to throw a little shade at Lopez. â€œOK, and imagine what J.Lo would have said if I was the third [performer]!â€ Estefan said, bugging out her eyes. â€œI literally would come out, done â€˜come on shake your body,â€™ out!â€ Estefan joked, referring to the lyrics of her 1985 Miami Sound Machine hit, â€œConga!â€ Estefan then added that sheâ€™s performed at a few Super Bowls and that Lopez and Shakiraâ€™s show was â€œtheir momentâ€ to shine. â€œPlus, I didnâ€™t want to go on a diet in December,â€ Estefan said. â€œItâ€™s Christmas!â€ Lopezâ€™s complaints about her Super Bowl performance in â€œHalftimeâ€ werenâ€™t directed at Shakira but at the NFL. Lopezâ€™s manager Benny Medina shared his clientâ€™s frustrations over the NFLâ€™s choice of a co-headlining performance. â€œTypically, you have one headliner at a Super Bowl. That headliner constructs a show, and, should they choose to have other guests, thatâ€™s their choice,â€ he said, according to Entertainment Weekly. â€œIt was an insult to say you needed two Latinas to do the job that one artist historically has done.â€ Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Dave Chappelle Reveals 'Very Fitting Goodbye' Last Time He Saw Norm Macdonald
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Comedy icon Dave Chappelle opened up about the last time he saw his friend, fellow comedian Norm Macdonald â€• who died last year of cancer at the age of 61 â€• and the photo that resulted. It was taken at the Comedy Store in Hollywood during what would be their last meeting. â€œ[Macdonald] was uncharacteristically emotional,â€ Chappelle said during a discussion thatâ€™s featured in Macdonaldâ€™s posthumous Netflix special, â€œNorm Macdonald: Nothing Special.â€ Chappelle said he included the picture of that meeting in his own special, â€œThe Closer,â€ which was released last year and dedicated to Macdonald. Chappelle didnâ€™t realize it at the the time, but Macdonald was giving him â€œa very fitting goodbye.â€ (h/t digg) Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Jimmy Kimmel Presents 'Drunk Giuliani' Compilation After Jan. 6 Panel's Detail
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Thereâ€™s no way late-show hosts werenâ€™t going to pounce on this detail from the Jan. 6 House select committee hearings. Jimmy Kimmelâ€™s team promptly offered up a compilation Monday after the committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol revealed that on the night of the 2020 election, Donald Trump falsely declared victory on the advice of his drunk personal attorney, even though votes were still being counted. â€œPresident Trump rejected the advice of his campaign experts on election night, and instead followed the course recommended by an apparently inebriated Rudy Giuliani to just claim he won and insist the vote-counting stop, to falsely claim everything was fraudulent,â€ committee co-chair Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.) said at Mondayâ€™s proceedings. Cheneyâ€™s comments were followed by video testimony from former Trump aide Jason Miller, who said Giuliani was â€œdefinitely intoxicatedâ€ when they spoke that night. â€œEveryone pretty much told Trump he lost, but he didnâ€™t want to hear that. He wanted to hear what Rudy Giuliani told him,â€ Kimmel said. â€œAnd how would Trump know Giuliani was drunk? I mean, does this seem like a drunk person to you?â€ Check out the compilation below on â€œJimmy Kimmel Live.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Seth Meyers Highlights 'Bonkers' Jan. 6 Texts That 'Make Mike Lindell Look' Normal
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Seth Meyers was blown away by â€œbonkersâ€ texts from the wife of a Supreme Court justice to former President Donald Trumpâ€™s team during his crusade to overturn the 2020 election. The House panel investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol attack said Thursday it had requested an interview with Ginni Thomas, wife of Clarence Thomas. That followed revelations Wednesday that the committee is in possession of emails between Ginni Thomas and attorney John Eastman, a key adviser in Trumpâ€™s effort to overturn the election results. Previously revealed text messages showed Ginni Thomas repeatedly contacted then-White House chief of staff Mark Meadows with false and outlandish claims about electoral fraud in November 2020, including one in which she claimed a group of co-conspirators including the â€œBiden crime family,â€ elected officials, â€œsocial media censorship mongersâ€ and others were being arrested and detained and would soon be â€œliving in barges off GITMO [Guantanamo Bay detention camp] to face military tribunals for sedition.â€ To Meyers, this sounded even crazier than MyPillow CEO and notorious election conspiracy theorist Mike Lindell. â€œThose texts make Mike Lindell sound like a levelheaded businessman,â€ Meyers quipped on â€œLate Night.â€ â€œI know those texts all sound insane to you. But itâ€™s important to remember. They really are fucking insane,â€ he said. â€œI think my favorite part is when she says the Biden crime family and ballot fraud co-conspirators will be living in barges of Gitmo. Obviously, all this stuff is bonkers, but I am curious about one thing. Why would they live in a barge off Gitmo? Like why wouldnâ€™t they just be sent to Gitmo?â€ Watch below on â€œLate Night.â€ Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Ana De Armas Channels Iconic Marilyn Monroe Moments In First Trailer For 'Blonde'
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Ana de Armas may not wear an actual dress of Marilyn Monroeâ€™s in â€œBlonde,â€ but she does a good job of filling her shoes. Thatâ€™s based on the first trailer for the upcoming Netflix biopic about the iconic sex symbol, released on Thursday. The â€œofficial teaserâ€ shows de Armas channeling some of Monroeâ€™s most famous moments, including her rendition of â€œDiamonds Are A Girlâ€™s Best Friendâ€ from â€œGentlemen Prefer Blondes.â€ However, de Armas is not seen singing â€œHappy Birthdayâ€ to John F. Kennedy. The filmâ€™s synopsis describes it as a bold reimagination of the life of â€œone of Hollywoodâ€™s most enduring icons,â€ from a volatile childhood as Norma Jeane Mortenson, through her rise to stardom and romantic entanglements. De Armas told Netflix Queue that director Andrew Dominik told her he wanted the world â€œto experience what it actually felt like to not only be Marilyn, but also Norma Jeane.â€ She added, â€œI found that to be the most daring, unapologetic, and feminist take on her story that I had ever seen.â€ The film is based on the Joyce Carol Oates novel of the same name. De Armas said she prepared for the role by studying â€œhundreds of photographs, videos, audio recordings, films â€” anything I could get my hands on.â€ Every scene in the film is inspired by an existing photograph, and de Armas said she and Dominik would pore over every detail in each photo and debate what was happening in it. â€œThe first question was always, â€˜What was Norma Jeane feeling here?â€™ We wanted to tell the human side of her story. Fame is what made Marilyn the most visible person in the world, but it also made Norma the most invisible.â€ The NC-17 film debuts on the streaming platform Sept. 23, and Dominik told Vulture that it has â€œsomething in it to offend everyone.â€ You can see the trailer below. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Nick Cannon â€” Soon-To-Be Dad Of 8 â€” Makes â€˜Vasectomyâ€™ Cocktail In Ad With Ryan Reynolds
content: Reporter, HuffPost Nick Cannon appears tired â€” yet self-aware â€” in a very funny Fatherâ€™s Day ad for Ryan Reynoldsâ€™ Aviation Gin. In the commercial, which was uploaded to Reynoldsâ€™ YouTube page Wednesday, Cannon shows viewers how to make a cocktail called â€œThe Vasectomy.â€ â€œLord knows I need one,â€ he says in the ad. The former â€œAmericaâ€™s Got Talentâ€ host announced this week that he is expecting to expand his brood of children (seven with at least one on the way) even more later this year. Throughout the tutorial, Cannon appears to be exhausted â€” spilling ice and watching a bottle of tonic explode as he unscrews the cap. This makes perfect sense because Cannon shares 11-year-old twins Moroccan and Monroe with ex-wife Mariah Carey; a son, Golden, and daughter, Powerful Queen, with model Brittany Bell; son Zen, who died last year at age 5 months, with model Alyssa Scott; and twins Zion and Zillion, who were also born last year, with DJ Abby De La Rosa. (We got tired just listing all those children!) In January, he announced that he is expecting his eighth child later this year with model Bre Tiesi. In a podcast interview released Tuesday, he implied even more children are on the way. â€œIf you thought it was a lot of kids last year...â€ Cannon joked. This may explain why Cannon deploys Reynoldsâ€™ trademark snark so effectively in the ad, talking about the different ingredients in the cocktail and how they relate to parenthood. As Cannon finishes adding the ingredients to the drink, he concludes with what is supposed to be 1.5 ounces of Aviation Gin but instead free-pours half the bottle into his glass. â€œThe worldâ€™s highest-rated gin for the highest-rated job â€¦ Dad,â€ Cannon says as the gin overflows from the glass. Once the cocktail is topped with a garnish, Reynolds makes an appearance. â€œIâ€™ll take it from here, Nick,â€ Reynolds says, grabbing the cocktail. â€œI have three kids.â€ Reynolds proceeds to chug the drink, while Cannon says in a matter-of-fact way: â€œI have eight.â€ To see how Reynolds hilariously responds, check out the video above. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: What â€œGood Luck To You, Leo Grandeâ€ Star Daryl McCormack Understands About Intimacy
content: Senior Culture Reporter This article contains spoilers for â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grande.â€ Itâ€™s not every day that a young actor gets the opportunity to lead a film with Emma Thompson â€” much less a deeply intimate two-hander shot during lockdown that demands an unflinching level of emotional and physical vulnerability. But after just a few minutes of conversation with Daryl McCormack, itâ€™s easy to see why he was cherry-picked to play the sensitive sex worker hired by Thompsonâ€™s retired English teacher in â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grande.â€ Because McCormack, 29, exudes many of the same qualities his character shares: assured and earnest yet quietly reserved, masculine yet sees the world through a disarmingly feminist lens. These might have also also been traits Thompson, 63, noticed because shortly after going on a walk with the actor following his auditions, she knew that he was the right fit for the titular role. â€œEmma messaged me, and was like, â€˜Hey, I want you to be Leo,â€™â€ McCormack said on a video call from his hotel room in London. â€œSo, within five days, I went from reading a script to being like, â€˜Oh, my God. Now Iâ€™m going to go ahead and do this.â€™ My world just flipped upside down.â€ Thatâ€™s an understatement, especially if youâ€™re only familiar with McCormack from his role as gun-wielding gang member Isaiah Jesus on â€œPeaky Blinders.â€ Even since helping â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grande,â€ directed by Sophie Hyde and written by Katy Brand, become the darling of the Sundance Film Festival earlier this year, the actor has been consistently busy. He reprised his role on â€œPeaky Blinders,â€ is currently shooting a film in Hamburg, had just celebrated the London premiere of â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grandeâ€ the night before we spoke and was about to fly out to New York the following week. In fact, McCormack has barely had a moment to eat, which is why our conversation was momentarily interrupted by a doorbell when his order of soup and sandwiches arrived. â€œMy bad,â€ he said with a conciliatory laugh as he set the bag down next to him. Still, he remained present throughout our chat, considering each question as he reflected on his experience shooting the charming â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grandeâ€ in a mere 19 days after only one month to prepare, during which he researched sex work and talked to real-life sex workers. The insight that both he and Hyde, who joined him in those conversations, gained from that groundwork was incorporated into the character and the film. And in many ways, Leo subverts popular depictions of sex work on-screen â€” from â€œMidnight Cowboyâ€ and â€œKluteâ€ to â€œHungâ€ and even this yearâ€™s â€œPleasure,â€ to a certain extent. â€œWe see portrayals of sex work on-screen, but itâ€™s not always empowering,â€ McCormack said. â€œItâ€™s often diminishing.â€ Thatâ€™s because thereâ€™s often a sense of danger lurking around every turn and/or the character has limited agency. Leo, on the other hand, has full authority over who he is, his job and his sexuality. When McCormack first read the script, he saw â€œa portrayal of a young man whoâ€™s really in touch with his own sense of intimacy and sexuality. I havenâ€™t really seen young men like that portrayed on-screen, and it didnâ€™t feel false to me.â€ It was really important to both him and Hyde that Leo instilled those same virtues in his clients. That includes Nancy (Thompson), who admits that even during a decadeslong marriage to her late husband and after two children, sheâ€™s never experienced an orgasm of her own. â€œI just felt this film was giving an audience a chance to witness that thereâ€™s a scope to sex work,â€ McCormack continued. â€œAnd thereâ€™s a capacity to be of real value in that work.â€ But as the film emphasizes, that purpose is defined by the client herself. Despite Nancy finally giving herself permission to achieve sexual pleasure by going through the motions of hiring a sex worker, when Leo arrives in her hotel room, she is riddled with self-doubt. Instead of immediately having sex with him, Nancy is self-deprecating and tries to talk herself out of her own plan, even offering to give Leo a refund. She laments she might be â€œdisappointed againâ€ if he isnâ€™t able to get her to come, or that maybe he might be, fears she might be using the young man, and refuses to believe him when he calls her â€œempirically sexy.â€ In other words, Nancyâ€™s instinctual response to the idea of affording herself sexual pleasure is to downplay her appeal or that sheâ€™s somehow exploiting Leo for her own gain. To which he responds that sheâ€™s not â€œusingâ€ him, but rather â€œhiring him for her own pleasure.â€ The idea of autonomy is mind-altering for her. â€œIsnâ€™t it interesting that sheâ€™s garnering that information from a young man â€” and that her damaged experience of intimacy has been the result of being with a man who didnâ€™t understand it, couldnâ€™t offer her what she wanted, and didnâ€™t maybe even see it as important?â€ McCormack pondered. This is an excellent question that â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grandeâ€ poses as it compels its audience to sit with two people and their thoughts for just over 90 minutes. As a matter of fact, thereâ€™s a lot more dialogue in the film than actual sex. Not that thereâ€™s a problem with the latter, but itâ€™s refreshing to see emotional intimacy portrayed at the same prominent level as sexual intimacy, especially amid todayâ€™s dating app culture that makes it difficult for anyone to really get to know anyone else. As any intimacy coordinator would tell you, both forms of intimacy require the same care. McCormack agrees. â€œI think that was the main draw for me, actually,â€ he said. â€œYou have a story about a sex worker and a woman who hires him, yet thereâ€™s not major amounts of physical intimacy in the film. But we feel like itâ€™s a very intimate film. It all begins with conversation.â€ â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grande,â€ which McCormack describes as â€œvery exposing and simplistic,â€ allows the sexual pressure to fall away from the filmâ€™s forefront in order for its two protagonists to form a type of intimacy that neither of them, nor the audience, anticipates. By mutually sharing their experiences, it gives way for sex to naturally happen between them. For her, those disclosures are personal; including how she finds her adult son â€œboringâ€ and the way she faked each orgasm with her husband (moaning â€œAh!â€ two or three times before she pretended her body was collapsing from the thrill of it all). For him, theyâ€™re more measured revelations that walk a tightrope between making her more comfortable yet preserving his professional image. Like, that he lied about his job to his mother, a strict Irish Catholic from whom he is estranged, and has a male client that likes him to dress up as a cat for an hour then go home. Aside from the confidence Nancy gains from these intimate exchanges, to the point where she brings a whole list of sexual positions to try to their second meeting, they also give her and the audience plenty to think about in terms of gender expectations and antiquated views on feminity. For instance, Leo thinks women and girls should be able to wear whatever they want and that the people who have a problem with that should mind their business. While his character is the one that utters these words, theyâ€™re also aligned with how McCormack views women. Having been raised by his mother and grandmother, or â€œNanâ€ as he refers to the latter, the actor, who like his character is Irish and Black, has a natural comfort around women that was certainly vital for this role. â€œBecause how could you have a sex worker whoâ€™s not respecting the people that heâ€™s working with?â€ he asked. â€œIâ€™ve always felt safe in the presence of women, and I think that also helped in terms of working in a vulnerable context with Sophie and Emma.â€ It also imbues McCormack, and subsequently Leo, with â€œmodern masculinity,â€ as the actor describes it, that allows the character to be confidently vulnerable and challenge Nancy on her own moral viewpoints. For him, it goes back to Nancy and Leo being two individuals in a room connecting without the constrictions of identity that could keep them listening to one another. â€œItâ€™s interesting that when our gender or age doesnâ€™t put us into a square [where] we can get wisdom, or experience, to empower one another,â€ McCormack said. â€œItâ€™s just so interesting when we donâ€™t fall into those binary â€” Well, Iâ€™m a man, so I should know this about intimacy.â€ He clearly feels passionately about this. â€œOr, Iâ€™m at this age, so I should know this about that,â€ he continued without even so much as a pregnant pause. â€œWhen we limit ourselves like that, it just feels like we can then only engage with people of similar things.â€ â€œWhatâ€™s so interesting about these two people is that theyâ€™re very different, yet they can enlighten one another because they have different walks of life,â€ McCormack said. â€œOnce they allow those differences to fall away, they realize that they can communicate with one another.â€ All of this underscores some of what makes â€œGood Luck to You, Leo Grandeâ€ such a thoughtful watch. But it brings to mind a moment between Nancy and Leo, who throughout the film use aliases to protect their private identities, that raises a question of fetishization. When Nancy discovers Leoâ€™s real name through cyberstalking and goes as far to call him by that name in person, he takes the breach in confidentiality as a direct insult. In a fit of rage, he accuses her of not actually caring about the truth of his life and looking for someone â€œexotic.â€ Though Leo adds, â€œI guess you found him, a whore,â€ â€œexoticâ€ could easily refer to his race, age, the fact that heâ€™s a sex worker or any of things that make the pair different from each other, despite the characters building the empowering connection the actor described. Thatâ€™s a point McCormack also considered while developing the character. â€œWe went back and forth about that,â€ he admitted. â€œBecause I was like, â€˜He feels really socially aware. It feels really out of character that he would say that.â€™ I think we kept that there because, for me, it felt like that showed that his trauma was just taking all sorts of things out.â€ As the film stirs toward its pensive ending, Leoâ€™s painful past becomes more crystallized. But just enough to understand him on another level and not much more than that. â€œThatâ€™s the thing,â€ McCormack said. â€œWe donâ€™t know his past, but Iâ€™d imagine, being a person of color, itâ€™s very hard to be exempt from ever experiencing a level of racism.â€ Thatâ€™s fair. For the actor, the moment ultimately humanizes the character. â€œI think there was pain in there that had nothing to do with Nancy,â€ he explained. â€œAnd itâ€™s just in this flippant, â€˜Oh, thatâ€™s all you wanted.â€™ Because itâ€™s his pain thatâ€™s speaking. Itâ€™s not Leo.â€ While watching the film, you might also notice other more subtle scenes that challenge your perception of the character, like the split second when he scans himself topless in the mirror that could be interpreted as a moment of insecurity. â€œI think it was important that I felt he was fallible,â€ McCormack concluded. â€œAs much as he wanted to present the perfect image, and needed to in order to lay down a foundation for Nancy, it was important that we saw him struggle internally.â€ Thatâ€™s true even within the confines of a character that is more mysterious than his counterpart. â€œI wanted to keep that alive on the surface,â€ McCormack added. â€œI thought it was beautiful that there is a contradiction, in the fact that he is super confident and does know who he is, but thereâ€™s something niggling at him inside that is contradicting that.â€ That is, after all, what makes Leo fully human. And to some extent, itâ€™s what makes the man who plays him that more interesting to watch. â€œGood Luck To You, Leo Grandeâ€ streams Friday on Hulu. Senior Culture Reporter

topic: Martin Sheen Says He â€˜Regretsâ€™ Not Using His Real Name Professionally
content: Reporter, HuffPost Martin Sheen may be a household name, but the actor himself wishes you knew him by his real name. Sheen â€” the son of a Spanish immigrant father and Irish immigrant mother â€” was born with the name Ramon EstÃ©vez. In an interview with Closer Weekly published Monday, the â€œApocalypse Nowâ€ star said that he wishes he used his actual name when he was starting out as an actor. â€œThatâ€™s one of my regrets,â€ he told the magazine. â€œI never changed my name officially. Itâ€™s still Ramon EstÃ©vez on my birth certificate. Itâ€™s on my marriage license, my passport, driverâ€™s license.â€ He chalked up the decision of being naive when he first started in show business. â€œSometimes you get persuaded when you donâ€™t have enough insight or even enough courage to stand up for what you believe in, and you pay for it later,â€ he said. â€œBut, of course, Iâ€™m only speaking for myself.â€ He added that when his son, Emilio EstÃ©vez, first started acting professionally, he advised his son to stay true to his name. â€œThe only influence I had on Emilio was to keep his name,â€ Sheen told Closer. â€œWhen he started out, his agent was advising him to change his name to Sheen and he wouldnâ€™t do it. And I thank God he didnâ€™t.â€ Sheenâ€™s other famous son, Charlie Sheen, didnâ€™t take the same advice â€” initially. In 2013, he was credited in Robert Rodriguezâ€˜s film â€œMachete Killsâ€ by his real name, Carlos EstÃ©vez, in the title cards. But in 2017â€™s â€œMad Families,â€ Charlie Sheen was credited by his professional name. Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Bill Nye The Science Guy Is Now A Married Man
content: Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost Bill Nye is celebrating his first month as a married man. The host of the long-running â€œBill Nye the Science Guyâ€ TV series tied the knot with journalist and author Liza Mundy in May, People confirmed Wednesday. The ceremony took place in the Enid A. Haupt Garden of the Smithsonian Institution in Washington, D.C., and was officiated by â€œStar Trek: Voyagerâ€ actor Robert Picardo. Photos of the nuptials were taken by former White House photographer Pete Souza. The couple wrote their own vows, which one attendee described as â€œequal parts moving and comical.â€ Mundy, a former Washington Post reporter, mentioned Nyeâ€™s mother, cryptanalyst Jacqueline Jenkins-Nye, in her 2017 book, â€œCode Girls: The Untold Story of the American Women Code Breakers of World War II.â€ Nye emailed Mundy following the release of the book, and the two began dating shortly afterward. The pair have kept their relationship mostly private. Last week, they attended the premiere of Nyeâ€™s new Peacock series, â€œThe End Is Nye,â€ at the 2022 Tribeca Film Festival in New York. And in March, Mundy was by Nyeâ€™s side at the Captain Planet Foundationâ€™s 30th anniversary gala, a nonprofit organization in Atlanta. â€œThe End Is Nyeâ€ due out Aug. 25, will feature Nye as he explores â€œthe most epic global disasters imaginable â€• both natural and unnatural â€• and then demystifies them using science to show how we can survive, mitigate, and even prevent them,â€ according to press notes. The six-episode series will include guest appearances by Seth MacFarlane, who is also an executive producer. Senior Culture Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Elliot Page Says Life Has 'Drastically' Improved Since Coming Out As Trans
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost Life has only gotten better for Elliot Page since coming out as transgender. The â€œUmbrella Academyâ€ star opened up about feeling a â€œdegree of joyâ€ he never thought possible on Tuesdayâ€™s episode of â€œLate Night With Seth Meyers,â€ sharing that heâ€™s learned to tune out peopleâ€™s negative reactions. â€œItâ€™s improved my life drastically,â€ Page said about transitioning. â€œI hope, you know, I hope maybe people who do have an issue with me can maybe try and hear that, or embrace that on some level.â€ â€œWhat I want to focus on right now and has been so extraordinary is the degree of joy that I feel, the degree of presence that I feel,â€ he added. â€œI feel a way that I really never thought possible for a long, long time.â€ While Pageâ€™s loved ones have been supportive, the actor has previously spoken about the â€œhatred and crueltyâ€ heâ€™s received since publicly disclosing that he is a transgender man in late 2020, including being verbally accosted by a stranger on the street. Page said certain â€œmoments can be overwhelming,â€ but heâ€™s choosing to concentrate on the positive, despite the spate of anti-trans bills that are rolling out across the nation. â€œI feel like itâ€™s one of those things where itâ€™s so unfortunate because itâ€™s like, weâ€™re all on the same team here, you know?â€ he told Meyers, adding that everybody faces â€œlimits and constraints because of peopleâ€™s obsession with the binaryâ€ regardless of their gender identity. The actor added, â€œTo me, itâ€™d be so special for us to all be able to connect and talk about how similar we are in all of our journeys.â€ Ultimately, Page said transitioning â€œmade me betterâ€ both as a person and as an actor. Mirroring Pageâ€™s own real-life experience, his character on Netflixâ€™s superhero series â€œUmbrella Academy,â€ who previously presented as female, comes out as transgender in the new season, which premiered on Wednesday. The characterâ€™s transition has drawn praise from fans and critics alike with Page explaining that showrunner Steve Blackman was â€œreally excited about incorporating it into the showâ€ and remarking that he feels â€œproud of it and excited for people to see it.â€ â€œItâ€™s a beautiful thing to experience now,â€ Page said. â€œBecause a lot of the time my life was just trying to move forward, so getting to embrace the experience as much as I get to now, I think itâ€™s made me better in so many facets. As a person, as a friend, relationships.â€ Page plans to release a memoir next year about his journey. Senior Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Herschel Walker Says There Are 52 States
content:
Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost There are 50 states in the United States of America. But in an interview Tuesday, Georgia GOP Senate candidate Herschel Walker said there were 52. Walker was going after Stacey Abrams, the Democratic candidate for governor, for recently saying, â€œI am tired of hearing about [Georgia] being the best state in the country to do business when we are the worst state in the country to live.â€ Abrams cited the stateâ€™s problems with mental health treatment, maternal mortality, incarceration rates and wages. Republicans seized upon the remark and used it to criticize her, although Abrams said she stood by her belief that Republican Brian Kemp is â€œa failed governor, who doesnâ€™t care about the people of Georgia.â€ In an interview Tuesday with the Clay Travis and Buck Sexton Show, Walker said Abrams should go live in another state â€• saying she had 51 others from which to choose. â€œIf you donâ€™t believe in the country, leave and go somewhere else,â€ he said. â€œIf itâ€™s the worst state, why are you here? Why donâ€™t you leave â€• go to another? Thereâ€™s, what, 51 more other states that you can go to?â€ â€œHerschel misspoke â€• he obviously knows there are 50 states,â€ spokeswoman Mallory Blount told HuffPost. Walker is a former NFL star whose campaign has been filled with controversies and misstatements. He has faced domestic violence allegations, and recently, claims of being an absent father. Walker has talked frequently about his 22-year-old son Christian and railed against fatherless homes. But The Daily Beast reported that Walker actually has three other children he doesnâ€™t talk about publicly. He has since acknowledged his four children, saying he â€œnever denied any of my kids.â€ Walker has also said heâ€™s skeptical of evolution, pointing to the fact that apes and humans coexist. â€œAt one time, science said man came from apes, did it not? ... If that is true, why are there still apes? Think about it,â€ Walker said in March. After the massacre in Uvalde, Texas, Walker called for â€œa department that can look at young men thatâ€™s looking at women thatâ€™s looking at social media,â€ as a solution to curb school shootings, but it was not clear what that was or how it would solve the problem. In 2008, then-candidate Barack Obama also misspoke on the number of states. â€œIt is wonderful to be back in Oregon,â€ Obama said. â€œOver the last 15 months, weâ€™ve traveled to every corner of the United States. Iâ€™ve now been in 57 states? I think one left to go. Alaska and Hawaii, I was not allowed to go to even though I really wanted to visit, but my staff would not justify it.â€ He later said it was â€œa sign that my numeracy is getting a little, uh â€•â€ before an aide cut him off. Some on took this comment as further proof of the birther conspiracy, claiming that he was actually referencing Muslim countries. Washington Bureau Chief, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Eric Swalwell Shares Recording Of Death Threat After Marjorie Taylor Greene Attack
content:
Senior Reporter, HuffPost Rep. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) shared an audio recording of a disturbing threat Wednesday that he said he received because of false statements made by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.). â€œMarjorie loves to play the victim. But sheâ€™s an inciter of violence. Her constant attacks â€” even after the FBI said I was never suspected of wrongdoing â€” lead to threatening calls like this,â€ he tweeted alongside the audio clip. â€œThis caller from today threatened to kill my three children.â€ In the recording, a manâ€™s voice said: â€œHey, you little cocksucker. You still banging the Chinese spy Fang Fang? ... Weâ€™re coming to your house this weekend. Gonâ€™ get you and them little mutant bastards, them little mutant offspring of yours. Weâ€™re gonâ€™ get ya.â€ Earlier Wednesday, Swalwell had shared a story about an interaction with a supporter of former President Donald Trump that happened while the congressman was giving a tour of the U.S. Capitol. He said a man shouted at him and then told his son, â€œThatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ Today I gave a tour in the Capitol and was stopped by a father with his young boy. The father yelled at me â€œHey Swalwellâ€ and then told his son, â€œthatâ€™s Swalwell. Heâ€™s trouble. He doesnâ€™t back Trump.â€ I kept walking and felt sad for the boy. Heâ€™s being raised in a cult family. Greene responded to the tweet by saying there was â€œno way that happened.â€ â€œBecause we all know good Trump supporting fathers would say, â€œthatâ€™s the Democrat who had sex with a Chinese spy,â€ she tweeted. Swalwell has been targeted by right-wing disinformation over his past connection to a suspected Chinese intelligence operative named Fang Fang or Christine Fang. According to a 2020 Axios report, Fang targeted up-and-coming politicians in the Bay Area and the U.S., including Swalwell. Fang reportedly took part in fundraising activity for Swalwellâ€™s 2014 reelection campaign and recommended an intern for his office. Federal investigators said they alerted Swalwell to their concerns in 2015 and he immediately cut all ties with Fang, Axios reported. He was not accused of any wrongdoing or of passing on any classified intelligence. Fang allegedly had sexual relationships with at least two Midwestern mayors. Swalwell was not accused of having sex with her. Senior Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Arkansasâ€™ Israel Boycott Pledge Law Upheld By Appeals Court
content:
LITTLE ROCK, Ark. (AP) â€” A federal appeals court on Wednesday upheld Arkansasâ€™ law requiring state contractors to pledge not to boycott Israel, finding the restriction is not an unconstitutional violation of free speech. The full 8th Circuit U.S. Court of Appeals reversed a 2-1 decision last year by a three-judge panel of the court that found the requirement to be unconstitutional. The Arkansas Times had sued to block the law, which requires contractors with the state to reduce their fees by 20% if they donâ€™t sign the pledge. â€œ(The law) only prohibits economic decisions that discriminate against Israel,â€ Judge Jonathan Kobes wrote in the courtâ€™s opinion. â€œBecause those commercial decisions are invisible to observers unless explained, they are not inherently expressive and do not implicate the First Amendment.â€ A federal judge in 2019 dismissed the Timesâ€™ lawsuit, ruling that the boycotts are not protected by the First Amendment. A three-judge panel of the appeals court reversed that ruling, and the state appealed to the full appeals court. The American Civil Liberties Union, which represented the Times, said it planned to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court. â€œWe hope and expect that the Supreme Court will set things right and reaffirm the nationâ€™s historic commitment to providing robust protection to political boycotts,â€ Brian Hauss, senior staff attorney for the ACLU Foundationâ€™s Speech, Privacy & Technology Project, said in a statement. The new ruling didnâ€™t give a breakdown of how judges decided, but at least one dissented, saying the law is written so broadly that it could go beyond boycotts. â€œOne could imagine a company posting anti-Israel signs, donating to causes that promote a boycott of Israel, encouraging others to boycott Israel, or even publicly criticizing the act with the intent to â€˜limit commercial relations with Israelâ€™ as a general matter,â€ Judge Jane Kelly wrote in her dissent. â€œAnd any of that conduct would arguably fall within the prohibition.â€ The Timesâ€™ lawsuit said the University of Arkansas Pulaski Technical College refused to contract for advertising with the newspaper unless the paper signed the pledge. The newspaper isnâ€™t engaged in a boycott against Israel. â€œToday is a resounding victory for Arkansasâ€™s anti-discrimination law and reinforces Arkansasâ€™s relationship with our long-time ally, Israel,â€ Republican Attorney General Leslie Rutledge, whose office defended the law, said in a statement. Republican legislators in Arkansas who drafted the 2017 law have said it wasnâ€™t prompted by a specific incident in the state. It followed similar restrictions enacted by other states in response to a movement promoting boycotts, divestment and sanctions of Israeli institutions and businesses over the countryâ€™s treatment of Palestinians. Israeli officials say the campaign masks a deeper goal of delegitimizing and even destroying the country. Similar measures in Arizona, Kansas and Texas that were blocked were later allowed to be enforced after lawmakers narrowed the requirement so it applied only to larger contracts. Arkansasâ€™ law applies to contracts worth $1,000 or more. Citing its anti-boycott law, Arizona last year sold off millions of dollars in Unilever bonds over subsidiary Ben & Jerryâ€™s decision to stop selling its ice cream in Israeli-occupied territories. Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Former NFL Star Tony Siragusa Dies
content: Tony Siragusa, the charismatic defensive tackle who helped lead a stout Baltimore defense to a Super Bowl title, has died. He was 55. Siragusaâ€™s broadcast agent, Jim Ornstein, confirmed the death Wednesday. The cause of death was not immediately available. â€œThis is a really sad day,â€ he said. â€œTony was way more than my client, he was family. My heart goes out to Tonyâ€™s loved ones.â€ Siragusa, known as â€œthe Goose,â€ played seven seasons with the Indianapolis Colts and five with the Ravens. Baltimoreâ€™s 2000 team won the Super Bowl behind a defense that included Siragusa, Ray Lewis and Sam Adams. The Goose,Tony Siracusa has passed away at 55.. Iâ€™m heart broken as is all of Colts Nationâ¤ï¸ğŸ™ğŸ¼ğŸˆ Siragusa was popular with fans because of his fun-loving personality, which also helped him transition quickly to broadcasting after his playing career. Siragusa came to Baltimore as a free agent in 1997 and teamed up with Adams to form an imposing defensive tackle tandem. In the Ravensâ€™ 2000 championship season, the 6-foot-3, 340-pound Siragusa was sixth among Baltimore defenders with 75 tackles. He finished his career with 22 sacks. The news of Siragusaâ€™s death came on what was already a tragic day for the Ravens. The death of Jaylon Ferguson, a linebacker for Baltimore, at age 26 was announced earlier in the day.

topic: Sen. Ron Johnson Caught Faking Phone Call To Avoid Fake Elector Questions
content:
National Reporter, HuffPost Facing searing questions about the revelation he tried to give false election documents to then-Vice President Mike Pence, Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wis.) opted to fake a phone call. He got caught doing that, too. NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V spotted the Wisconsin Republican as he left the Capitol building Tuesday. Earlier that day, the House committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol aired damning texts sent by Johnsonâ€™s chief of staff, Sean Riley, to a Pence staffer saying the senator wanted to hand the vice president an â€[a]lternate slate of electorsâ€ â€• the fake election documents used to push the idea that former President Donald Trump won in states he actually lost. â€œHow much did you know about what your chief of staff was doing with the alternate slates of electors?â€ Thorp asked Johnson, as captured in a video of the encounter. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, pointing to the device and dismissively waving Thorp away. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ Thorp replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Sen. Ron Johnson so much didn't want to talk to reporters about his office trying to pass fake elector lists to the vice president's office that he tried to pretend he was on the phone. pic.twitter.com/V1VwBDs42t Caught in the act, Johnson nevertheless continued the ruse, holding the phone to his ear in a one-sided, silent conversation with no one. After 30 awkward seconds, the senator put his phone down â€• still having not uttered a word into it â€• to tell reporters the apparent bombshell is â€œa complete non-story.â€ â€œI donâ€™t know what youâ€™re even concerned about here,â€ he said. Johnson denied any knowledge of what transpired between his chief of staff and Mike Penceâ€™s staff, saying he had no idea the falsified election documents had â€œeven been delivered to us.â€ National Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Chasten Buttigieg Slams Lauren Boebert After She Sends 'Gratitude' To 'All' Dads
content:
Senior Reporter, HuffPost Chasten Buttigieg, husband of Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, blasted Rep. Lauren Boebert (R-Colo.) for her appreciative Fatherâ€™s Day tweet this week, noting that she once criticized his husband for taking paternity leave to be with his sick newborn. â€œOur two-month-old son was on a ventilator at the childrenâ€™s hospital when you attacked my husband for being with his family,â€ Chasten Buttigieg tweeted Wednesday. â€œI watched him take calls and Zooms from our hospital room all day, managing crisis after crisis while our sonâ€™s heart monitor beeped in the background.â€ Our two-month-old son was on a ventilator at the children's hospital when you attacked my husband for being with his family. I watched him take calls and Zooms from our hospital room all day, managing crisis after crisis while our son's heart monitor beeped in the background. pic.twitter.com/zRkLiAANgV In November, Boebert hurled a homophobic attack at the transportation secretary for taking time off to be with his newborn twins, saying he was unavailable to deal with the supply-chain crisis because he was â€œstill at home trying to figure out how to chest feed.â€ She also boasted on another occasion that she had given birth in her truck and that â€œainâ€™t nobody got timeâ€ for parental leave. But this Fatherâ€™s Day, Boebert tweeted that â€œthe role of the father is absolutely fundamental to the family and to society as a whole.â€ â€œI want to send out a shoutout of gratitude to all of the dads across America!â€ she wrote. Boebert was among a chorus of right-wing criticism against Buttigieg for taking paid time off to care for his babies. Conservatives claimed he was shirking his Cabinet duties, even though Buttigieg said at the time he was still â€œavailable 24/7 on issues that canâ€™t wait, issues that canâ€™t be delegated and major decisions,â€ such as the supply-chain issue. The Buttigiegs welcomed twins Joseph August (Gus) and Penelope Rose in the summer. Chasten Buttigieg revealed in early November that â€œAfter 3 weeks in and out of hospitals, 125 miles in an ambulance, and a terrifying week on a ventilator, Gus is home, smiling, and doing great!â€ A post shared by Chasten Buttigieg (@chasten.buttigieg) Senior Reporter, HuffPost Do you have information you want to share with HuffPost? 
    Hereâ€™s how.

topic: Watch Lebanese Dance Troupe Unleash The Artistry of Arab Women On 'AGT'
content: General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost The Mayyas dance troupe set out to â€œprove to the world what Arab women can do, the arts we can create,â€ one member said on Tuesdayâ€™s â€œAmericaâ€™s Got Talent.â€ (Watch the video below.) Mission accomplished. The Lebanese troupe amazed the panelists and audience with coordinated arm movements that generated a kaleidoscopic vibe and a creature-like illusion. The routine delivered on Mayyasâ€™ promise to â€œhypnotize.â€ The same performer said earlier in the segment that â€œbeing a dancer as a female Arab is not fully supported yetâ€ â€• but Simon Cowell said the groupâ€™s performance will make a difference. He called them â€œarguably the best dance act.â€ Judge Sofia Vergara gave perhaps the highest compliment, pushing the Golden Buzzer to vault the team to the live rounds. The former â€œModern Familyâ€ star told the group she was â€œso honored to empower you even more.â€ General Assignment Reporter, HuffPost

topic: â€˜Jimmy Kimmelâ€™ Host Sean Hayes Spots GOP Lawmakerâ€™s Most Awkward Moment Yet
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Sean Hayes, filling in for Jimmy Kimmel this week, spotted a truly awkward moment earlier in the week. It was a strange attempt Tuesday by Sen. Ron Johnson (R-Wisc.) to duck the press by fielding a fake phone call. Johnson was attempting to avoid questions about his role in a scheme to give then-Vice President Mike Pence a slate of fake electors ahead of the congressional certification of the 2020 presidential election. â€œIâ€™m on the phone right now,â€ Johnson said, cellphone to his ear as he walked quickly. â€œNo youâ€™re not,â€ NBC News reporter Frank Thorp V replied. â€œI can see your phone. I can see your screen.â€ Hayes laughed at the footage. â€œOnce again, Ronâ€™s caught with his Johnson in his hand,â€ he cracked. Hayes offered a free lesson in how itâ€™s really done: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Christian Bale Didnâ€™t Know What The MCU Was Before 'Thor: Love And Thunder'
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Actor Christian Bale was unaware he had entered any kind of â€œcinematic universeâ€ when he joined the cast of Marvelâ€™s â€œThor: Love And Thunder.â€ The actor â€” who played Gothamâ€™s caped crusader in the â€œDark Knightâ€ trilogy â€” recently told Total Film he didnâ€™t even know what the acronym â€œMCUâ€ (Marvel Cinematic Universe) stood for before he ditched DC Comics for the opposing multiverse. â€œIâ€™d read that, and people would go, â€˜Oh, look at this! Heâ€™s entered the MCU!â€™ And Iâ€™d go, â€˜Iâ€™ve done what? I havenâ€™t entered shit, thank you very much,â€™â€ Bale said. â€œIâ€™m like, â€˜The MCU?â€™ I had to ask what that was.â€ The Oscar-winner also recounted the hilarious moment he learned about his character, Gorr the God Butcher, a sinister Marvel supervillain he didnâ€™t even know existed. â€œI did make the mistake of Googling [Gorr] and, oh no! [In the comics,] he runs around in a G-string all the time,â€ Bale told Total Film. He added: â€œAnd I thought, â€˜They donâ€™t have the right man for that!â€™ And then [director Taika Waititi] quickly dispelled any notions of running around in that.â€ Christian Bale on researching for #Gorr:I know what he does. It's right there in the name, isn't it? But I did make the mistake of Googling him and, oh no! [In the comics] he runs around in a G-string all the time, and I thought, 'They don't have the right man for that!â€™ pic.twitter.com/nGs3EDWS5a Asked if he had any reservations about portraying another comic book character after playing Batman to critical acclaim, Bale rapidly banished the notion. â€œAbsolutely not, no. That didnâ€™t even enter into my head at all,â€ he said. The Method actor also shared that he and Waititi had discussed making the character less serious and that heâ€™d wanted to add a dance sequence inspired by singer Kate Bush, who recently enjoyed a resurgence in â€œStranger Things.â€ â€œThereâ€™s obviously sort of a â€˜Nosferatuâ€™ slight attitude,â€ Bale said. â€œTaika and I wanted to do a whole dance, which we didnâ€™t get to do, but we had all this sort of Kate Bush stuff that we worked at. But I think he just realized he was never going to be allowed to put that in the final film.â€ â€œThor: Love And Thunder,â€ the fourth installment of the â€œThorâ€ franchise, is set to hit theaters on July 8. Watch the latest trailer below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Tom Hanks Reveals Why He Canâ€™t Stop Crashing His Fansâ€™ Weddings
content: Trends Reporter, HuffPost Tom Hanks shared on Tuesdayâ€™s â€œLate Night with Seth Meyersâ€ why in recent years heâ€™s become a serial wedding crasher at his fansâ€™ weddings, whether heâ€™s â€œinvited or not.â€ The â€œElvisâ€ actor, who loves to hilariously photobomb his supporters on their big day, revealed why he has a passion for wedding crashing. â€œItâ€™s my ego, unchecked,â€ Hanks said jokingly. He added: â€œI just canâ€™t help but think, â€˜What would these people like more than anything else to remember this magic day of days? Oh, I know, me!â€™â€ In March, Hanks stunned a bride when he united with her bridal party outside of a hotel in downtown Pittsburgh to take photos. The group was preparing to leave the venue when the longtime actor pulled up to join in on the snapshot session. The bride, Grace Gwaltney, shared that she was blown away to see the star. â€œHe was like, â€˜Hey! Iâ€™m Tom Hanks. I would love to get a photo with you,â€™ and I immediately froze and was just looking around,â€ Gwaltney told KCRA at the time. â€œI didnâ€™t know what to do.â€ Hanks, who was declared a â€œman of many hatsâ€ by the showâ€™s host, has crashed so many weddings that Meyers showcased the actorâ€™s best wedding-crasher moments during the episode, with some clips even dating back to the early 2000s. The movie heavyweight also explained the time he took his affinity for wedding crashing internationally, after he stumbled upon a brideâ€™s wedding while filming 2009â€™s â€œAngels and Demonsâ€ in Rome. Hanks told Meyers that the set crew wasnâ€™t privy that a wedding party had booked the venue they were filming in, the Pantheon, on the same day. â€œThis limousine pulled up, and it was the bride and the groom trying to â€˜get me to the church on time,â€™â€ Hanks said. â€œAnd they couldnâ€™t do it because we had all this stuff going on.â€ â€œIt was like â€˜Uh, how do we fix this?â€™ So, like a stalker â€” you know, â€˜Hey miss, miss, miss!â€™ â€” I knocked on the window, I said â€˜Hey listen, we have a thing, but would you do me the honor of escorting you to your bridal altar?â€™ So we did it!â€ the actor recalled. Hanks then joked to Meyers that the couple may not have initially recognized him at the time due to his â€œchemically straightened hair,â€ he said, pointing to his hairstyle in the throwback photo from the ceremony. â€œI donâ€™t like to think I crashed a wedding. I provided a service,â€ the leading man added. â€œElvis,â€ in which Hanks plays manager to the rock â€˜nâ€™ roll icon, hits theaters on Friday. Watch the trailer below. Trends Reporter, HuffPost

topic: Stephen Colbert Names The 'Dumbest Person Ever To Sit In The United States Senate'
content: Overnight Editor, HuffPost Stephen Colbert gave one U.S. lawmaker a scathing new distinction on Wednesday. â€œMost historians agree: Ron Johnson is the dumbest person ever to sit in the United States Senate,â€ Colbert declared on â€œThe Late Show.â€ Newly revealed text messages showed the Wisconsin Republicanâ€™s chief of staff tried to arrange a meeting in which Johnson would hand-deliver a slate of fake electors to then-Vice President Mike Pence. Penceâ€™s office declined. This week, Johnson claimed â€œsome staff internâ€ wanted an envelope delivered to the vice president and his office tried to arrange it but he didnâ€™t know who sent it or what it was, according to The Washington Post. Colbert was incredulous: â€œSo, he has no idea where it came from, no idea who gave it to them, no idea what it is, but he canâ€™t wait to hand-deliver it to the second-in-command. There couldâ€™ve been anything in that envelope, he doesnâ€™t care: fake electors, angry bees, naked pictures of Mary Todd Lincoln. It donâ€™t matter to Ron! Heâ€™s just a delivery boy.â€ Colbert also said this situation answered a question heâ€™d always had. â€œYou know those announcements in the airport when they say, â€˜Do not carry onto the flight a package for someone you donâ€™t knowâ€™? Iâ€™ve always wondered who those announcements are for,â€ he said. â€œTurns out itâ€™s Ron Johnson.â€ See his full takedown below: Overnight Editor, HuffPost

topic: Brad Pitt Gets Conned Into Hunting For Fake Buried Treasure At His French Mansion
content: Senior Reporter, HuffPost In a stunning rebuke of todayâ€™s relatable celebrity culture, Brad Pitt revealed he spent a year hunting for buried medieval treasure that never existed beneath his French estate. Yes, for some reason the Oscar winner chose to come clean about getting swindled by an unnamed man who convinced him that the property he once shared with ex-wife Angelina Jolie was even more valuable than the estimated $60 million the former couple forked over for it back in 2008. Speaking with GQ in a profile published on Wednesday, Pitt said he was told that there were â€œmillions of dollars worth of goldâ€ left by the villaâ€™s medieval owners that had been â€œtaken from the Levant during the Crusades and buried on the grounds.â€ â€œI got obsessed,â€ said Pitt, who acquired radar equipment to hunt for the loot. â€œLike for a year, this was all I could think about, just the excitement of it all. Maybe it has something to do with where I grew up, because in the Ozark Mountainsâ€ near his childhood home in Missouri, â€œthere were always stories of hidden caches of gold.â€ Ultimately, Pitt came up empty, and it was revealed that the man had targeted him as a potential investor in a radar company and (successfully) pitched the prospect of undiscovered riches to dupe the actor. Pitt said the ordeal left him feeling â€œpretty foolish in the end.â€ â€œIt was just the hunt that was exciting,â€ he remarked. Despite the slightly embarrassing admission, there are grounds to believe buried treasure may lay beneath the historic villa. Pittâ€™s ChÃ¢teau Miraval sits along an ancient Roman trade route and contains a sprawling estate and various structures, including the 13th-century chapel where he and Jolie wed. The chÃ¢teau and its award-winning wine from the propertyâ€™s vineyards have since become a major source of contention in the former coupleâ€™s ongoing divorce battle. After Jolie sold her stake in the business last year to Russian billionaire Yuri Shefler, Pitt sued her in February, claiming she unlawfully disregarded their agreement never to sell their shares without the otherâ€™s permission. In a filing from Pittâ€™s legal team earlier this month, the actor claims Jolie â€œsought to inflict harm onâ€ him by forcing him to partner with â€œa stranger with poisonous associations and intentionsâ€ who plans to launch a â€œhostileâ€ takeover of the business. Jolie hasnâ€™t commented on Pittâ€™s allegations or his hunt for fake treasure. Senior Reporter, HuffPost
